story:
**UPDATE**

To all of those who have already contributed: Thank you so much! 

I'm adding a +$10 feature to get hardcover books. Those who have professed their love via "I Want Your Art Babies" get this upgrade free. :D


Also, the pages are well over 100, now. Just forewarning you!

 

Who is "Em²a Cartoon"?

Hi! My name is Emma Lysyk. I draw a slice of life/art journal webcomic called Em²a Cartoon, that can be found at EmaCartoon.com. Em²a started as a way for me to illustrate my thoughts and feelings in place of a diary. I am a magnet for strange happenings, and I get wild and crazy ideas. My friends wanted a place to keep up with me after all my moves, so I created EmaCartoon.com to share with the world what life with a crazy artist is like.

The key players in my comic are Em²a, my inner redhead; Orion, my imaginary boyfriend; Mandy, my kick-ass bff roommate; Mikey, my goofy awesome roommate; our cats - Yin, Yang, Sheba, Sam, and Ash; and our dogs - Sonny, Breic, and Jesse (who recently passed away).

 

The Em²a Cartoon World of Art

Oh my gosh! Em²a Cartoon has been online for 10 years (and even longer offline). To celebrate, I think we should make a book!

You've been asking, and now I'm making it happen. There’s so much of my art that I have doodled all over the place, never making it up on the interwebs, and collecting dust in my art folder of doom. I’ve been meaning to do this for ages, and can’t think of a better time or method how.

 

What You Get

The Em²a Cartoon World of Art will be a 9” wide x 7” tall landscape 100-page paperback book with glossy pages featuring both the published and never-before-seen art of the Em²a Cartoon world. Inside you’ll find sketches, paintings, character studies, and animal pictures galore, as well as every comic from the beginning through April 30, 2013.

The digital version will be a 150dpi PDF version so you can print it out at home. Delivery method depends on the size.

Pick-up will also be available at my Phoenix ComiCon booth 1843 during the Exibitor Hall hours.

Even if I don't make the full amount - if you purchase a book, you will get a book.

FAQs

Why do you need so much money?

Nobody likes asking for money. But the fact of the matter is, I can't afford to buy a ton of books with no guarantee that they would sell and end up with a huge pile of books in my studio room. With my recent surgery, vet bills, and laptop death, I need you guys to tell me if this is something you want. And let’s face it, money talks.

The funds will go towards:

  • The costs of producing paperback books,
  • A replacement laptop since mine ate the dust,
  • A much-needed software upgrade, and
  • Whatever's left will go towards various local pet rescue groups.

I have no money! How can I help?

Spread the word! Let everyone know about this campaign and/or my webcomic. Mention it on Twitter or Facebook or wherever people congregate on the internet nowadays.

Will the books be available anywhere else?

Nope. Well, not planning on it. The book will be a LIMITED EDITION run. I will order all the books (plus just a few extra for friends, family, and safe keepings) if and once the goal is reached and will not have a second print. If you guys beg and plead, I might put it up on an on-demand site, but we’ll have to see.

story:
Henriette et Gilbert forment un couple de personnes âgées autonomes qui vivent dans leur bungalow de banlieue. Leur maison est remplie d’objets disparates et de meubles tout droit sortis des années 70. Bien que les amoureux soient intéressés par l’actualité et l’évolution de la société, l'ascension fulgurante de la technologie les dépasse. Ils tentent tant bien que mal de suivre la tendance pour rester dans le coup, ce qui provoque plusieurs situations loufoques... Et pourtant, ils ne s'en rendent pas toujours compte ! 

Henriette, 74 ans.
Très germaine, c’est une femme fière et encore en forme. Cheveux blancs, pomettes roses, elle incarne la parfaite grand-mère. Elle « gère » son mari qu’elle aime depuis toujours. Son style trahit son attachement pour les années 50 à 80. Elle parle fort, rit beaucoup et adore parler au téléphone. Bien qu’elle semble autoritaire, c’est une femme sensible et anxieuse qui s’inquiète pour tous ceux qu’elle aime... c’est-à-dire tout le monde!

Gilbert, 83 ans.
Homme tranquille, mais très amoureux de sa femme depuis plus de cinquante ans. Il est légèrement bedonnant, porte des lunettes usées et peigne ses sept cheveux sur le côté. Il est cardiaque, fumeur occasionnel et légèrement sourd. C’est un bon vivant qui aime travailler dans son cabanon, boire un verre de temps en temps et jouer aux cartes. Il a du plaisir avec tous ceux qu’il croise et ne s’en fait pas avec la vie. Bien qu’il semble parfois blasé, il ferait tout pour le bonheur de son entourage.

L’objectif du projet Les Dépassés est de mettre l’accent sur les différences
générationnelles en lien avec la technologie. Nombreux sont ceux qui constatent ces différences, mais peu de gens se permettent d’en rire de bon coeur.

Le projet se présente en deux déclinaisons. La première est une bande dessinée mettant en vedette les personnages Henriette et Gilbert. La BD permettra une diffusion dans le domaine culturel grâce au support papier. Ainsi, les personnages se tailleront une place dans l’univers littéraire. De cette bande dessinée naîtra la seconde déclinaison du projet : la websérie.
Chaque épisode sera une adaptation d’une péripétie de la bande dessinée. La
première saison prévoit 6 épisodes d'environ 5 minutes.

Empreintes d’un ton absurde, la BD et la websérie permettront à tous de se reconnaître dans l’une ou l’autre des situations présentées. Évidemment, il ne s’agit pas d’un prétexte pour se moquer des aînés. Au contraire, leur sagesse par rapport à la technologie et leurs expériences de vie seront au coeur du propos. La série s’adressera donc à tous et réunira les générations en permettant des discussions autour des phénomènes technologiques.

Ayant étudié en littératures de la langue française à l'Université de Montréal et travaillé dans le milieu des communications comme graphiste/illustratrice pour plusieurs projets, Sévrine Dumais est toute désignée pour faire du projet un chef d'oeuvre.

Parmi ses expériences de travail, notons ses rôles de rédactrice et graphiste pour Les Projets de la Meute, compagnie de théâtre, et de collaboratrice pour le blogue Ton Petit Look.

Sachant jouer avec les mots et ayant un grand sens de l'humour, elle saura captiver ses lecteurs et «webspectateurs» en relatant des situations cocasses dans lesquelles vous pourriez tous vous reconnaître.

Diplômé du Conservatoire d'art dramatique de Montréal, Bernard Fortin est un acteur et doubleur québécois. Parmi ses réalisations, on note le personnage de Rod dans La Petite Vie et de Pierre Lavoie dans Providence.

En plus de prêter sa voix à l'acteur américain Tom Hanks depuis 1988, il double de nombreux personnages de séries animées telles que Les Simpsons, plus précisément le Chef Wiggum, Ned Flanders et Timothy Lovejoy.

Homme de théâtre, il joue cette année dans la pièce Boeing Boeing produite par Les Projets de la Meute.

Son expérience du milieu des arts et de la culture, jumelée à son grand sens de l'humour permettra sans aucun doute au projet Les Dépassés de briller au Québec.

La campagne de financement participatif permettra de financer l'impression de la bande dessinée et la préparation de la websérie (fabrication des décors, formation de l'équipe technique et approche de vos acteurs préférés).

En contribuant au projet, vous recevrez un ou plusieurs produits dérivés Les Dépassés. 

En achetant une contrepartie comprenant la bande dessinée édition limitée (35$ et +), vous recevrez une invitation VIP au lancement officiel de la BD.

Merci à tous ceux qui nous encouragent dans ce beau projet. Vos dons sont très appréciés, et vous serez fiers d'avoir rendu ce projet possible lorsque vous verrez le résultat.

De notre côté, nous sommes très fiers de vous compter parmi Les Dépassés!

N'oubliez pas de nous suivre sur Facebook et Instagram @lesdepasses !

story:
Thanks to you, the backers, CYBERFROG: BLOODHONEY is the HOTTEST COMIC of 2019!

 

I'm hard at work on the sequel, CYBERFROG: REKT PLANET, which will be even better!  I put my heart into my comics, and I hope it shows.  

I'd like to offer you the chance to acquire this new set of collectible Cyberfrog coins, a JFK silver fifty cent piece with a hi-tech art overlay of your friends from CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY!  There are six to collect!

Silver Coins: 2019 JFK Half Dollars straight from the mint, which are not available at any bank or in circulation. 

Gold Coins: 24K Gold Plated

The Art Process Official Term: Colorization Infused Legal Tender Coins - Colorizing coins involves the application of special inks directly to the surface of a coin using a unique multi-color printing process. The result is an everlasting colorized coin collectible of ultra-high quality. We are using America’s largest manufacturer and the creators of both colorized U.S. coins. This colorizing process achieves a level of detail, color saturation, and durability that is #1 in the industry.

Here's a COMPLETE SET OF GOLD CYBERFROG Coins! They'll come packed in this attractive box complete with Certificates of Authenticity!

 

Let's take a look at these coins!

 

Pretty GREAT, right?  So what are you waiting for?  Back today, and reserve your CYBERFROG Collectible Coins now!

story:
GLAXIAL: FREAK OR GOD #1 IS A 36 PAGES BOOK!

 

Here's how Glaxial #1 looks like! (Preview without Dialogue, we don't want to spoil you!):

Has you understand by this preview a major part of issue #1 is about Kralex meeting (Fighting with) Doug! You feel the rivality? We hope so because there's one! CHOOSE YOUR SIDE! Kralex or Doug?

Glaxial was initially funded on Kickstarter on June 4th with 11 346$ on a 2 500$ funding Goal supported by 494 Backers. Now, 3 month later the book is nearly finished. We thought it was finally time, to open the PRE-ORDERS HERE! WE SHIP IN NOVEMBER!

HERE'S THE COVER:

The WRAP edition never been offer before the INDIEGOGO INDEMAND CAMPAIGN.

You are the first one to get it!

story:
READ ISSUE #1 FOR FREE

CLICK THE LOGO ABOVE!

The COVERS for Issue #3

SOMETHING exists -- but is it REAL? 

A small town family is being haunted. The monster from underneath your bed wants their kid. Its mission is simple: craft a new world from the imaginations of brilliantly gifted children. The kid in question, a young boy named Phillip Hasten, is the ultimate example of an extraordinary young mind. Phillip's untested mental capabilities have made him the boogeyman's prime target since conception...

The events that follow will change the Hasten family forever. Will they end the boogeyman's reign and finally break the curse -- or will it's hunger for power result in our ultimate demise?

We've now conducted 2 successfully crowdfunded campaigns -- one with Kickstarter and the most recent with Indiegogo. We've learned an awful lot and are constantly applying what we've learned to subsequent campaigns. Our main goal is to provide a quality book at an affordable price for all those who are willing to give our comics a chance.

Backers make these books possible and for that we are extremely appreciative. Thank you for supporting an evergrowing community of amazingly talented indie creators.

story:
Hello! This is José Villena and David Tomaselli, the creators of the "Onion & Pea" comic strips. We are here to promote our first book, “Onion & Pea: The Adventures of the Nuclear Onion and the Atomic Pea”. A full-color, 160-page paperback with 300 comic strips, extra drawings and comments by the authors. The book is suitable for all ages and will be published in two versions, English and Spanish.

It has taken us four years to put our very first book together, and we can’t express in words how much love and hard work has gone into it. We don’t want it to be just a book of comic strips; we want it to be a comic book that you can enjoy every time you read it.

Now we need your help and support to turn this comic strip into a real book that you can finally hold in your hands.

About Onion & Pea 

“Leo was a normal boy with a normal life until two large, costumed vegetable superheroes showed up: Onion and Pea! Now nothing will ever be normal again." 

”Onion & Pea” is a series of comic strips very much like the classics you see in the newspaper (Peanuts, Garfield, Calvin & Hobbes...), but at the same time we were aiming to push the boundaries a bit by making two vegetables the main characters in the book. We wanted them to show Leo how to see life from another perspective. We don’t just deal with universal subjects like friendship, love or fear; we also want to touch on current topics such as global recession. With “Onion & Pea”, our aim is to create a funny series with cute storylines and positive messages. Once you’ve started reading “Onion & Pea”, you won’t be able to put the book down!

Take a big bite of “Onion & Pea”: it’s not what you’d expect, and it’s really delicious!

 "Onion and Pea" is a great comic strip. It's got everything I look for in a comic; it's very funny, it's beautifully drawn, and it's named after garden vegetables (just like my own comic, "Pickles"). So enjoy "Onion& Pea". It's delicious!
Brian Crane. Creator of the comic strip "Pickles".
--
"Onion & Pea" are two vegetables everyone can love! Villena and Tomaselli have created one of those rare comic strips that combine absolutely beautiful artwork with consistently funny material. I've read a LOT of comic strips in my time and “Onion& Pea” is one of the few I can honestly call one of my favorites!
Chad Carpenter. Tundra Comics.

…You’re going to enjoy "Onion & Pea", it’s delicious.
John Glynn, President at Universal Uclick. 
--
"Onion and Pea" is a wonderful comic strip with funny writing and beautiful artwork—well worth becoming a regular reader of—but Villena and Tomaselli take their eBook collections to rarefied heights. Jam packed with fun extras like CGI animations, games, peeks at the process, author/artist commentary and more, "Onion and Pea" eBooks add even more fun to an already terrific comic strip! Plus, it's healthy snacking!"
Tom Richmond. Cartoonist for MAD Magazine and President of the National Cartoonists Society.

… Theirs is a comic world with talking vegetables that role-play politics, pop culture and puns. Jose & David have crafted a world with no rules or boundaries starring a family that's host to the vegetable equivalents of Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck, but it's a funny world and one worth exploring...
Michael Jantze, Creator of the comic strip "The Norm".  Jantze Studios.

You can see the “Onion & Pea” strips at any of the following websites:
www.onionandpea.com
www.gocomics.com/onion-and-pea
www.facebook.com/onionandpea


We're hoping to raise $5,000 to cover the costs of printing, perks, and fees (Indiegogo, PayPal and banks).

What you get 

Just for checking out our campaign, we’ve prepared a little gift for you - a game for your mobile device!

Download it for free here:
- Apple: https://itunes.apple.com/app/id783580332
- Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.drakharstudio.pearock

Your Impact

Your collaboration is very important to us. “Onion & Pea” is an online comic strip but now, thanks to your help, the very first “Onion & Pea” book will be published in two editions, English and Spanish. Finally you will be able to hold it in your hands and enjoy all the funny, colorful adventures of our little vegetable friends, not forgetting the extra drawings and comments by the authors, in a unique edition that you will have helped to accomplish.

    Risks and Challenges

    The design and layout have already been completed and the book is now ready for printing. A few test copies have been made (you can see them in the video) and we are delighted with the result. We are lucky to have a trusty printing company with many years’ experience, and with the help of family and friends, we will be sending the perks off to you without delay.

    Other Ways to Help

    Even if you cannot make a donation, you can still help us in other ways:

    - By telling your friends about our campaign.

    - By using the Indiegogo tools to share the campaign with your friends on social networks.

    We have prepared a competition to reward those who are most active in sharing our campaign. Click on UPDATES above the video, and look for “Share Onion & Pea Contest”.

    Thank you very much for your support!

and Spanish.

It has taken us four years
to put our very first book together, and we can’t express in words how much
love and hard work has gone into it. We don’t want it to be just a book of
comic strips; we want it to be a comic book that you can enjoy every time you
read it.Now we need your help and support to turn this comic strip
into a real book that you can finally hold in your hands.

About Onion & Pea 


“Leo was a normal
boy with a normal life until two large, costumed vegetable superheroes showed
up: Onion and Pea! Now nothing will ever be normal again." 
”Onion & Pea” is a series of comic strips very much like the classics
you see in the newspaper (Peanuts, Garfield, Calvin & Hobbes...), but at
the same time we were aiming to push the boundaries a bit by making two
vegetables the main characters in the book. We wanted them to show Leo how
to see life from another perspective. We don’t just deal with universal subjects like friendship, love or fear; we also want to touch on current topics such as
global recession. With “Onion & Pea”, our aim is to create a funny series with cute storylines and positive messages. Once you’ve started reading “Onion & Pea”, you won’t be able to put the book down!

Take a big bite of “Onion & Pea”: it’s not what you’d expect, and it’s really delicious!


 "Onion and
Pea" is a great comic strip. It's got everything I look for in a comic;
it's very funny, it's beautifully drawn, and it's named after garden vegetables
(just like my own comic, "Pickles"). So enjoy "Onion&
Pea". It's delicious!Brian Crane. Creator of
the comic strip "Pickles".--"Onion & Pea" are two vegetables everyone can love! Villena and Tomaselli have created one of those rare comic strips that combine absolutely beautiful artwork with consistently funny material. I've read a LOT of comic strips in my time and “Onion& Pea” is one of the few I can honestly call one of my favorites!Chad Carpenter. Tundra Comics. 



…You’re going to enjoy
"Onion & Pea", it’s delicious.John Glynn, President
at Universal Uclick. --"Onion and
Pea" is a wonderful comic strip with funny writing and beautiful artwork—well
worth becoming a regular reader of—but Villena and Tomaselli take their eBook
collections to rarefied heights. Jam packed with fun extras like CGI
animations, games, peeks at the process, author/artist commentary and more,
"Onion and Pea" eBooks add even more fun to an already terrific comic
strip! Plus, it's healthy snacking!"Tom Richmond. Cartoonist
for MAD Magazine and President of the National Cartoonists Society.




… Theirs is a comic
world with talking vegetables that role-play politics, pop culture and puns.
Jose & David have crafted a world with no rules or boundaries starring a
family that's host to the vegetable equivalents of Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck,
but it's a funny world and one worth exploring...Michael Jantze, Creator
of the comic strip "The Norm".  Jantze Studios.



You can see the “Onion
& Pea” strips at any of the following websites:
www.onionandpea.com
www.gocomics.com/onion-and-pea
www.facebook.com/onionandpea
We're hoping to raise $5,000 to cover the costs of
printing, perks, and fees (Indiegogo, PayPal and banks).    

What you get 






























Just
for checking out our campaign, we’ve prepared a little gift for you - a game
for your mobile device!


Download
it for free here: - Apple: https://itunes.apple.com/app/id783580332
- Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.drakharstudio.pearock

Your Impact 
Your collaboration
is very important to us. “Onion & Pea” is an online comic strip but now,
thanks to your help, the very first “Onion & Pea” book will be published in
two editions, English and Spanish. Finally you will be able to hold it in your
hands and enjoy all the funny, colorful adventures of our little vegetable
friends, not forgetting the extra drawings and comments by the authors, in a
unique edition that you will have helped to accomplish.

  Risks and Challenges  

The design and
layout have already been completed and the book is now ready for printing. A
few test copies have been made (you can see them in the video) and we are
delighted with the result. We are lucky to have a trusty printing company with
many years’ experience, and with the help of family and friends, we will be
sending the perks off to you without delay.

Other Ways to Help
 
Even if you
cannot make a donation, you can still help us in other ways:
- By telling your
friends about our campaign.
- By using the Indiegogo
tools to share the campaign with your friends on social networks.
We have prepared
a competition to reward those who are most active in sharing our campaign.
Click on UPDATES above the video, and look for “Share Onion & Pea
Contest”.
Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Kate Lavut has been described as "a stand-up comedian wrapped in a comic book," by the Montreal Gazette.  Known for her mini comics; Smoked, Animals Ate the Alphabet and  Sex after Baby, Lavut is about to release her first full length comic novel, CHiCO. 

In 1997 Kate Lavut decided she wanted to be a boy. She packed a jar of peanut butter, shaved her head and bought a bus ticket from Toronto Canada to Tiajuana Mexico.

"I kept a diary when I was gone, and always had the idea of writing a novel of the experience, in fact I did, and sat on a manuscript for about 10 years! When I started making mini comics, I realized that a comic novel was the perfect medium to tell the story of CHiCO." says Lavut.  

Those who have collected the first editions of CHiCO, which first came out in mini comic form in 2011, will be delighted to see the transformation from the stripped down linear style of drawings into a full blown painted comic novel.

With your help, CHiCO will be printed and bound in a beautiful special edition, which will be completed and ready for purchase in early December 2014

In exchange for your amazing donations - you will receive incredible prizes,  including, but not limited too: a special edition of CHiCO with an original painting just for you, beautiful posters, hand drawn cloth bags, mini comics and silk screen tee-shirts.  Kate Lavut also love trades, if you don't have cash, but can help with publicity, printing and publishing we would be thrilled!

story:
First Things First

The Anger Diaries, as a part of a cross media epic project about a secret time- and world-dominating society called "Sheng" and its permanently depressed Hitman John F. Sebastian (YES, we know :-)), were created by Illustrator Jörg Vogeltanz, Author A. Heimo Sver and Author Mario Schwarzl in 1998, in 2006 Author Thomas Ballhausen joined the crew.

Currently, we published 4 books in non-chronological order since 2002. Now we are ready to collect the first 3 books in an amazing Trilogy with 300+ pages, hardcover, previously unpublished materials and bonus stuff for our fans and friends... plus: we'll translate it to english.

Books included in Trilogy:

"Anger Diary #1: Citoyen" (Vogeltanz)  ... out of stock.
"Anger  Diary #2: Wired Worlds" (Ballhausen/Vogeltanz)

"Anger Diary #3: Inmates" (Ballhausen/Vogeltanz)

 

Why & What we need

It is more than financially challenging to get a high-quality-Graphic Novel printed... the edition preQuel, as an independent publisher in Austria, kept alive by 3 people with no noteworthy capital, is completely unable to print bigger publications without financial support by interested fans and helpers. Because there are very few Graphic Novel-addicts among the more wealthy Austrian citizens and because public promotion for art projects is becoming more and more difficult we try to take as many alternatives as possible.
So what we need is primarily print support. For a project as big as the First Anger-Diary-Trilogy we'll need 10.000 US$ for a proper print.

"Vogeltanz offers a fully mature and relentlessly explicit drawing style in order to illuminate the most degraded sites in this world: his exuberant page compositions are bathed in bright colors; his backgrounds threaten to engulf the single images or allow them to appear briefly, emerging on the visible page surfaces. A visually exhilarating reading experience." (Paul Gravett, Graphic Novel Expert)
"This is the greatest story of multidimensional mystery ever produced in the german-speaking world – it should be made visible to an international audience at last!" (Michael Wittmann, Illustrator, Artist)

What you get

If the Funding Goal is reached, we offer edition preQuel memberships, free books, personalized signed original drawings by Jörg Vogeltanz etc. (see perks list). Not to mention, you become a part of the SHENG game!

 

Spread it!

If you are unable to help us finacially we appreciate any effort to spread our indiegogo-project on social platforms such as facebook, among your friends or family.

story:
Chi sono

Ciao! Mi chiamo Marco Tanca, sono nato a Cagliari nel 1980 e sono un fumettista.
Attualmente sto realizzando "Le bizzarre avventure del Bambino Biscotto", un progetto arrivato in finale al Lucca Project Contest 2018 e che presto verrà pubblicato da ProGLO.

 

L'uomo dalle giacche Adidas

Nel corso degli anni ho realizzato diversi fumetti brevi, apparsi su pubblicazioni underground e pagine social. Così mi son detto, perché non preparare un volume che raccolga tutte queste storie? Da questa semplice domanda è nata l'idea di "L'uomo dalle giacche Adidas - Autobiografia cromatica 2010_2020", una raccolta di miei lavori degli ultimi dieci anni, più alcuni inediti.



Il titolo è un riferimento ad un indumento che amo indossare spesso. Le storie non parlano della mia vita, sebbene i fumetti presenti esprimano tanti lati di me e del mio modo di raccontare. Potremmo considerarla un'autobiografia indiretta.
Cromatica perché il volume è suddiviso in diverse sezioni, ognuna rappresentata da un colore. I colori delle mie giacche Adidas.

 

Il mio obiettivo

Per la stampa del mio nuovo fumetto "L'uomo dalle giacche Adidas", l'obiettivo da raggiungere è 750€. Somma che verrà ripartita tra le seguenti spese:


 

  • 5% è la percentuale richiesta dal sito INDIEGOGO che ospita il crowdfunding.
  • 30% della somma raccolta sarà impiegato per alcune delle RICOMPENSE per i sostenitori. Sono previste mascherine con Gino, il pesce con le gambe presente in copertina. E delle stampe firmate e numerate per veri collezionisti.
  • 10% della somma raccolta sarà impiegato per l'ACQUISTO DEL CODICE ISBN.
  • Il codice ISBN è una sequenza numerica di 13 cifre usata internazionalmente per la classificazione dei libri. Con il codice ISBN, la pubblicazione del libro acquisisce in qualche modo ufficialità.
  • 55% della somma raccolta sarà impiegata per la STAMPA DELLE COPIE DEL VOLUME.


Grazie alla formula "Flexible Funding" potrò riscuotere qualsiasi somma di denaro raggiunta al termine della campagna. Il conseguimento del 100% della cifra fissata come obiettivo serve per garantire determinate caratteristiche di stampa e rispettare la data di pubblicazione.

 

Caratteristiche dell'edizione cartacea

"L'uomo dalle giacche Adidas" sarà disponibile in due edizioni: Digitale PDF e Cartacea.
Quest'ultima, con il raggiungimento del 100% dell'obiettivo fissato, avrà le seguenti caratteristiche:

  • Formato 14,8 x 21 cm, grammatura 170 gr
  • Circa 100 pagine a colori e in b/n
  • Brossura grecata e fresata
  • Copertina con plastificazione Soft Touch, grammatura 300 gr
  • Codice ISBN

 

Data di pubblicazione

Con il raggiungimento del 100% dell'obiettivo fissato, il volume verrà consegnato nel mese di Ottobre 2020. Ovviamente la pubblicazione sarà anticipata qualora l'opera fosse completata prima.

Per qualsiasi domanda, dubbio o curiosità, non esitate a contattarmi e sarò ben lieto di rispondervi. Oltre ad un contributo, se il progetto vi piace anche il semplice passaparola è fondamentale, utilizzando gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo! Tanc you! :)


I fumetti presenti nel volume

Le storie brevi contenute nel volume (a colori e in b/n) sono lavori apparsi su pubblicazioni underground e pagine social dal 2010 in poi. In più ci saranno alcuni inediti, che sto realizzando in questo periodo (proprio perché prima devo completare questi inediti, l'opera non verrà immediatamente stampata e consegnata al termine del crowdfunding). Tra questi anche una nuova avventura di Luna Lounge, un mio personaggio già apparso in diverse autoproduzioni. Tengo parecchio all'idea di inserire anche dei lavori attuali, oltre a poter dare - in questo modo - del materiale completamente nuovo anche ai lettori che già conoscono i miei precedenti lavori.

 

Alcune tavole presenti nel volume

story:
To continue giving to this ongoing project please contact me at: shirafrimer@gmail.com or visit the website www.nistarheroes.com



NEW STRETCH GOAL: $25,000

WOW!! We have reached our initial goal faster than I had ever imagined. My hearfelt thanks to my amazing supporters.

NOW for the real miracle goal - to get in into the hands of thousands of children with cancer, FOR FREE

I am happy to announce a new STRETCH GOAL of $25,000.  

At this level I can print 5,000 copies of NISTAR and give them to children with cancer all over the world, AT NO COST TO THE CHILD.

LET'S KEEP THE MOMENTUM GOING!! SO MUCH MORE TO COME!!

 

 

 

 

 Superhero Needed!!

The world is in need of a true superhero. Not to stop a speeding train. Or to scale a skyscraper in pursuit of masked marauders. But to face the vile nemesis that children of all races and religions battle on a daily basis. Cancer.  

JJ Barak is the world’s first such hero, and I need your help in bringing him to life. Nistar is a 104 page, fully colored graphic novel about JJ Barak and his battles against Cancer, illustrated by none other than renowned comic book artist Josef Rubinstein (published by Marvel and DC comics) as well as other comic book artists.

 

I have been working on this project for over 10 years, since my husband passed away at the age of 24 after battling pediatric bone cancer. During his five-year treatment in a children's oncology ward I watched him use his charisma and charm to give hope to his young friends on the ward. Inspired by his legacy I created this superhero, in the hopes of someday reaching the hearts of all children, especially those who need a bit of light to help them through their times of darkness.

My dream is get this book into the hands of the little heroes who need it most.

What we need and what you get

We are hoping to raise $15,000 to pay for the completion of the artwork and the cost of a first print run!! I hope to raise enough money so that I can distribute Nistar to children with cancer all over the world, for free!

In exchange for your support you will be able to choose between some basic rewards and some really amazing packages. At higher reward levels we are offering signed prints, original sketches of your favorite superhero, and even portraits of someone you love drawn by the amazing Joe Rubinstein!

From levels $25 and up a copy of Nistar will be donated to a child with cancer.

Book Specs

The perfect bound book will be 104 pages, will measure 6.25 X 10.25 inches and will be printed on high quality paper in full color.

Rewards

Original Artwork by Josef Rubinstein

Choose the $360 perk - You receive an original 8 X 10" signed sketch of a character from the book or yourself drawn as a supehero!

Choose the $500 perk - You receive an original 11 X 17" signed ink drawing of a character from the book or an ink portrait of someone you love. If you know a child who is battling cancer this makes a very meaningful gift - and the portrait will be included in the book!!

 

 

Choose the $720 perk - You receive a beautiful  8 x 10" original signed watercolor or pastel portrait of someone you love!

Choose the $1,000 perk - You receive and unbelieveable 11 x 17" original signed watercolor or pastel portrait of someone you love!

How does this work?

If you are not familiar with Indiegogo or crowd funding in general, here's a brief overview.

For the next 45 days, you'll be able to make pledges to help support this project, ranging from $15 to whatever you can afford without going broke or having to divorce. You can select one of the perks on the right, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only being awesome: you are also receiveing stuff as proof of that! 

Who am I?

Hi, I'm Shira, 37 year old mother of twin boys, expressive arts therapist and author. I believe in the power of creativity as an effective tool for coping with life's challenges. I am also a dreamer...and Nistar is one of my dreams.

story:
Greetings all good people of the Earth.

We doing our second campaign to co-fund our charity project for children with autism.

Earlier this year we did our first campaign (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/support-chil...)  and managed to raise 75% of funds with 197 backers both online and offline. However, we still missing 1300£ to start printing.  Please join us to meet targets (or even more) by 31/08/2020. 

Elish and the Wicker Tale is a children’s book by the author, Kamran Salayev. It follows the life of Elish, a young boy who has trouble communicating and coping with the world around him. Elish would rather keep to himself, doing what he loves more than anything, crafting wicker artifacts. Once trouble stirs in his world, however, Elish is set on the path of adventure, forced to step outside his comfort zone and confront his fears in order to help those around him.


Elish’s behavior and insecurities mirror those of children around the globe who suffer from autism. Just like Elish, children with autism find it hard to understand and relate to people, so they end up devoting their time to something they can understand, usually a hobby or craft such as wicker-making. Kamran Salayev’s goal is to promote awareness of this subject through his book, and I’ve decided to join him in that endeavor.


As of spring 2020, I’ve been working on a comic/graphic novel adaptation of Elish and Wicker Tale, with the first issue due to be completed this summer. With support from crowdfunding, I’ll be able to publish the graphic novel, allowing children both with and without autism to access this story in a more visual and engaging form. Sales will also contribute to the cause, with 20% of profits going directly to charities and organizations that tackle autism and make the lives of children affected by it easier and happier.

 

The main objectives of the project:

  • Draw attention to the social inequality of autistic and healthy children.
  • Show the main opportunities and values through the character of the comics based on the book “Elish”
  • To create a new tolerant look for children through the illustrations.
  • This crowdfunding project will help to take a fresh look at the whole social problem and change the established human worldview through a comic book!

 

All sponsors will be written on the ‘thank you page’ in the book.

 

  1. Everyone who supports the project with 10 pounds or more will be indicated as sponsors.
  2. All sponsors who support the project with 25 pounds or more will be mentioned as sponsors and will receive an electronic copy of the book + autograph of the comic book author 
  3. Sponsors who support the project with 50 pounds or more will be mentioned as sponsors and will receive an electronic copy of the book + autograph of the comic book author + gift copy for any world library that will be sent from the UK (free shipping)
  4. All sponsors who support the project with 100 pounds or more will be mentioned as sponsors and will receive an electronic copy of the book + autograph of the comic book author + gift copy for any world library or institution that will be sent from the UK + original book Elish and the Wicker Tales by Kamran Salayev.

Once the book has been published by the Hertfordshire Press, it will be available for sale on the Amazon.
Thanks in advance for your support!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Видео Камрана Салаева о своей книге и проекте:

Поддержите детей c аутизмом: новый комикс от Тимура Ахмеджанова

Добрый день добрые люди планеты Земля!

Мы делаем вторую попытку собрать необходимую сумму для издания книги-комикса посвященная детям с аутизмом.

Ранее этой весной мы провели первую компанию  (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/support-chil...)   и смогли собрать 75% от необходимой суммы с помощью 197 меценатов как через платформу, так и напрямую, но нам по прежнему не хватает 1300£, чтобы проект стартовал в типографии.

Пожалуйста поддержите нас, чтобы мы вместе смогли добиться поставленной цели, а может даже превысить ее. Ждем всех добрых и неравнодушных людей до 31/08/2020.

«Илиш и плетеные истории» — детская книга авторства Камрана Салаева. Она повествуют о жизни Илиша — мальчика, которому трудно находить общий язык с миром вокруг. Поэтому Илиш предпочитает оставаться сам по себе, занимаясь тем, что любит больше всего на свете — плетением. Но когда наступают тяжелые времена, Илиш встает на путь приключений; он вынужден выйти за пределы зоны комфорта и побороть свои страхи, чтобы помочь людям вокруг него.

Поступки и комплексы Илиша отражают поведение детей с аутизмом по всему миру. Всем, как Илишу, детям с аутизмом сложно понимать людей, поэтому они зацикливаются на чем-то, что они понимают, чаще всего этим хобби становится плетение. Цель создателя книги — Камрана Салаева — в том, чтобы повысить внимание этой темы через книгу, поэтому я решил присоединиться к нему в его начинании. С весны 2020 года я работаю над графической адаптацией "Илиша и плетеных историй", первая часть которой должна выйти в свет уже этим летом. 

С помощью краудфандинга, я смогу опубликовать серию комиксов, дав возможность детям с и без аутизма прочитать историю в более наглядной форме — в виде красочных иллюстраций. Также 20% полученных средств будут перечислены благотворительным фондам и организациям, которые делают жизнь детей с аутизмом легче и счастливее

Задачи проекта:

  • Обратить внимание на социальное неравенство между детьми с аутизмом и без него;
  • Показать основные возможности и ценности через персонажа комикса по мотивам книги «Илиш»;
  • Создать новый толерантный взгляд на мир через иллюстрации.

Этот краудфандинговый проект поможет людям по-новому взглянуть на социальные проблемы и изменить устоявшийся взгляд человека на аутизм с помощью комикса!

Все спонсоры будут перечислены на странице благодарности в готовой книге.

  • Все спонсоры, которые поддержат проект 10 фунтами и более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры.
  • Все спонсоры, которые поддерживают проект 25 фунтами или более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры, получат электронную копию книги + автограф автора комикса
  • Все спонсоры, которые поддержат проект 50 фунтами или более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры, получат электронную копию книги, автограф автора комикса и подарочную копию, которая будет отправлена ​​из Великобритании (бесплатная доставка)
  • Все спонсоры, которые поддерживают проект 100 фунтами или более, будут упомянуты как спонсоры, получат электронную копию книги, автограф автора комикса и подарочную копию, которая будет отправлена ​​из Великобритании (бесплатная доставка) + оригинал книги Камрана Салаева "Илиш и плетеные истории".

Как только книга будет опубликована издательством Hertfordshire Press, она будет доступна для продажи на Amazon.

Мы верим в Вашу поддержку!

Если по каким-то причинам у Вас не получается сделать пожертвование через эту платформу, свяжитесь с нами по e-mail publisher@ocamagazine.com или WhatApp​ +447411978955 и мы расскажем об альтернативных методах

story:
BIG UPDATE! WE DID IT! WE HAVE RAISED ENOUGH TO GET AN EXCESS OF BOOKS PRINTED AND ALL CURRENT AND FUTURE BACKERS WILL RECEIVE THEIR BOOKS AND PERKS! THANK YOU! IF YOU HAVEN'T BACKED US YET, GET ON BOARD!

 

 

Teen rabbit pop-punk sensations, THE WRASKLES, are on their way to a gig in Porksburg when their old jalopy tour van breaks down at a spooky crossroads. An old goat challenges them to a musical duel, and after they defeat him, he transforms into a demon and curses them to encounter the supernatural until they can perform a better song than the one played to best him. This sets our series in motion where THE WRASKLES tour around the world searching for pop-punk super-stardom while they fight the dark forces of the musical world.

We are looking to print around 750 issues and to fund this as well as the materials for the various tiers of perks and shipping we will need to raise $5,000.00

Perks include signed copies of THE WRASKLES CROSSROADS AT PORKSBURG, sketch cards of 7 of the main recurring characters of the series, original artwork drawn by series artist and co-creator Curt Spurging, and stickers.

We hope to hit the initial target so that we can keep the price per unit low enough to get the book into our readers hands. If the goal isn't hit we will reassess the number of units needed and the costs required thereafter.

One important thing to consider with this campaign is that THE BOOK IS FINISHED and we are hoping to ship approximately 30 days after the campaign is fully funded and closes. Our goal for this book and the continuing series is to give our readers a FUN and ENTERTAINING read, not to fund a rock star lifestyle for a year while our backers wait for the book to get to them. 

 

Preview of interior pages:

Page 1

​Page 4

​Page 8

​Page 11

​Page 12

​Page 17

Page 20

​Page 22

​Page 24

​Page 25

​Page 26

Page 27

Back Cover

7 signed original drawing sketch cards - 4 inches x 6 inches

 

Sticker 1:

Sticker 2:

 

Original artwork. Watercolor & pencil on 10in x 14.25in comic book quality paper.

story:
Full Mag: Veteran Stories Illustrated

A unique veteran history project...

Without your support these stories will remain untold

At Full Mag, we interview military veterans and present their first person stories in our high quality graphic novel and military history magazine.  Our diverse team captures stories that would otherwise be lost to the ages, thus adding to the historic record while at the same time providing a platform for artists to honor the veteran storytellers through the application of their skills. 

  • Stories from WW II to the current day as can only be told by those who experienced the events themselves.
  • Illustrated by best graphic artists: industry pros and emerging talent.
  • Our team of veterans, historians, artists, and authors combine their skills for this veteran history project.
  • Traditional articles and essays by veteran authors and military historians that tie directly to the first person illustrated stories combine for a genre-crossing journey like no other.
  • Volume 2 is the culmination of thousands of hours of effort by our team.

Full Mag is not a comic book!  It is a high quality, perfect bound, magazine size graphic novel and military history magazine.  Volume 2 is an 84 page epic journey from the European and Pacific Theaters of WW II, to Vietnam, to the modern day conflicts in Central and Southwest Asia.  Eight of the nine stories in Volume 2 are told by the veterans themselves with one told by the widow of a veteran. 

Stories are illustrated by an all star team of industry pros and emerging talent including: Russ Heath [some of his last published work], Gary Martin, Fernando Ruiz, Tom Mandrake, Gary Kwapisz, J.W. Erwin, Joshua Sloniker, Cassandra Dale, and others.

This campaign is to launch Volume 2...

Full Mag: Veteran Stories Illustrated is a ground breaking product!

  • Vol.1, our 56 page premier issue was published in Nov. 2017 and included the epic story of David Thatcher, one of the last two Doolittle Raiders, and more.  
  • Combined, across Volumes 1 and 2 - supporters will get 140 pages of high quality graphic novel with 13 illustrated stories [five WW II, five Vietnam, two OEF & one OIF], amazing written contributions, and much more.
  • Full Mag is a full color, perfect bound, magazine size, heavy page weight, quality product.
  • Printed in the USA.
  • Volume 2 is print-ready!  We need your support now to make this a reality and present these untold tales.

Full Mag supports the arts and preserves history!

  • Our firm has paid nearly $40,000 to freelance artists in fair page rates.  We pay better than many major studios.
  • We contribute to the historic record and provide a platform for artists to use their skills to honor the veterans who guarantee our freedoms to freely express ourselves.
  • Volume 2 has the illustrated stories of Obie Wickersham, Douglas Drysdale [as told by Martha Drysdale], Ray Lau, Leonard Swartz, Brian Prahl, Mark Potes, Mitch Waldran, Casey Jourdan, Alan Sutton, and written contributions by Michael MacLeod & Jeff Thatcher.
  • We obtain and present stories that would otherwise be lost forever.
    • To illustrate this point, sadly, at least three WW II veterans who have been involved in Full Mag have since passed away.

    A unique opportunity for veterans to tell their stories...

    Veterans now approach us to tell their stories in Full Mag.  This only became possible after the publication of Volume 1.  It was then that we knew our efforts were truly worthy.

    The American Legion and other sponsors...

    Full Mag is not just a collection of scattered stories.  It is a cohesive artistic journey from cover to cover with content that flows across the volume in a thoughtful manner.  This includes stunning full page ads and double page spreads by our sponsors: The American Legion, The Newcomer Conservation and Humanitarian Fund, Newcomer Arms, First Spear, Back Bay USA, and Dillon Design Group.  In addition, Full Mag's attendance at the 2019 Denver Pop Culture Con will be sponsored in part by the Montana Arts Council.

    Please support us by buying multiple copies and spreading them around or going big as a patron.

    Full Mag truly makes a great gift.  The stories are riveting page-turners.  Anyone who enjoys sequential graphic storytelling, epic non-fiction first-person stories, military history, or supporting the arts will absolutely be stunned by this unique product.

    Page from story "Plain of Reeds" by Brian Prahl, art by J.W. Erwin

    Panel sequence from story "Seafloat" by Mark Potes, art by Gary Kwapisz

The American Legion and other sponsors...

Full Mag is not just a collection of scattered stories.  It is a cohesive artistic journey from cover to cover with content that flows across the volume in a thoughtful manner.  This includes stunning full page ads and double page spreads by our sponsors: The American Legion, The Newcomer Conservation and Humanitarian Fund, Newcomer Arms, First Spear, Back Bay USA, and Dillon Design Group.  In addition, Full Mag's attendance at the 2019 Denver Pop Culture Con will be sponsored in part by the Montana Arts Council.

Please support us by buying multiple copies and spreading them around or going big as a patron.
Full Mag truly makes a great gift.  The stories are riveting page-turners.  Anyone who enjoys sequential graphic storytelling, epic non-fiction first-person stories, military history, or supporting the arts will absolutely be stunned by this unique product.

Page from story "Plain of Reeds" by Brian Prahl, art by J.W. Erwin

Panel sequence from story "Seafloat" by Mark Potes, art by Gary Kwapisz

story:
INFO

This indiegogo page is a form of preorder with limited prizes. We’re planning an official premiere of our zine at MFKiG (International Comics and Games Festival) in Łódź (Poland), which takes place on 27-29th September. We’ll start shipping your prizes after that date.

Every order with shipping gets a free sticker and a business card inside every book, but you can also get more limited merch such as postcards (we’ll update the designs soon), totes and pens with our logo.* There’s also a wholesale option with one extra ciut, a pdf option and thanks with your name printed in our book!

Please take a look at our perks and find something for yourself, let’s help this book come into life!

 

BOOK SPECIFICS

  • Format: A5
  • Color: B&W
  • Cover: softcover, printed in color, cover design by xuh
  • Pages: minimum 120, ideal would be 160
  • Paper: Munken Pure
  • Language: English

 

PRIZES

Here you can see photos or visualisations of the items you can get in the perks.

 

ARTISTS PARTICIPATING

Meet the artists who'll make this zine into life. The artists have a free hand and can deliver whatever they want to the zine, from comics to illustrations and sketches. The main topic of this book is school related, but we don't restrict their interpretations.

Also, if we reach the goal of 1900 USD we'll be able to pay artists for their work, otherwise they'll get free copies of the zine.

  • Ala Flora
  • Anka Waćkowska
  • Anna Sranna
  • Berliac
  • Jakub Grochola
  • javvie
  • Joanna Rzepecka
  • Julia Płoch
  • Karl Nesser
  • Laska
  • Magdalena Rzepecka
  • Oasis of hate
  • Olga Wieszczyk
  • Weronika Banasińska
  • xuh

 

 

RISKS & CHALLANGES

There is no real risk, we will print the book anyway even if it doesn't reach the goal, but your support will help us make it thicker and better!

Shipping disclaimer: packages sent to countries outside Europe may take even a month to arrive, so be patient please! Thanks!

 

MORE INFO

Video teaser by javvie & xuh, with Pariuh song, ‘Micky Mouse’s’ playing in the background, thanks Pariuh!

*All photos are just visualizations for now, we don’t have the final products yet, but we’ll keep you guys updated! Same goes for postcard designs, there’ll be two of them with illustrations by xuh and Magdalena Rzepecka, both in color (back and front).

Follow us on FB and IG @ciut.zine to see our progress! Contact: zine.ciut@gmail.com

 

INFO DLA WSPIERAJĄCYCH Z POLSKI

Hej! Dzięki za wsparcie naszego projektu mimo progów w dolarach! Specjalnie dla was wysyłka na terenie Polski będzie darmowa. Rozsyłanie egzemplarzy i nagród z progów rozpoczynamy na początku września. Istnieje też możliwość odebrania zinka wcześniej, osobiście, na MFKiG w Łodzi, będziemy tam ze stoiskiem Biedacy, zapraszamy! Oczywiście na miejscu będzie też możliwość kupienia ciuta w polskiej cenie.

 

 

 

 

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
The Bare Bones:

So, what is this piratey nonsense all about?

Weaponry is a webcomic that uploads free of charge every Monday, found at http://www.otherworldscomics.com/weaponry.php as well as on DeviantART and Smackjeeves. It is a Choose Your Own Adventure comic, and a yaoi (or boy's love) tale of adventure, lawlessness and competition on the high seas. The readers are encouraged to voice their two-pennies, debate potential directions the story could go and defend their choices for reactions and pairings based on the canon pages. Then, at the end of every chapter, I offer up three different scenarios - one for each of the three protagonists - and the readers get to choose how they would like the story to continue.

So who am I? My name is Astra Crompton. I'm a working stiff by day, yet by night I write and publish novels, illustrate comics, and do freelance art and craft work. Being able to support myself fully through my art is a dream I'm working hard to fulfill.

Up 'til now, my art has been a welcome though sporadic bonus, but comes no where near to paying the bills. I've funded the start-up costs for Weaponry completely out of pocket, and as of yet there's no real way for me to recoup these costs. I don't have the capitol to get this first run to print, and I'm hoping that if I can get some stock, I might be able to get the comic on its feet, er, Sea Legs.

Not only will your generous donations enable me to print the first run of 100 copies, it will also enable the infrastructure to solidify. How's that exactly? This amount pays for the supplies for the incentives (left overs becoming extra merch) like key-chains, stickers, prints and other extras. It provides much-needed funding for minor advertising to encourage readership and hopefully increase support for this relatively new comic (by ads on Smackjeeves, similar web comics' sites, etc), it also enables the website and Big Cartel sites to continue running smoothly so that everyone can enjoy this story for free.

Weaponry has received glowing compliments from its current readership for its realistic characters, rich colours, compelling writing and delicious character designs. If you already read Weaponry - I thank you. It is your feedback and encouragement that keeps my passion for this project running so high. If you have not yet read the tale, I entreat you to take a moment to read the first chapter and see what it is I'm trying to accomplish first hand. This initial step will set the stage for all the storytelling to come - and I'd love for you to be a part of it!

Your Gold for Me Bounty

Where does the money go?

$1950 is a modest request for a print endeavour, but every dollar is put to work. It enables:

~100 copies to be printed (including shipping from the printer to myself, import and customs duties, and basic shipping costs to send them on to you - if you are in North America)

~The cost of 1 to 2 advertisments on similar webcomics' sites (I'm looking into Artifice, Teahouse, Tj & Amal, Facebook)

~The cost for 1 year of web hosting (both my url and web hoster, Big Cartel store website, and Smackjeeves donator account) to increase options and space so that I can offer bigger page display and more goods to you, the reader.

~The cost of the Incentives and merchandise that I hope to offer in the shop and at conventions. (This includes colour prints, key-chains, the art supplies for unique art, and one of a kind crafts like plushies and cosplay pieces) plus the cost of using IndieGoGo to facilitate the fundraising.

And for thy generosity ye shall be rewarded!

I've put together some really fun perks for funding this project! Please note that ALL PERKS STACK! That's right! That means you will receive the listed perk for your donation level AS WELL AS EVERYTHING that preceded it!

Obviously, since I'm the sole creator of this comic, I'm also the only one filling the orders (including drawing the unique art and making your craft prizes) so please have patience as I fill all your orders. I'm looking forward to getting to know you during this fundraiser and will try my best to draw you your favourite characters for incentives and on the livestreams while the fundraiser is happening.

Despite the fact that the goal is on the barebones end of the comic funding spectrum, I understand that thus far, Weaponry's reach is small. I know that many of you are much in the same boat as I am, and your boundless love for my comic does nothing to line your pockets. It is a very real possibility that I will not be able to raise the needed funds. If not, cuts will need to be made - the advertising & website fees will be the first to be culled, as much as doing so will hamstring the future of the comic. I will use every raised dollar to ensure all of the incentives are fullfilled, even if it means I need to continue to raise the funds needed to do so, on my own afterwards.

Conversely, if, by some miracle of the Pastafarian Angels, we EXCEED the targeted goal - my solemn pledge is that every extra dollar will go to buying more copies of the comic to take around to conventions and sell on the online shop. The revenue from their sales will hopefully fuel the other costs this comic incrues to keep it going for Chapter Two and beyond. I'll also be offering bonus art to everyone who has pledged in the form of exclusive wallpapers, gift art, and anything else I can manage to illustrate my overwhelming joy.

Long-Sighted Views

Weaponry began in July of 2011. I had no idea if people would enjoy the story, or my art, but in my close circle, it got such a positive response that I wanted to share it. Since then, its readership has constantly surprised and impressed me with their insightful views, varied opinions and diligent support.
It is for that reason above all others that I have not yet missed an update. My dedication to see this project through is iron-clad, with the willing sacrifice of sleep and other personal projects to ensure the updates go up on time with consistent quality. I treat the comic as a dream job - because I wish that someday it could be my official line of work.
Keeping the audience involved in directing the story prevents me from getting carried away - from planning too far ahead and developing machiavellian plots that I could never possibly execute in my lifetime. We are fuel to each others' fires, and every new reader only builds my enthusiasm.
 

Be on the Lookout!

There are many more ways you can help Weaponry become a success. Whether you are able to contribute your hard-earned treasure to the chest or not, I would wholly appreciate your assistance with the following:

~ Spread the word! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Y!Gallery, DeviantART, Smackjeeves, messageboards, classrooms, chatrooms, forums, blackboards, emails, quill and ink!! Any method at your disposal to share your love and support of Weaponry is the best gift I could receive. Word of mouth advertising is the least expensive yet most effective method out there. If you know anyone you think might like Weaponry - please, encourage them to read the comic, tell them about the fundraiser. This is not only a chance to get Chapter One to print, it's a chance to spread the love of the comic itself.

~ IndieGoGo has a number of helpful tools to make it easy to share this fundraiser at the mere click of a button! You can also embed the Livestream video into any html supporting website or forum you use.

~ I welcome banner exchanges with other webcomics (yaoi or otherwise); I adore fanart (it shares the characters in an accessible fashion and looks great on the website - plus it's a free plug for you!).

~ Keep it fresh! By all of you helping to share all of this, the chances of a wider audience being reached expand exponentially! With your help, we can get this comic its Sea Legs, and the Print Edition will be merely the start of our grande adventure!

 

Thank you all for all your support thus far. It means the Seven Seas to me!

story:
Note: All perks include shipping to everywhere!

Our Story

Thank you for taking the time to view this campaign. My name is Savannah Houston-McIntyre, and I am the writer and producer of Amya. I work alongside my co-writer Andrew Hewitt, as well as our illustrator Rebecca Gunter.


Amya is a high-fantasy graphic novel that my comrades and I have dedicated our time and skill to publishing since September 2009, though the story began years prior. We consider Amya much more than a hobby, it is a passion.


In the first two chapters "Unexpected Meeting" and "The Monster of Erishore", we followed the adventures of a mute spell-touched and her unlikely companions as they were pulled into an adventure that was greater than any of them could have anticipated; or ever expect to fulfill.


The third installment "Conflict at Deepwall", focuses on unwrapping the mystery surrounding Faye and her purpose to the story. We will meet new villains and find new friends as Faye discovers she is to be the saviour of a world she has been segregated from since birth. This will lead to her biggest ultimatum through the series: Does she want to sacrifice her own humanity for the world -- or the world for her humanity?


What We Need

As an independent publisher, printing comics at the level of quality that readers expect is financially challenging. We had fantastic support from our readers towards the print run of Chapter Two, and the campaign was a success. Chapter Three is the largest of the series to date at 76 pages; therefore the production cost is higher than the previous issues. 


Because of recent medical concerns involving myself and continuing medical concerns surrounding my son, I have not been able to supply as much funding for the project from my own pockets as I have in the past. To compile these pages into a solid format that you can hold and cherish - we will once again need your help.


It is my hope that you will help me raise $2,500 of the cost to print Chapter Three. Anything we raise above that amount will aid in printing the project sooner, or add to the amount we are able to print.


What You Get

We have a number of pledges and rewards listed to the right. Please review the options and consider extending your support. Anything you give is appreciated - as every dollar pushes us toward our goal.


Some of the options include:

  • Print and digital copies of the comic.
  • Additional swag such as stickers and pins.
  • High-quality spot-gloss postcards.
  • A number of 11x17 posters.
  • Limited edition printed canvas.
  • Unique art cards.
  • A chance to cameo in chapter four!

You can find visual examples of these products towards the end of the page!


For those of you who are able to donate towards either the digital or print editions, we're pleased to be offer five bonus pages of additional content! 


Jules Rivera of Valkyrie Squadron is currently offering an additional perk ontop of our regular perks for anyone who donated more than $10 to the final $600 we need to reach our goal! See her post for more details. 



Other ways to Help

If you cannot donate financially, please consider donating your time and sharing this project with another. It's a great way to see this dream become a reality and is as simple as sharing our link on Facebook, Twitter, or Google+! Talk to your friends, e-mail your family - pollute your first date with chatter of Amya and make an impression! Well - perhaps you don't need to go that far. However, every link to the campaign helps and we will be most grateful.

 I wish to thank you again for taking the time to consider this campaign. Amya has been a real labor of love - and it's our dream to see it to its end-- is still 12 chapters away. I hope as we move forward on this journey you will continue to read and support our work. As I've said before, not only does our love for the project propel us forward - but your support. You make it all worthwhile!

With my warmest regards,


Savannah Houston-McIntyre


11x17 Posters

More to come


Canvas and Postcards


Limited Poster and Bonus Stickers!

story:
Juarez, Mexico  

In a gritty, soulless border town that smells of blood, sex, and liquor, there's no real honest way to make a living. I only had two choices in life -- become the cartel's instrument of death or end up the next decapitated message hanging from an overpass. 

Working for the Castaneda Cartel transformed me into the perfect killer.  Cold. Calculating. Uncaring. I was truly a heartless messenger for evil men.  

After a lifetime of wading in a river of blood, I escaped this self-inflicted nightmare. Why God chose to bless me with Maria and my sweet little Gloria, I will never know. Perhaps he knew a good woman and an innocent child of my own could change the heart of this devil.  

Together, we fled this hell and disappeared into the safety of America. We had two wonderful years together as a family... until the cartel forced me to return to the blood-soaked past I'd left behind and use my tools to issue vengeance on men I once called "brothers".

 

Thank you for checking out my book! My name is Brad Ashworth and I'm the creator of Handyman. I have been drawing professionally since I was twenty, including children's books, board games,  print media illustrations, and commissions.  After many months,  I am proud to announce the release of my first comic book. Working with writer Tyler Carpenter, we've crafted Handyman as a hard-edged series set in a violent, criminal world where retribution is poured out upon evil men who far too often escape the hands of justice.
story_txt:
Juarez, Mexico  
In a gritty, soulless border town that smells of blood, sex, and liquor, there's no real honest way to make a living. I only had two choices in life -- become the cartel's instrument of death or end up the next decapitated message hanging from an overpass. 
Working for the Castaneda Cartel transformed me into the perfect killer.  Cold. Calculating. Uncaring. I was truly a heartless messenger for evil men.  
After a lifetime of wading in a river of blood, I escaped this self-inflicted nightmare. Why God chose to bless me with Maria and my sweet little Gloria, I will never know. Perhaps he knew a good woman and an innocent child of my own could change the heart of this devil.  
Together, we fled this hell and disappeared into the safety of America. We had two wonderful years together as a family... until the cartel forced me to return to the blood-soaked past I'd left behind and use my tools to issue vengeance on men I once called "brothers".



 

Thank you for checking out my book! My name is Brad Ashworth and I'm the creator of Handyman. I have been drawing professionally since I was twenty, including children's books, board games,  print media illustrations, and commissions.  After many months,  I am proud to announce the release of my first comic book. Working with writer Tyler Carpenter, we've crafted Handyman as a hard-edged series set in a violent, criminal world where retribution is poured out upon evil men who far too often escape the hands of justice.

story:
AS OF 9/1, ALL ORDERS HAVE BEEN FILLED. IF YOU DO NOT RECEIVE YOUR PACKAGE WITHIN 1 WEEK (NORTH AMERICA) OR 2 WEEKS (REST OF THE WORLD), PLEASE DIRECT MESSAGE US WITH YOUR ORDER NUMBER AND WE'LL GLADLY RESOLVE YOUR ORDER.

BLACK FLAG is coming back and Dan Fraga is celebrating the return with a limited edition, crossover cover!

It's a mash-up you never saw coming! The upcoming return of Black Flag is hotly anticipated by fans but, before that book debuts, Dynamite is proud to present the franchise's first appearance in over 25 years with this limited crossover cover of Red Sonja: Age of Chaos #1.

JUST ADDED!

ORDER AN EXCLUSIVE T-SHIRT BY ITSELF OR AS PART OF ANY OTHER PERK!

Look for the design option at checkout.

Behind the scenes look at Dan's cover process

About Red Sonja: Age of Chaos

Written by Erik Burnham (Ghostbusters, Chastity) and drawn by Jonathan Lau (Green Hornet), the past meets the present with the future of literally everything at stake! The warrior Red Sonja has a plan to keep freshly killed wizard Kulan Gath from resurrecting himself again -- but when the plan backfires, it allows a whole new kind of Chaos! to infest the Hyborean Age! Will these new beings be any easier to deal with than Kulan Gath, or has Sonja called a worse evil to her world? It's the first chapter of a brand-new quest for the She-Devil - and it may be her hardest yet as for the first time ever, Red Sonja meets the badass characters of Chaos!

Comic Watch said "these characters are visual powerhouses that allow so many great opportunities for the creative talent to shine. While Sakkara definitely steals the spotlight, each of the Chaos characters bring their own unique flair that matches up with Red Sonja’s aesthetic quite well."

Sequential Planet said: "...the action is great and fans of Chaos! comics will love it. I think the sense of humour and willingness to poke fun at itself was brilliant and I’m sold on the series."

About Dan Fraga

Dan Fraga (aka FRAGABOOM) is originally from California and immediately out of high school was hired to be a part of Rob Liefeld's Extreme Studios within Image Comics in their early heyday. After making his main stage debut in Youngblood #0, Fraga went on to launch Bloodstrike as its principal artist, as well as his own creation, Black Flag. 

Through the 1990s and early 2000s, Fraga continued to work on titles such as Spider-Man, Wolverine, Black Panther, Cable, Witchblade, and his creation The Gear Station. Leaving the industry around that time, he started working in film and animation, directing episdoes of the Ricky Gervais Show, and doing storyboards for Doom Patrol, Monster High, Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer and music videos. 

Returning to comics, Dan created his webcomic The Grave and contributed covers to titles like G.I. Joe and the Bloodstrike modern revival.

Risks & Challenges

The book is finished and ready for press, we just need to know how many copies to print. If we encounter any delays with fulfillment, they would likely be due to printer closings/delays due to the coronavirus. We have set our fulfillment time as August in order to allow extra time for last-minute delays with printers, but we hope to be filling these orders sooner.

story:
Welcome to Chiсkago.

«Casino Zooar» is a graphic novel in the Noir genre. It is an exciting adventure in the world of detectives and criminals of the North America of the 40s.

Chickago is the city of wet asphalt and neon signs, where both power and law are born in the shadow of the side streets and underground clubs. When cynicism and prudence become the main signs of strength, everyone is particularly strict about observing the "order," and the problems are resolved in a neutral territory, at the poker table!

The Story.


The story follows shepherdJohn Faulkner, private detective, a former police officer. He has a major conflict with the "shadow" leaders of the city, who destroyed his life and caused the death of his beloved. Fighting with them, he understands that his revenge will only bring more harm to the residents of the city. But he can't stop and goes all the way till the end, even after realising that he caused everything that happened to his life himself.

What is Casino Zooar.

This is a started right before your eyescomic book series, written and drawn by comic fans, old school roleplayers and fans of film Noir. It will be a full-colored detective book more than 30 pages long.  It can be viewed as a stand-alone story or the beginning of a cycle of novels in the dark and brutal city of Chicago.

A Few Sample Pages.

Why IndieGoGo?

During the production of the graphic novel Casino Zooar, we have been faced with an important issue of costs associated with printing and transporting books. This are huge expenses, that must be approached very carefully. A small quantity printing is going to rise each novel’s book cost and in the long run increases the spendings. In case of success on IndieGoGo, we will increase the circulation of the print edition and provide the rewards to our pledgers.

Be the first of your friends who can own a limited edition copy of graphic novel Casino Zooar.

Your help is invaluable!

If you want to participate in the project, help us by making an order with one of the above rewards. All funds will go to print, create additional content and delivery logistics.


Sometimes it happens that there is no possibility of financial support - it is ok. Please tell about the novel to your family and friends. You can follow us on our social networks for the news and to share the images we’ll be revealing throughout the duration of the campaign.

If you are a blogger and want to interview us or write a small post in the novel, we are ready to answer all your questions. We want new fans to participate and breathe life into this Noir story project.

Like Casino Zooar on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CasinoZooarBooks

Follow Casino Zooar on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Zooar_GN

Risks and challengess.

The only risk factor that we can imagine - emergency delays in the production of printing and shipping. Hopefully this will not happen and we'll do everything and even more that all received would have their rewards at the time.

If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact us directly via email or section "contact the author" or leave your comments here.


Thank you for all the support you can provide for the release of the graphic novel Casino Zooar!

story:
Thank you everyone who contributed.  I will be launching a new campaign for Requiem of the Crazies issue #2 soon.  So STAY TUNED!  You can still purchase issue #1 here: www.Requiemofthecrazies.com 

Requiem of the Crazies tells the story a man named Dante, who after losing his job and home, is cast out of his mundane life and into the strange underground world of the homeless. Being mentored by a veteran bum named Vernon, our two protagonists begin to uncover a dark reality about the homeless community in which they live. That it’s slowly falling under the control of an insidious maniacal cult leader who is drugging their food and water supply, manipulating the minds of the homeless so they carry out his nefarious evil bidding. In order to stop this madman’s plot, Dante and Vern will have to face off against corrupt police, drug dealers, satanic gangs, and a rising epidemic of cannibalism.  

 

I currently have 20 pages near completion (there will be changes to color/ slight adjustments).  You can read the first 3 chapters on my website here: http://www.rustycagemusic.com/comic/

I plan on making this comic series one way or the other. As you can see, I’m about halfway done with Issue #1, so there is no stopping me from completing this project and making my comic. UNSTOPPABLE I TELL YOU! 

My name is Rusty Cage. I’m a musician, artist, beef jerky connoisseur, and YouTuber. I gained notoriety world-wide for the “five finger fillet” video I made called “The Knife Game Song”, which helped to launch my career in music (https://rustycage.bandcamp.com/), as well as my youtube channel (https://www.youtube.com/rustycage).  I’m probably best known for making songs and videos that dwell in the realm of insanity, dark themes, and macabre subject matters. Which is what I plan to bring to my comic book series, ‘Requiem of the Crazies’. 

Creating a comic book has been a dream of mine since I was a small weak child. As I approach my midlife crisis at 29 years old, I’m excited to put my motivation into making this comic series. To FINALLY tell the stories too in-depth to be written as a song, and not ‘family-friendly’ enough for a youtube video.  If you like comics with grit, filth, excitement and dark themes, then this is a comic for you.  

If the entire goal isn’t reached, I will still print as many copies as possible.  If the goal is exceeded, then I can print more copies, as well as add stretch goals to bring you more perks for your contribution. 

All tiers will get a signed copy of Requiem of the Crazies Issue #1, printed on high quality paper. Additional perks include:

• Fold-out posters

• Personally hand drawn character sketches

• Have your name printed in the back of the comic on a special thank you page. 

Challenging? maybe, but risks? Absolutely none. The main purpose of this campaign is to fund the comic print run first, rather than trying to make back its production costs through sales. This way allows for contributors to be apart of it’s creation, while getting perks on the side. It’s more personal when we make this comic together.

story:
Update August 9th: Printer's proof is here

Just wanted to let you guys know that I just got the proof from the printer. On first inspection it looks amazing. So thank you again for making this come true!

 

 

Short Summary

I'm a professional graphic designer and have been an active member of the Montréal comic book scene for over 20 years. I've published 5 small press comics in the past. Although these were fun projects, I have been yearning to produce a high-quality colour book.

My current project, the Tales from the Interface webcomic, has received a ton of positive feedback and upon multiple requests, I am now planning to print the first 3 chapters in this first issue. This includes pages which are not yet on the website. 

If, like me, you love classic science-fiction, fantasy and horror, you will love Tales from the Interface! I'm really looking forward to holding in my hands the first issue of Tales from the Interface. This first book will contain over 40 highly-detailed pages of comics as well as bonuses such as illustrations, tips and tricks... 

 

Why should you back this project?

This initial funding will be used to print a first run of the comic. I am also offering signed books with doodles or full-fledged commissions. There is no risk to you: even if I don't reach my goal, I pledge to fulfill all orders made during the indiegogo campaign. I need to print a reasonable number of copies to meet my target price, but if I don't get enough orders on this page, I will assume part of the cost myself and sell the remaining comics in stores and conventions.

 

Bonuses

The book will contain a ton of bonus content.

  • Unreleased illustrations from various projects
  • Tips and tricks on frequently asked questions such as resolution, process of creating a page, silhouetting and much more...

 

Stretch goals

  • $600: Original drawing
    I will give away this original drawing of King Krab to one of my backers selected by chance.
  • $700: Dust-jackets
    I will add a dust jacket to every book. I'm thinking of a silk-screen print. I will share details when the goal has been reached.
  • More to come as the campaign continues.

 

Risks & Challenges

There isn't much risk associated with this campaign. As I mentioned earlier, I will print less copies of the book if I have to. Pages are completely finished, the book has been assembled in Indesign by me (I'm a professional graphic designer) and even the pre-press has been pre-checked by a professional. I've also confirmed pricing with a well known printer who produced books for many artist in the Montréal community. 
The point of this campaign is really to gather pre-orders and hopefully lower the cost per unit.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign financially I completely understand. But you can really help by talking to your friends about this project or sharing this page on your social media circle.
