story:
Summary

My Name is Terence Jones
I am a Honors student in Biochemistry and for the past 6 years i have been working on a Comic book that i have finally started writing.

I started Armoured Penguin this year to act as a publishing company to publish my first Boardgame 'Here Be Dragons!' as well as my First comic book that i hope to start publishing next year.

While trying to get my Comic to a point were i can start publishing i looked at a number of known Comic book publishers.

I found that all comic publishers have a few things in common:
1. Do not accept unsolicitated submissions
2. Do not accept story concepts or drafts without an attached Artist and at least 3-5 completed pages
3. Rarely accept Freelance artists without them being attached to projects.
4. Even if you have fulfilled number 2 the chances of being published are VERY rare

So the aim of Armoured Penguin is to cut through this red tape.
The Aims of Armoured Penguin are as follows:
1. Having Open submissions for a minimum 4 months a year
2. Have a Range of in house Artists that a writer can talk to and work with
3. Work with the Writer to polish the story to get the best from their Ideas

How will Armoured Penguin reach these Aims?

Aim 1:
1. Having Open submissions for a minimum 4 months a year
Submissions will run on a three month cycle
Submissions will be open for 1 month. Followed by 1 month of reviewing and a  month of talking with owner of the work.

Established projects will be exempt from the cycle and new pieces can be submitted at any time.

Aim 2:
2. Have a Range of in house Artists that a writer can talk to and work with

So far I have compiled a list of 6 artists who are interested in the project and to take on new projects from new writers.
Three of the artists are Mainstream published
and Two are self-published

Aim 3:
3. Work with the Writer to polish the story to get the best from their Ideas

So often a writer will read over their own work and think 'This is fantastic everyone will love this'
However the sad truth is the manuscript has major plot holes, things turning up suddenly and spelling and grammer mistakes all over the place.
While this is not always a bad thing 'Writers blindness' can seriously hamper a story.
During the review month the story will be read by someone who is impartial to the writers ideas and will make every effort to find plot holes and point out any problems the story may have and help the writer to fix anything major.


                                                      AIM 4:
To treat every writer as a person and as an individual.
Every Comic company that accepts submissions will only ever tell you that they are interested. Armoured Penguin aims to tell everyone what they thought of the story and what potential they see for it even if Armoured Penguin doesn't take on the project.
Every writer deserves to know that their interest is valued.


The Website
  • The Website will be the First stop for anyone interested in Armoured Penguin and so will probably give the first impression.

    For this reason i wish to make the website the best it can be to encourage People to publish their Comics through Armoured Penguin

You're Contribution will help to build a website as a strong foundation for the building of a Comic book publisher that cares about their writers and will help them take their idea from the rough notebook that's falling apart at the binding to a glossy comic in your hands.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Q: How much is needed
  • A: $500
  • Q: How will the funds be used
  • A: The funds will be used to pay for web hosting of the Site, An updated Logo and website design
  • Funds Breakdown
  • $60 Webhosting
  • $70 Logo update
  • $250 Website Design and building
  • $70 re-registering of the buisness for 3 years

Any extra funds will be used to register extra Domain names after that extra funds will be used to fund the artwork for the prologue of my comic that will be released to contributers before anyone else

if the target of $400 is not meet the first priority of the funds raised will go towards Webhosting followed by Updating the logo

The Impact

The Impact of the Sight will help to advertise Armoured Penguin to the people that visit as well as advertise the projects being undertaken by Armoured Penguin.

The presence of the website will help to encourage Indy Comic artists and writers to publish through a company that cares about the project more then the profit.

Because Armoured Penguin was created in the hopes of Publishing my own Comic i understand the difficulties writers and artists have when trying to publish their own comics.

How You Can Help

Other ways you can help Armoured Penguin
Donations are a great way to help make the website a reality but its by no means the only way.
Check out Armoured Penguin on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Armoured-Penguin/330832863694344

Tell your Friends
Tell someone you know who wants to publish a comic
Help spread the word and make the Armoured Penguin website a reality for people interested in Comic books
story_txt:
SummaryMy Name is Terence JonesI am a Honors student in Biochemistry and for the past 6 years i have been working on a Comic book that i have finally started writing.I started Armoured Penguin this year to act as a publishing company to publish my first Boardgame 'Here Be Dragons!' as well as my First comic book that i hope to start publishing next year.While trying to get my Comic to a point were i can start publishing i looked at a number of known Comic book publishers.I found that all comic publishers have a few things in common:1. Do not accept unsolicitated submissions2. Do not accept story concepts or drafts without an attached Artist and at least 3-5 completed pages3. Rarely accept Freelance artists without them being attached to projects.4. Even if you have fulfilled number 2 the chances of being published are VERY rareSo the aim of Armoured Penguin is to cut through this red tape.The Aims of Armoured Penguin are as follows:1. Having Open submissions for a minimum 4 months a year 2. Have a Range of in house Artists that a writer can talk to and work with3. Work with the Writer to polish the story to get the best from their IdeasHow will Armoured Penguin reach these Aims?Aim 1:1. Having Open submissions for a minimum 4 months a year Submissions will run on a three month cycleSubmissions will be open for 1 month. Followed by 1 month of reviewing and a  month of talking with owner of the work. Established projects will be exempt from the cycle and new pieces can be submitted at any time.Aim 2:2. Have a Range of in house Artists that a writer can talk to and work withSo far I have compiled a list of 6 artists who are interested in the project and to take on new projects from new writers.Three of the artists are Mainstream publishedand Two are self-published Aim 3:3. Work with the Writer to polish the story to get the best from their IdeasSo often a writer will read over their own work and think 'This is fantastic everyone will love this'However the sad truth is the manuscript has major plot holes, things turning up suddenly and spelling and grammer mistakes all over the place.While this is not always a bad thing 'Writers blindness' can seriously hamper a story.During the review month the story will be read by someone who is impartial to the writers ideas and will make every effort to find plot holes and point out any problems the story may have and help the writer to fix anything major.                                                      AIM 4:To treat every writer as a person and as an individual.Every Comic company that accepts submissions will only ever tell you that they are interested. Armoured Penguin aims to tell everyone what they thought of the story and what potential they see for it even if Armoured Penguin doesn't take on the project.Every writer deserves to know that their interest is valued.The WebsiteThe Website will be the First stop for anyone interested in Armoured Penguin and so will probably give the first impression.For
 this reason i wish to make the website the best it can be to encourage 
People to publish their Comics through Armoured PenguinYou're Contribution will help to build a website as a strong foundation for the building of a Comic book publisher that cares about their writers and will help them take their idea from the rough notebook that's falling apart at the binding to a glossy comic in your hands.What We Need & What You Get
Q: How much is needed 

A: $500
Q: How will the funds be used
A: The funds will be used to pay for web hosting of the Site, An updated Logo and website design
Funds Breakdown
$60 Webhosting
$70 Logo update
$250 Website Design and building
$70 re-registering of the buisness for 3 years

Any extra funds will be used to register extra Domain names after that extra funds will be used to fund the artwork for the prologue of my comic that will be released to contributers before anyone elseif the target of $400 is not meet the first priority of the funds raised will go towards Webhosting followed by Updating the logoThe ImpactThe Impact of the Sight will help to advertise Armoured Penguin to the people that visit as well as advertise the projects being undertaken by Armoured Penguin.The presence of the website will help to encourage Indy Comic artists and writers to publish through a company that cares about the project more then the profit.Because Armoured Penguin was created in the hopes of Publishing my own Comic i understand the difficulties writers and artists have when trying to publish their own comics.How You Can HelpOther ways you can help Armoured PenguinDonations are a great way to help make the website a reality but its by no means the only way.Check out Armoured Penguin on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/pages/Armoured-Penguin/330832863694344Tell your FriendsTell someone you know who wants to publish a comic Help spread the word and make the Armoured Penguin website a reality for people interested in Comic books

story:
What We Need & What You Get

The Nitty Gritty

We are asking for $5,000.00 to finish the project with a stretch goal of $40,000.00 and $1,000.00 contingency. This includes  the cost to finish the art by the artist and some other funds for publication and marketing.

  • $1,000.00 for Brad and me to finish the comic
  • $3,000.00 to setup production for inital run of comic
  • $1,000.00 to cover supplies, and contract fees.

    • STRETCH GOALS
  • $20,000.00 for first full year of Comic.
  • $10,000.00 for marketing promotion items
  • $5,000.00 for bonus reward plushy (if stretch goal succeeds)
  • $5,000.00 for fees and contengicy

 

The Story

 

THUNDERGODS:

Thor and the Battle for Asgard

-Story Overview

 

 

Issue 1- “The Attack of Asgard”

Asgard has been attacked, ravaged by the Dark Elves; it means war. Thor, stranded and stripped of most of his powers, must fight through The Nine Realms, reclaim his powers and save his family members, warped and controlled by the Dark Elves themselves. The forces of the Realms are at stake.

 

Issue 2- “Heavens fall from Earth”

Asgard lies in ruins, and Thor finds no clues as to where the Dark Elves have vanished. In despair, he heads for Vanaheim to meet his friends. But when it too comes under attack, he uses his mighty strength and new powers to defeat those foes and capture one of the Elfish hordes. After getting the information needed, he learns that the Aesir are being made sickly and are losing their great strength. Thor fights to restore them, but it is of no use as the Dark Elves invade the gates and enter Midgard, calling it “The Great Feast of the World Eater.”

 

Issue 3- “Thor, Defender of Earth”

Thor has a different plan and successfully repels the Dark Elves from Midgard, rescuing humanity in the process. He spends the night there to replenish his energy when he hears the calling of the Frost Giants and leaves for Jotunheim in a flash.

 

Issue 4- “Broken Family”

At Jotunheim, he finds not only hundreds of dead Frost Giants but an enraged Ysmir, the leader of the Frost Giants, blaming Thor for the death of his city. After defeating Ysmir, Thor vows vengeance on the Dark Elves and swears to never stop fighting until he finds the source of all this chaos.

 

Issue 5- “The Demons Wake”

He heads to Muspelheim, Land of the Demons. He confronts Surtur here, looking for information on the Dark Elves’ plans. Thor learns that they wish to destroy Aesir and recreate the world in their image. After he defeats Surtur’s hordes, he seeks the help of the wise Dwarves at Nidavellir.

 

 

Issue 6 - “The Echo of Stonewall Mountains”

Nidavellir is attacked by the Dark Elves also, signifying to Thor that something must be following him but is strangely always one step in advance. He is given new abilities and great technology by the Dwarves, and he prepares himself for one last stop before he reaches the Dark Elves.

 

Issue 7- “To Hel and Back”

He visits Hel, the Underworld, and wishes for great power by Death herself. After proving himself in combat, she grants him never-ending life, at the cost that he may never enter paradise and will have to fight the World Eater to prove himself worthy at Ragnarok.

 

Issue 8- “A Final Battle, A New Beginning”

Now truly Immortal and powerful beyond belief, Thor goes straight to Svartalfheim, The Realm of the Dark Elves. Facing Dokka, their leader, he engages in a brutal cosmological fight, and proves himself to be champion of Asgard. With Dokka dead and his friends rescued, he now has time to slumber until the day of Ragnarok, where he will have to repay his debt to Hel.

 

Short Summary

We are developing a comic book franchise based on the Thundergods from around the world: Thor, Zeus, and Perun, just to name a few.

  • Ryan Waller, owner of Forthright Entertainment
  • Brad Moore, comic artist drawing comics and game art for over 15 years
  • Sean Northridge, comic writer.

The Launch of Thundergods means so much to us to finally see our vision come to life for the fans. We are taking a unique look at the eras of mythology and can't wait for others to enjoy and share in the process with us.

What contributors are helping us to achieve is to launch a new line of comics that promise to excite and garner steam.  The comic is also going to be included in a new video game under the Thundergods brand as well.

 

 

The Impact

We have launched multiple games and have completed films in the past

  • Ryan's IMDB page http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1177265/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1
  • One of Brad's art pages http://shinryoga.deviantart.com/
  • Spot the Difference Game http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QYWbLW157rc

Other Ways You Can Help

Wanna help but don’t have $$$ to donate? No problem! We would love any help at all.

  • Please tell folks to get the word out and make some noise about the Thundergods Comic campaign.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
  • Share links on Facebook on your timeline or on your friends’ walls!

We look forward to seeing this goal through and appreciate your support and help!

ART

Characters

THOR

Thor is a god of thunder, son of Odin and a member of the Aesir sub-group of the Norse gods. Thor's wife is Sif. He smashed giants' heads with his mighty throwing hammer, Mjolnir. Thor is often compared with the Greek thunder god Zeus. The English fifth day of the week is named Thursday after Thor (Thor's Day).

Thor posseses 3 important objects:

"The first is a hammer, which both the Frost and the Mountain giants know to their cost, when they see it hurled against them in the air, for it has split many a skull of their fathers and kindred. When thrown, it returns to his hand of its own accord. The second rare thing he possesses is called the belt of strength. When he girds it about him his divine might is doubled. The third, also very precious, is his iron gloves, which he puts on whenever he would use his mallet efficiently."
Source: Bulfinch - Norse Mythology

The Impact
We have launched multiple games and have completed films in the past



Ryan's IMDB page http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1177265/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

One of Brad's art pages http://shinryoga.deviantart.com/

Spot the Difference Game http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QYWbLW157rc




Other Ways You Can Help
Wanna help but don’t have $$$ to donate? No problem! We would love any help at all.

Please tell folks to get the word out and make some noise about the Thundergods Comic campaign.
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
Share links on Facebook on your timeline or on your friends’ walls!


We look forward to seeing this goal through and appreciate your support and help!

The third, also very precious, is his iron gloves, which he puts on whenever he would use his mallet efficiently." Source: Bulfinch - Norse Mythology

story:
Short Summary

BNG is an artist specializing in erotic furry artwork of the big, the buff, and the downright extraordinary! For the first time, Club Stripes/Hot Cider Press is proud to present a suitably sizeable collection of BNG's male color works in book form, and we want your help to do it!

The book is slated to be 92 pages long, containing the color version of BNG's short comic "The Outing," originally published in Cocktails: Hard and Strong, plus the complete Club Stripes-exclusive collection of BNG's male art with all-new commentary by the artist.


(Cover not final)

As an Indiegogo exclusive, we will also be releasing a limited edition 8GB 16GB USB flash drive, decorated with a swishing fox's tail by BNG! The flash drive will come preloaded with high-res PSDs of the art contained in the book and a screen-resolution PDF version of the book itself. No more will be produced after this Indiegogo fundraiser ends, so make sure to pledge now!


(Image not final)

Please note that this project contains adult-oriented content and you must be 18+ years of age to receive pledge materials. Club Stripes/Hot Cider Press and BNG cannot be responsible for the local laws in your area.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding breaks down like this:

Base goal - Yay! We can print books and make the USB drives for all Indiegogo supporters who want some. We will also have enough books to sell a few at Anthrocon for those who didn't get to participate here. The base goal covers printing books to cover the backers plus a few extra copies for sale at conventions, USB drive making, shipping costs of the books/merch to us, and buying postage and packaging.

Stretch Goals!

All stretch goal bonus material will be included in both the physical book, as well as the digital PDF in the download and USB tiers!


  FUNDED!

$2000 - Character Bio and Q&A featuring all-new art of Orbitas (Malamute/Dragon Hybrid)

  FUNDED!
$2400 - Character Bio and Q&A featuring all-new art ofJanus! (Cat)

  FUNDED!
$2800 - Character Bio and Q&A featuring all-new art of Big Willy! (Lion)

  FUNDED!
$3200 - Character Bio and Q&A featuring all-new art of Calvin! (Dog) with special guest, Mike! (Cat)

  FUNDED!
$3600 - Character Bio and Q&A featuring all-new art of Griggle! (Horse/Doberman/Dragon Hybrid)

  FUNDED!!!1

$6000 - Final Stretch Goal! BNG is selecting ten images from his online galleries to be added to the book, with the accompanying high-res PSDs to be added to the exclusive USB flash drive. Flash drive size will also be increased from 8GB to 16GB! (This book's so massive, we'll definitely need it!) If we hit our goal, we're also throwing in a PDF copy of the book for everyone who donates at least $10 or more!

    Risks & Challenges

    We at Club Stripes/Hot Cider Press have been producing books and digital content for the furry/anthro community for the past ten years. While we try to accommodate as much of our production risks as possible, we acknowledge there is always a slight risk of problems in production, and keep backup companies in mind for production assistance in the unlikely event of a problem in manufacturing. The biggest risk is that the books cannot arrive in time for the convention, but our current printer is highly reliable and as long as our files are turned in by the time specified, they have been reliably early, rather than late. :)

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you don't participate in our Indiegogo campaign, we appreciate you spreading the word! Let's get this book made!

The biggest risk is that the books cannot arrive in time for the convention, but our current printer is highly reliable and as long as our files are turned in by the time specified, they have been reliably early, rather than late. :)
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you don't participate in our Indiegogo campaign, we appreciate you spreading the word! Let's get this book made!

story:
THE HIDDEN HERO COMIC BOOK & MOBILE APP

The Hidden Hero is a Comic Book that get's you actively involved in the Heroes Journey. The comic book gives instant access to the reader who can train along side the Heroes and learn how to activate their own Natural Powers with Mobile Applications.

Now thanks to this crowdfunder we will have the opportunity to share their stories with all of YOU! That's where you all come in. Help us to co-create these Real Life Comic Book adventures.

1. DONATE! The karma of Donating will be felt instantly for supporting real life heroes and their remarkable stories.

2. Get your friends and family to donate! The whole community can get involved and everyones a winner!

3. BLAST this on FaceBook, Twitter and other Social Networks. It's high time we take control of our community to once again be in balance with the Forces of Nature.

Our mission is to raise money for these comic books and matching mobile applications. We want people not only to read the comics but to become the Hero/Heroine of the story. In the comic books we will go deeper into the origin stories of these heroes and learn how they activated their own Natural Powers and changed their universe.

We are all born with these Natural Powers! Although not as exaggerated as we see in commercial comics and movies, they are still just as EXTRAORDINARY none-the-less.

My name is Andrew Morrissey, my friends call me Mr. M. 

I am the co-director of the Universal Heroes which is a non-profit organisation dedicated to activating heroes. Here is a sample of my work with D'jedi hero David Beaudry. I have been lucky in my life I have trained with some of the best Martial Artists, Yogis, Tibetan Monks, D'jedi's and Masters of the Force. With over 18 years of training experience I recently turned my talents to finding other real life heroes.

This is my first solo project since the successful creation of the Universal Heroes and I am really excited by the possibilities. I have been travelling the world for the last three years searching for a league of heroes who were just waiting for their stories to be revealed.

The idea came to me after I had just started up the Universal Heroes. 

While randomly searching on YouTube, I came across Stan Lee's Super-Humans and the Real Life Super Hero Project. Then I realized that this was the birth of a global movement, the Comic Book culture had been preparing us with the Super Hero Mythos to empower ordinary citizens to take control of their Universe.

Then I had what alcoholics like to call 'A Moment of Clarity.' I need to make a COMIC BOOK! 

In a Flash of Brilliance I had discovered my Next Mission here on Planet Earth. Through this clarity I then began to organize my 18 years of experience into a story which I have almost completed. This will be the very first ever interactive comic book that allows you to train along side your favourite heroes and learn how to unlock your Natural Powers, tapping into your unlimited potential.

In issue #1 we are introduced to Red Phoenix: Andrea Sullivan. Dr D: David Beaudry. Deva-Liminal: Jami Deva.

In The Hidden Hero issue #1 we will explore the defining moment when Mr M fully-activated his D'jedi Mind Training with his masters in China Town for 7 years. We will film the first Mobile Application 'D'jedi Activation' in Angkor Watt, Cambodia.

D'jedi Activation: The D’Jedi Activation is a training to unlock the codes of Self-Mastery within. We utilize ancient practices and modern technology, to re-boot and “Wake Up” inside the matrix, with full remembrance of who we are, and our Mission here on Planet Earth.

This style of story telling using real life heroes and interactive mobile applications to learn their special powers has never been attempted before and that's what makes this project so unique and EXCITING! 

Your contributions for this crowdfunder will go directly to the costs of creating the comic book, T-shirt printing, mobile application development and expenses for our crew to travel to these exotic locations. The cost of our comic book artists and printing stands at $6000 and the travelling expenses the crew need to film these mobile applications is $6000.

If we move past the crowdfunding amount then we will put the extra funds towards the creation of issue #1 #2 #3. I currently have a list of 10 Heroes that I would like to work with from around the world and I would be honoured if you would allow our team to tell their remarkable stories. 

Here is a sample below from Gabriel Santiago. We will be updating NEW Drawings every week as the Campaign HEATS UP!

The Hidden Hero issue #2.

In issue two we will go deeper into the origin stories of Red Phoenix: Andrea Sullivan. Andrea has been training in the ancient Ninja and Universal Healing Arts since the age of 5. This episode we will track Andrea to her birth place in The USA. Also we will film another mobile application at Angkor Watt in Cambodia. This will expose us to Andrea's unique abilities with Phoenix Healing and the 5 Elemental Qigong Forms.

The Hidden Hero issue #3.

let's keep revealing these amazing HEROES!!! This stretch goal will unlock the stories and mysteries surrounding Deva-Liminal: Jami Deva. We will go deeper into the origin story of Jami's training and promotional tours with one of the largest touring groups on the planet, the Supreme Science Qigong Foundation. We will travel to Bali, Indonesia to film the iPhone/Android Application to share his amazing Talents in the D'jedi Arts.

The Hidden Hero Documentary.

In this stretch goal I will create a documentary of the Hidden Hero. I will travel with our Crew back to the USA and track Down more Hidden Heroes. Also we will go deeper with the Origin story of David Beaudry and track his progress as he activates the modern day D'jedi with his Team in the USA.

"I believe comic books are our last link to an ancient form of passing on History. The Egyptians drew on walls, countries from all around the world still pass on knowledge through pictorial forms. I believe comics are a form of history that some one some where felt or experienced." Mr. Glass -Unbreakable.

THANK YOU! PLEASE SHARE & COMMENT.

We are all born with these Natural Powers! Although not as exaggerated as we see in commercial comics and movies, they are still just as EXTRAORDINARY none-the-less.

My name is Andrew Morrissey, my friends call me Mr. M. 
I am the co-director of the Universal Heroes which is a non-profit organisation dedicated to activating heroes. Here is a sample of my work with D'jedi hero David Beaudry. I have been lucky in my life I have trained with some of the best Martial Artists, Yogis, Tibetan Monks, D'jedi's and Masters of the Force. With over 18 years of training experience I recently turned my talents to finding other real life heroes.
This is my first solo project since the successful creation of the Universal Heroes and I am really excited by the possibilities. I have been travelling the world for the last three years searching for a league of heroes who were just waiting for their stories to be revealed.

The idea came to me after I had just started up the Universal Heroes. 
While randomly searching on YouTube, I came across Stan Lee's Super-Humans and the Real Life Super Hero Project. Then I realized that this was the birth of a global movement, the Comic Book culture had been preparing us with the Super Hero Mythos to empower ordinary citizens to take control of their Universe.
Then I had what alcoholics like to call 'A Moment of Clarity.' I need to make a COMIC BOOK! 
In a Flash of Brilliance I had discovered my Next Mission here on Planet Earth. Through this clarity I then began to organize my 18 years of experience into a story which I have almost completed. This will be the very first ever interactive comic book that allows you to train along side your favourite heroes and learn how to unlock your Natural Powers, tapping into your unlimited potential.

In issue #1 we are introduced to Red Phoenix: Andrea Sullivan. Dr D: David Beaudry. Deva-Liminal: Jami Deva.
In The Hidden Hero issue #1 we will explore the defining moment when Mr M fully-activated his D'jedi Mind Training with his masters in China Town for 7 years. We will film the first Mobile Application 'D'jedi Activation' in Angkor Watt, Cambodia.
D'jedi Activation: The D’Jedi Activation is a training to unlock the codes of Self-Mastery within. We utilize ancient practices and modern technology, to re-boot and “Wake Up” inside the matrix, with full remembrance of who we are, and our Mission here on Planet Earth.

This style of story telling using real life heroes and interactive mobile applications to learn their special powers has never been attempted before and that's what makes this project so unique and EXCITING! 

Your contributions for this crowdfunder will go directly to the costs of creating the comic book, T-shirt printing, mobile application development and expenses for our crew to travel to these exotic locations. The cost of our comic book artists and printing stands at $6000 and the travelling expenses the crew need to film these mobile applications is $6000.
If we move past the crowdfunding amount then we will put the extra funds towards the creation of issue #1 #2 #3. I currently have a list of 10 Heroes that I would like to work with from around the world and I would be honoured if you would allow our team to tell their remarkable stories. 
Here is a sample below from Gabriel Santiago. We will be updating NEW Drawings every week as the Campaign HEATS UP!

The Hidden Hero issue #2. 
In issue two we will go deeper into the origin stories of Red Phoenix: Andrea Sullivan. Andrea has been training in the ancient Ninja and Universal Healing Arts since the age of 5. This episode we will track Andrea to her birth place in The USA. Also we will film another mobile application at Angkor Watt in Cambodia. This will expose us to Andrea's unique abilities with Phoenix Healing and the 5 Elemental Qigong Forms.

The Hidden Hero issue #3.
let's keep revealing these amazing HEROES!!! This stretch goal will unlock the stories and mysteries surrounding Deva-Liminal: Jami Deva. We will go deeper into the origin story of Jami's training and promotional tours with one of the largest touring groups on the planet, the Supreme Science Qigong Foundation. We will travel to Bali, Indonesia to film the iPhone/Android Application to share his amazing Talents in the D'jedi Arts.

The Hidden Hero Documentary.
In this stretch goal I will create a documentary of the Hidden Hero. I will travel with our Crew back to the USA and track Down more Hidden Heroes. Also we will go deeper with the Origin story of David Beaudry and track his progress as he activates the modern day D'jedi with his Team in the USA.

"I believe comic books are our last link to an ancient form of passing on History. The Egyptians drew on walls, countries from all around the world still pass on knowledge through pictorial forms. I believe comics are a form of history that some one some where felt or experienced." Mr. Glass -Unbreakable.
THANK YOU! PLEASE SHARE & COMMENT.

story:
Short Summary

Hi all, my name is Barry Duffield. I'm an actor, screenwriter, and graphic novelist. Some of you may know me as Lugo from the TV series Spartacus: Blood and Sand and others as D.I Dave Woods from Shortland Street.

My first graphic novel Deadman's Land has received some pretty impressive critical acclaim and become a quarter finalist in the prestigious Final Draft Big Break and Scriptapalooza screenwriting competitions. I've been hard at work on my follow up graphic novel 'Tandoori Apocalypse'. Issue #1: Bombay Rounding. It has been completed and is a perk on this campaign. Now it's time to launch into issue #2 of the four issue series and I need your help in getting there.

Tandoori Apocalypse is above all a horror/comedy thrill ride, but it is also a look at the diverse society we live in; with it's two Hindu anti-heroes. It was important for me to tell this story outside of the stereotypical hero archetypes. I'd like to thank my friends Raj and Tarun for opening my eyes to a different world. Without you guys I may have never started this journey.

Each and every contribution you amazing people give will see the fruition of a dream built over decades, so in advance, I thank you from the bottom of my heart.  


What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $8,500 to get the artwork, colouring, and lettering completed. 
  • You guys will not only get issue #1 of the digital graphic novel 'Tandoori Apocalypse', but you'll also get a digital copy of my five star rated graphic novel 'Deadman's Land', and exclusive cover art from both novels.
  • Every dollar raised will go toward issue #2 and anything above that will go toward issue #3.

The Impact

  • Tandoori Apocalypse celebrates cultural diversity in a unique and fun way. You will fall in love with the wanna-be romantic Raj and the big hearted clutz Vimal, you will laugh and cry at the antics of the other survivors stuck in the corner store only days before the Earths inevitable fall to a Vampire plague.
  • Richard Taylor (Weta Studios) had this to say about my previous graphic novel 'Deadman's Land' "An inventive, blood-soaked horror show; begging to be made into a live action film" ~ Sir Richard Taylor
  • When you decide to help; your decision changes a life for the better.

Risks & Challenges

  • There are always inherant risks when you undertake creative endevours, but I have faced these and overcome them before - This time will be no different..
  • There are no problems; only solutions. With your help I shall succeed in bringing issue #2 to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

     *  If you can't help financially a share would be greatly appreciated.

     *  Please use the Indiegogo "share tools" to get the word out.

story:
LONG STORY SHORT

You're only here if you know what All Superheroes Must Die is. Do you want to see a six issue graphic novel of the heroes origins? Their first world wide battle with Rickshaw? How they got their powers? What, "The Four" really means? Do you know what "The Masters of the World" is?

Contribute and find out!

Mark Poulton and I (Jason Trost) wrote a six issue comic for an "unnamed" comic company. Right before our comic was set to be drawn, "politics" killed the book out of nowhere. But we enjoy the story so much that we're not taking, "No" for an answer. We want to make the comic ourselves!

Your contributions will help us get the first issue completed. Drawn, colored, printed, etc. Because unlike comic companies, I want to actually f**king pay the artists who work their asses off for me. 

Our artist is locked, loaded and ready to go. He is Gavin Smith. Check him out here... http://gavinpatricksmith.blogspot.com/

...Upon completion of the first issue, we will shop it and the remaining scripts around to get the entire book funded.

And trust me, this will give you all the back story you ever wanted, as well as a bunch of s**t you never even knew you wanted.

You ever want to say, "F**K the man?!" Well here at Team Grindfist, that is our motto. So from the very bottom of our hearts, please help us F**K the man!

story:
On April 17th we will begin shooting photos for our first Comic book for the Viseratta series. We are bringing the book characters to life. There will be a 250 limited edition print run of the first comic along with a pdf e-book file available.

Only 50 will have an extra insert hand signed.

Enter into the world of the Viseratta, the first Comic book edition by Ellen Griffin based off the Viseratta series.

There are unexplainable things that happen in this world, these are the things that change us forever

The Viseratta Series

By Ellen Griffin

There are things in this world we will never understand, in darkness there is a madness that overtakes all human instinct. Leaving behind the ideals we know, and entering into a primal world of the Viseratta.

Viseratta is a paranormal tale of a transformation into darkness, horror, strength and the truth about the humanity. The true nature of what we are and what we can become, there is always a choice.

Ari has always been different but after a series of unexplainable terrifying events she comes face to face with what she truly is. For Ari and her friends, life as they know it will never be the same, when they get pulled into a world were nothing and no one is what they seem.

As the darkness clears and the secrets of the Viseratta unfold, they face the deadly creatures forged from fire, in an epic struggle that spans several generations between humans and demons.


About The Cover Artist:

Featuring Comic and cover Artist Jonathan Hatcher,

Born and raised in Boones Mill, Virginia, Johnathan Hatcher is a published illustrator, tattoo artist, and graphic designer. Previously working for Litter Box Comics on “A Necessary Evil”.

He now specializes in custom tattoo's ranging from cartoon to realism and has been inking at Cherry bomb tattoos since 2006.

Currently, he has been re-recruited back into the comic world for the first release of the Viseratta Comic.

http://theskinpainter.com/johnathan-hatcher


_______________________________________________________________________

About The Author:

Fantasy Artist Ellen Griffin

Born on the New Jersey shore early enough to remember the 80's and big hair days and smart enough to hide all those embarrassing pictures. Then transplanted to the good ole' southern State of Virginia.

Currently a fantasy art artist and author, which is a pretty cool gig considering the fact she can change people into most any type of creature in a digital picture. However, one should not forget the not so hilarious sarcasm of hiding people of whom she has had differences with in her books. While most do make for some very interesting characters they do seem to meet some unusual fates. It does, however, make for some good reads!

Visit Ellen Griffin's web site at www.viseratta.com


About The Comic Artist:

Comic Artist Daniel Kelly

We have no idea where he came from. He originally just showed up one day to sing in a band. Currently, a Graphic Artist with a taste and flare for Anime Art.

Daniel was brought in to balance out the Viseratta Comic art, mixing the Heavy Metal style with Fantasy and Anime to make for a very interesting finished product.

He is currently banned from using any squid or octopus in the finished product.

www.facebook.com/daniel.kelley.5030


Introducing Ashley Russell as the lead character "Ari "



What We Need & What You Get

All of the work required to create the Viseratta Comic is currently being done and some initial work has already been completed. Our next shoot is April 17th to bring the main characters to life and then the artists will do what they do best. We just need a little more capital to actually print and manufacture the finished product. Our target is to raise $2,400.00 to make The Viseratta Comic a reality.

The cost break-down is:

  1. Printing - Layouts - Art= $1,400.00

  2. Costs of Perks = $600.00 and shipping of perks

  3. Cushion = IndieGoGo takes a commission + a unexpected thing or two

Make an Impact:

In order to get published one has to be published, and so with our cool perks and your sponsorship everyone wins. Lets make this happen!


Other Ways You Can Help:

Do you know someone who might like to be involved in our project? Please let them know!

You can use Indiegogo's "Share Tools" to get the word out and help make this endeavor a success.

Thank you

Additional Goals:

If we make our target goal everyone who purchases a perk will receive a thank you credit in the sponsor page of our website www.viseratta.com, an automatic credit in the comic book, and a PDF download of the comic.

Fantasy shoots are available in Roanoke, Bedford, Lynchburg,Boones Mills Virginia only. One person per photo 

Shoots can be booked Starting from a week after cleared indiegogo payments anytime during the year of 2014. Costumes and props provided.Photos are available to download within 2 weeks of shoot in both large and small formats.

Any questions about a shoot email to viseratta@yahoo.com

story:
For the first time in hundreds of years, Finn's legend is retold. Forged anew from the breath of the storyteller, but this time it's different... This time the fireside is the modern world. This time, it's in the form of a Graphic Novel. Now you have the chance to become part of that heroic quest, the journey of immortality, by remembering - The Nobility of our Irish Heroes.

The second coming ... As some of you may know, this campaign is our second in the wave of funding needed for the production of the Finn McCool graphic novel series. In 2013 we raised a fantastic $12,501 from Irish Celtic fans the world over, with donations from eight different countries, from $5 to a staggering $5000. This is the passion that others saw in our vision to bring the greatest warrior ancient Ireland ever knew onto the world platform of heroes. Now YOU have the chance to make a stand as they have, by helping us recreate the magic of the Irish celtic world. But firstly, for those of you who may not know, who was Finn McCool?

Finn was the legendary protector of Ireland and Chief of The Fianna, the elite bodyguard to the High Kings of Ireland. Finn and The Fianna's heroic adventures and deeds are well known within the Irish community and if you reference, Finn McCool, you will see, not only the vast amount of links to his mythology, but also the many pubs, restaurants, organizations and clubs, that celebrate his noble name. What you will not see, is the Graphic Novel of the hero, that, my friends, is about to change. 

The time has come to honour our ancient Irish heroes and in the highest way possible - by putting their fine names on the lips of true clansmen and women the world over. Part of our vision for the novel is for young men and women to read them, as well as adults, to learn more about their heritage, rites of passage and initiations into adulthood, something we feel is sadly lacking in today's world. 

The stories of Finn McCool do just that, they teach. This is part of the drive behind the graphic novel series, also to showcase the real heroes of our past, rather than the constant "Superman v Batman" overkill. This is an original project, a one off, you can be part of this fantastic journey.

We are producing of the Hardcover Original Graphic Novel, featuring the retelling of Finn’s origin. In order to hire the best writers, pencillers, inkers, colourists and letterers in the business to bring this vision to life, we need your support. Our plan is to raise the money to be able to hire top-notch creative talent from the comic and graphic novel field and to partner with an American Comic Book publisher, Archaia, in order to distribute the graphic novel to comic and bookstores across the world.  

  

Above we see Fiacuil, Finn's warrior mentor and the dreaded, Goll Mc Morna, the man who murders Finn's father, a conflict indeed!

Above is Saba Priestess of the underworld and Finn's true love. Saba first comes to Finn in the form of a white deer, cursed so by the dark lord of the underworld. Finn lifts the curse and we see here, Saba transformed back into the beautiful woman she is.

Below is the magical druid Finegas, another wise mentor of Finn's. He teaches Finn the value of the earth and the magic that she holds. Finegas also catches the fames, "Salomon of knowledge."

"You've seen the Movies 'Braveheart', 'Rob Roy', 'Highlander' and recently, the Pixar animation, 'Brave'.  All great and have one thing in common; they're Scottish. The magic, power and beauty that is Irish Story and Myth has seemingly been overlooked by Hollywood and the world, but not any longer - Irish legends and its Heroes deserve a place in our hearts with the graphic novel and up on the Big Screen.

Below we see the Boy Finn's first day of warrior initiation with his wild mentor, Fiacuil.

This ground breaking project will lead the way in the reemergence of the Irish Celtic Warrior Heroes. It will become part of your story, your history, not only for you, but for your ancestors. By honouring them, you honour the past, by honouring the past, you become the hero ...

Below we see Finn's first encounter with the magical druid, Finegas.

Together we can forge a new wave of Heroes ... and this time it's IRISH and the Greatest Irish Hero there ever was, Finn McCool. 

Below we see the moment that Finn is forced to face death, in more ways than one .

           "When you are dust, how will you be remembered?"

By supporting this project you will literally create for yourself, and kin, a lasting legacy that you can feel deeply proud of. Part of what the Finn McCool stories stand for, is the mentoring and initiation of our youth. Providing young people with safe, integral and beautiful settings for them to explore their own personal power, while being mentored onto the pathway of adulthood by trustworthy mentor figures. The producer of the Finn McCool Project, supports the Irish Youth Foundation charity. The mission of IYF is to provide opportunities for children and young people facing adverse and extreme conditions to experience success in their lives. A percentage of profits made from the graphic novel of Finn McCool, will be donated to this inspiring charity based in Dublin, Ireland.

Below are seven images from Courtney Davis' art pack for this campaign. They are copies of original art from the Finn McCool's story. We are offering these as a part of perk donations. Please view listings on the right hand side of the campaign for more details.

Totally one off and unique ... Should you choose to donate to a perk that comes with a certificate of authenticity, we will do our best to get it to you by Christmas. However, we cannot guarantee the postal system, so we are offering you a downloadable certificate, with your, or the name of the person you are gifting, printed and embossed into the certificate. This will come from our dedicated website, you can then mount or frame the certificate for yourself or a receiver, after all, a part of Irish history is an incredible gift for anyone ...

The first wave of funding gets us out into the world with this incredible story, on the Graphic Novel platform. A completed Screenplay for the first film is here, part two is well underway. "A classic in the action adventure genre, and deserves serious studio consideration." But here's the thing, we don't want to just give it away to the big studios, we want to produce as much of the project as possible with the help of public funding. By doing so, we retain as much of the story's authenticity as we can. From the Graphic Novel, to the big screen. You are invited on that wild journey of creation, we want you to be a part of one of the finest stories to have ever come out of Ireland ...

     

The images that you are seeing are from the talents of John Walters, known for his Stunning VFX on the latest Spartacus series for the US STARZ channel and Courtney Davis, the world's leading Celtic illustrator. Their artwork will become the imagery for the Graphic Novel. John's with the graphic page layout and Courtney's with his incredible Irish knot-work which brings in the magic of the Celtic world. Each page will carry with it Finn McCool's legend. From his true love Saba, cursed into the form of a white deer and freed by Finn from her entrapment, to Saint Patrick, in dialogue with Oisin, Finn's son, or the wild druid, Finegas and the many more characters that I'm sure you will love, and if its "World of Role Play" you're into, we have some fantastic new characters for you to dream alive.

What lifts Finn McCool's stories above the crowd? In truth, reality. Scattered across Ireland are dozens of sacred sites that pre-date the coming of christianity and unlike the make believe world of Tolkien's, "The Hobbit" and "The Lord of The Rings" who dwell on "Middle Earth" (a place that does not exist), the sites across Ireland do.  Many of them include the stories of Finn McCool and the elite bodyguard, the Fianna, protectors of the High Kings of ancient Ireland.

    

          

All of the funds will go towards the graphic novel's production, the artwork, writing, lettering, colouring, printing, marketing and distribution. Anything you can offer will help. In return we will offer our deepest gratitude in all kinds of unique perks. Please see the perk bar for details. *Please note: Travel and accommodation expenses are not included and postage outside of the USA must be added if you are claiming a perk that requires postage.

What's in a name? There's a very interesting fact about the hero, did you know that there's at least seven different spellings of his name? This has come about over thousands of years, the stories became legends, the legends became myths. Here's the names we know of: Finn McCool ... Fionn Mac Cum Hail ... Finn McCuail ... Fionn McCumhail ... Fyn Mc Cuail ... Fionn McCual ... Finn McCuail. Some say that his name is spelt "Fionn" but that would make it the modern spelling, others say "Finn" the old way. So, what we decided to do was to offer the hero's name so that EVERYBODY can read and pronounce it, an inclusive spelling, hence ... "Finn McCool". Now, for all of the die-hard Gaelic fan's of the hero, we will also be producing a limited edition version, with all of the names, and there are many, spelt in the ancient Irish Gaelic. If that's the copy you'd like, then please just email and let us know. You can do so via this page when you preorder your copy of the graphic novel. 

What happens if we don't reach our total goal? We will continue the project come what may by STARTING, we can still hire the artists and even begin by creating a soft copy of the stories. We want to invite you to become involved, you are our community, our tribe, we believe that you should have the chance to be a part of this exciting reemergence of the Wild Celt. We'll achieve this through the stories of Finn McCool, and the Fianna.  Finn would have wanted it that way. Real People. Real Project. Real Heart.

               An old Irish saying goes:

So, com'on, let's you and I dream the Heroes alive, let's breathe anew the old, give fire to the wind, and call the gods to task. Our time is Now, we honour our past by becoming the hero, by becoming the Hero, we live the myths...

For more info on this project please visit these related websites:

http://www.Finn-McCool.com

https://www.facebook.com/FinnMcCoolTheMovie

www.artofjohnwalters.com

http://www.courtneydavisart.com

http://www.iyf.ie

Chris Brosnan is the Writer/Producer of the Finn McCool project. Born in the UK where he lived for 40 years, he now lives in Vancouver, Canada with his wife, Karen  and their 3.7 year old son Fionn.

Chris' background is in Film and T.V. production in the UK, as well as writing and performing for the music and stage industry, not only in the UK, but around the world. This has been his passion for over 25 years. Below is a shot of Chris with his son, Fionn, named after the legendary Irish hero Finn McCool ...

Chris' writing credits include: "Fugitive Fathers", "Wimps To Warriors", "The Shadow Catcher", "Healers", "Gospel According to Elvis", "The Redemption of Man" and "Finn McCool - The Forging of the Fianna." Graphic novel and the feature film screenplay of the same.

"I was first introduced to the legends of Finn McCool from my Grandmother and later from traditional storytellers. His legend has fascinated, not only me, but the people of Ireland and scholars alike the world over for centuries." 

Chris started his film career working alongside the likes of Clint Eastwood, Ron Howard, Kevin Costner and Morgan Freeman, in big budget feature films, learning from the best in movies such as: "Willow", "Robin Hood - Prince of Thieves", "White Hunter- Black Heart", "Batman", and many, many more.

Although Chris started his career as an actor, he found that he preferred the other side of the camera. He became a writer/producer for stage in the early nineties and has also worked on productions for the BBC as well as many Independents.

The natural progression into producing is something Chris is very focussed on, and his passion and energy is on breathing life into this exiting new project.

Chris brings a wealth of experience in the industry, and an extensive book of contacts to the Finn McCool project.

If you are unable to donate, then you can still help us by spreading the word of our campaign to those around you, via Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, emails to friends, contacts and importantly by using the Indiegogo share button at the very top of this page ... YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE and remember that there's a blessings of magic and luck with every Irish story, so claim yours by supporting the heroes of old.

We will be updating the page as the campaign moves forward with new artwork and news, so keep in touch, send us your blessings, as we do to you ...

May you be blessed in all ways, always ...

This time the fireside is the modern world. This time, it's in the form of a Graphic Novel. Now you have the chance to become part of that heroic quest, the journey of immortality, by remembering - The Nobility of our Irish Heroes.The second coming ... As some of you may know, this campaign is our second in the wave of funding needed for the production of the Finn McCool graphic novel series. In 2013 we raised a fantastic $12,501 from Irish Celtic fans the world over, with donations from eight different countries, from $5 to a staggering $5000. This is the passion that others saw in our vision to bring the greatest warrior ancient Ireland ever knew onto the world platform of heroes. Now YOU have the chance to make a stand as they have, by helping us recreate the magic of the Irish celtic world. But firstly, for those of you who may not know, who was Finn McCool?Finn was the legendary protector of Ireland and Chief of The Fianna, the elite bodyguard to the High Kings of Ireland. Finn and The Fianna's heroic adventures and deeds are well known within the Irish community and if you reference, Finn McCool, you will see, not only the vast amount of links to his mythology, but also the many pubs, restaurants, organizations and clubs, that celebrate his noble name. What you will not see, is the Graphic Novel of the hero, that, my friends, is about to change. The time has come to honour our ancient Irish heroes and in the highest way possible - by putting their fine names on the lips of true clansmen and women the world over. Part of our vision for the novel is for young men and women to read them, as well as adults, to learn more about their heritage, rites of passage and initiations into adulthood, something we feel is sadly lacking in today's world. The stories of Finn McCool do just that, they teach. This is part of the drive behind the graphic novel series, also to showcase the real heroes of our past, rather than the constant "Superman v Batman" overkill. This is an original project, a one off, you can be part of this fantastic journey.We are producing of the Hardcover Original Graphic Novel, featuring the retelling of Finn’s origin. In order to hire the best writers, pencillers, inkers, colourists and letterers in the business to bring this vision to life, we need your support. Finn lifts the curse and we see here, Saba transformed back into the beautiful woman she is.Below is the magical druid Finegas, another wise mentor of Finn's. story:
Dylan McVillain's back again, and this time he's got a lot of explaining to do. The Council of Evil and Villainy have deemed Dylan's actions towards the Toe-Nailiens to be "Heroic", the ultimate no-no in Super Villainy. Can Dylan prove he's still worthy of the Super Villain title? Find out in this All-New All-Ages Graphic Novel, a sequel to "Dylan McVillain: A Super Villain with the Best Intentions"!

PLEASE READ BEFORE CONTRIBUTING:

  • ALL BACKERS WILL RECIEVE ORDERED BOOKS REGARDLESS OF WHETHER OR NOT THE FULL FUNDING GOAL IS MET
  • ALL PERKS INCLUDE SHIPPING IN THE U.S.
  • THIS CAMPAIGN IS FOR U.S. RESIDENTS ONLY, INTERNATIONAL ORDERS WILL BE AVAILABLE IN JANUARY 2014 ON WWW.DYLANMCVILLAIN.COM

story:
What is Murder Book?

Murder Book is a series of short crime stories written by me, Ed Brisson, and featuring different up-and-coming artists. Past contributing artists have included Simon Roy (Jan's Atomic Heart, Prophet), Vic Malhotra (Lucid Proof) and Michael Walsh. Past Murder Book stories can be read on the Murder Book Site.


The term "Murder Book" is used by detectives to refer to a case file on a homicide investigation. Murder books typically include crime scene photographs and sketches, autopsy and forensic reports, transcripts of investigatorâ€™s notes and witness interviews. They chronicle the life of a case from the time the murder is reported until an arrest is made.


Murder Book Vol. 3 will feature the stories Midnight Walk, illustrated by Johnnie Christmas and Fathers and Sons, illustrated by Jason Copland.


Midnight Walk is a 6 page story about a man who happens across a crime scene and tries to help, only to become a victim himself. Fathers and Sons is an 18 page tale involving the breakdown of the relationship between two mob men, and the chaos that results. 


Generally, I post Murder Book stories to the site as they're complete, but in order to entice contributors, I'll hold off posting either story until late May. This way, all contributors will have the stories two months before they're posted online.


If you dig current and gritty crime comics like Criminal and Scalped, then Murder Book is your bag!


Johnnie and Jason are currently hard at work on the art so that we can debut this sucker at Emerald City Comicon at the end of March. We're hoping to have the book to the printer the week this campaign ends and everything packaged and mailed to people before the end of March -- meaning your perks should start showing up late March/early April.


What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $1500 to cover the costs of printing the book. The artists have generously agreed to come on board to help with the book, so should there be any funds raised in excess of the printing and shipping costs, then that money will be given to the artists, evenly distributed based on their page counts.


If we fall short of our goal, the book will still be printed and all perks will be fulfilled. I'll just be running up a credit card bill instead.


Every perk includes something physical. I'm looking at this as more of a pre-order/purchase drive than just a "give us your money" plea. That said, please spread the word! Tell your friends, family and everyone you see on the street!


I'm also offering up my lettering services. Check over there on the right. For $250 I'll letter your 22 page comic AND send you a copy of Murder Book #3. You can't beat that with a bat. Need someone to letter your pitch? I can do that too!

Please keep an eye on this campaign,  we will be adding art and other process pieces as the campaign marches on. We may be adding additional perks as well!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're a fan of Murder Book, we'd love for you to help get the word out. Tell your friends, tweet about it. Steal money from your mom's purse and send it to us! We appreciate each and every person who helps us get close to our goal of $1500. Seriously. We love you. Hugs, kisses and all that stuff.


Are You A Retailer?

Retailers, are you interested in helping out? Shoot me an email to edbrissonATgmailDOTcom and let me know. I'll add new pledge levels for retailers based on your input. Multiple copies! Signed! If you're close enough, I'll come out and sign them all for you! If you're further away, we can still work something out!

Right now, I do have the "You Must Be A Crazy Person!" perk, where I'll bring myself and $2,000 worth of my books to your store, do a signing, go for beers and even spend the weekend working at your shop. Not a bad deal!

About Us

Ed Brisson has been creating comics in one form or another since the early 90s. In the past two years, he's managed to put out two volumes of Murder Book, a one-shot comic called Black River published by 215 Ink and contributed to the crime comic anthology Acts of Violence, which he also co-published.

In addition to writing comics, he works as a freelance comic book letterer, having worked for a myriad of publishers such as Image, Oni, Viz, Random House, Douglas & McIntyre and a million other smaller publishers. You can find out more information about Ed's writing and lettering at edbrisson.com.


Jason Copland is a Vancouver artist whose published works include The Perhapanauts: Mollyâ€™s Story (Image) and short stories in the Eisner nominated anthologies Trickster: Native American Tales (Fulcrum) and Postcards:True Stories That Never Happened (Villard). He is currently finishing up the art for the giant monsters vs giant mechcomic Kill All Monsters. His blog can be found at jasoncopland.com.


Johnnie Christmas is creator of the webcomic Spectre of Sound. His work can be also seen in Cloudscape Anthologies: Exploded View, 21 Journeys and the soon to be released Giants on Main Street. He has various freelance projects floating around out there as well. See more at spectreofsound.com and jxmas.com.

Ed Brisson has been creating comics in one form or another
 since the early 90s. In the past 
two years, he's managed to put out two volumes of Murder Book, a one-shot comic called Black River published by 215 Ink and contributed to the crime comic anthology Acts of Violence, which he also co-published.In
 addition to writing comics, he works as a freelance comic book letterer, having
 worked for a myriad of publishers such as Image, Oni, Viz, Random 
House, Douglas & McIntyre and a million other smaller publishers. You can find out more information about Ed's writing and lettering at edbrisson.com.

Jason Copland is a Vancouver artist whose published works include The Perhapanauts: Mollyâ€™s Story (Image) and short stories in the Eisner nominated anthologies Trickster: Native American Tales (Fulcrum) and Postcards:True Stories That Never Happened (Villard). He is currently finishing up the art for the giant monsters vs giant mechcomic Kill All Monsters. His blog can be found at jasoncopland.com.

Johnnie Christmas is creator of the webcomic Spectre of Sound. His work
 can be also seen in Cloudscape Anthologies: Exploded View, 21 Journeys 
and the soon to be released Giants on Main Street. He has various 
freelance projects floating around out there as well. See more at spectreofsound.com and jxmas.com.

story:
(Holy moly, we hit $1,000 really fast! THANK YOU! But: it costs way more than $1k to make a comic. It has ALREADY cost more than that to pay the artists for their work thusfar.  I chose IndieGoGo because it works with a different sort of campaign - not "give me this much money and we can do it," but rather, "let me know if you want this book and we'll make sure you get one." I don't think of these as donations [though, if you do, that's very welcome] but rather pre-sales for a product which would not be possible without them. The point is - please don't think'oh, they hit their goal, never mind.' Instead, check out the images, get a sense of the story, and see if it's something YOU WANT. But most of all: THANK YOU.)


Hello, Potential Purchaser

My name is Austin and I have always wanted to make a comic book. I have a lot of things going for me:

  • I am very, very familiar with comic books. Five out of five ex-girlfriends agree.
  • I'm a good writer.  One out of one my-moms agree.
  • I have a compelling world and a story in my head. Ten out of ten friends at a bar agree.

But, I have some things in my way. I can't draw, I have no connections to comic companies, and I have little money. These seemed insurmountable, so I gave up.

Until now. Until YOU.

The Way of Things

I really love this story. I really want people to see it.

To make a comic book you need words and pictures. I can make words up out of nothing - I'm doing it right now. It's pretty cool. But to get pictures, I need artists. I am very fortunate to have many such weirdos in my life, but in order to put their hands to work I need to pay them.

I can't really afford to pay them.

Add other not-free things like printing and distributing and it seems dire.

With IndieGoGo, I can spread the word about this project, determine printing costs, manage distribution, and cover at least some of the cost.

The Stories

Big & Little: A Regrettable Interlude

  • This is where it starts. I've been working on this one since shortly after college. Consisting of two more-than-full-length comic books, this mini-arc is an introduction to this world and these characters. Illustrated in full, glorious color by Ellis Anderson.

Big & Little: Get the Money Back

  • A prologue story, giving a glimpse into the 'everyday adventure' of Big & Little. The only black and white story on the menu, and the only one illustrated by the inestimable Adam Scott Mazer.

Big & Little: The Governor's Daughter

  • Another prologue, another adventure - this one drawn by Ellis Anderson.

OK, that seems fun, but how do I know this is any good?

You are  cautious cat. I respect this instinct.

How about this: we're giving the prologues away for free.

Head to www.biglittlecomic.com - both prologue stories are coming out, one page at a time, on the regular.

In fact, if you decide that this story isn't for you (to each his, her, or its own! No judgement here friend!) then please: spread the word. Tell all your comic-fan friends to head to the site and read the story thusfar. If they then want to buy a copy, well, yknow what? That was my plan all along.

story:
The Bughouse Tour

Menage a Bughouse is a 408-page graphic novel collecting my trilogy of Bughouse graphic novels. Previously, Bughouse, Baja and Scalawag were issued on Top Shelf, and now they are being published in one massive volume from CO2.

I am hitting the road this July to promote Menage a Bughouse, kicking the tour off on July 11 at ADA Books in Providence, RI then moving on to MoCCA in New York for a publishing event featuring a Bughouse panel discussion as well as a performance of my country-punk tunes.

Here are the complete tour dates:

July 11, Ada Books, Providence, RI

July 12, MoCCA, New York City

July 14, Locust Moon Comics, Philadelphia, PA

July 17, Boxcar Books, Bloomington IN

July 18, Daydream Comics, Iowa City, IA

July 20, Time Warp Comics, Boulder, CO

July 25, Cartoon Art Museum, San Francisco, CA

July 28, Cosmic Monkey Comics, Portland, OR

Bughouse is the story of Jimmy Watts and his band of jazz playing bugs. The character driven story is set in a stylish “insect-noir” world, invoking an indigo-toned Manhattan of the early 1950s. Be-bop is king, and the alluring substance “bug juice” threatens to destroy the players against a backdrop of romance and intrigue.

The Tour is intended to promote my new book and put Bughouse on the map--I'm taking a shot a putting my work in the forefront of the indie graphic novel genre. But man, it's gonna take a lotta work and a bit of dinero. This will be a 10,000 mile haul, as I'm driving up from Oaxaca, where I live, just to get to the starting line. I'm respectfully requesting your help in floating this big undertaking.

It promises to be a great tour, with books and art available, and I'm also bringing my guitar along to play some Oaxacabilly (Oaxaca + rockabilly) music along the way!


Naturally, I have some fantastic perks to offer, not the least of which is Menage a Bughouse itself.

Steve Lafler

 

"Steve Lafler is a master cartoonist and his work is in a class by itself; an unpredictable amalgam of fun, intelligence, breeziness and glorious strangeness that keeps your eyes fed and your synapses sizzling."

--Jim Woodring

story:
Welcome to a new comic book for imaginative girls

Note: Our new goal is to raise at least $500 by the conclusion of our campaign.  Please disregard the stated $10,000 as we now see this amount will not be achieved - however, Petalianne #1 and a children's book edition will still be launched this year!  Thank you for your support :-)

 

Petalianne is a new 24-page, full color, bi-monthly comic book series published by Zelpha Comics.  The series has been created for girls ages 5 and up and spotlights the adventures of the lead character Petalianne, her friends the Flower Girls, Queen Azura and Azura’s three guards – Palm, Pine and Cactus.  Issue #1 is slated for non-retail release in December/January and mass release in February 2013. 

Petalianne is a cute, fun and funny adventure-filled series with themes and everyday issues young girls can relate to.  Petalianne herself is a spirited, loving and always helpful young girl trying to figure out where she fits in within the magical Gully Forest.  Though she has enormous potential to become the greatest hero the Gully Forest has ever seen, she has self-doubts of her usefulness and can sometimes let her small size, occasional clumsiness and forgetfulness cloud her decisions.  Petalianne might mess things up a lot, but whenever there is trouble, her actions and drive to help others always saves the day. 

Living in the same village as Petalianne are her friends The Flower Girls – Lilac, Daisy Lilly, Vine and Tulip.  They all have amazing nature-based abilities and unique personalities that add to the lively dynamic of each story.  There is also Queen Azura Rose, the ruler of the entire Gully Forest, leader of the Flower Girls and protector of the Flower of Life; plus her three loyal guards – Palm, Pine and Cactus.  Together, Petalianne and all her friends defend their home against the mischievous antics of the dreadful Dandelion Bob.  He wants the magical Flower of Life to control all plants and take over the forest.

 

 

The Inspiration behind the Series

Petalianne is the creation of Mississauga, Ontario, Canada writer and game developer Luanga Lue Nuwame and Camas, Washington, U.S.A. creative artist George Leon.  The idea for Petalianne came to Lue after his daughter Azura (his first child) was born on May 27, 2012.  After years of creating trading cards, games and cardboard weapons for boys exclusively on his Homemade Game Guru You Tube channel, the birth of Azura inspired Lue to focus his attention on making a comic book and trading card series specifically for girls.  George, also a father to a lovely daughter named Lilly, also felt he needed to do more to create inspiring art for girls.  Lue and George decided to team up to create a fun, wondrous world of characters as positive role models for not only their daughters, but for girls everywhere. 

And although Petalianne was created primarily for girls, there is no reason why boys would not enjoy the series too.  Palm, Pine and Cactus are confident and strong main characters boys can relate to.

 

What is Needed to get Petalianne to the Next Stage

It is Zelpha Comics’ mission to make Petalianne a bonafide market ready comic book series and your help is needed to make this goal a reality.  Issue #1 is currently being drawn.  What is required is $500 or more to help complete issue #1 and have it professionally printed.      

Even if you cannot provide financial backing to this campaign, any word of mouth you can provide to friends, family and co-workers is greatly appreciated.  Please share our You Tube, Facebook and website links listed here on Indiegogo.  Every view received helps :-D 

 

Petalianne Backer Rewards Galore

We know this series isn’t going to succeed without help from generous backers like you.  A signed copy of issue #1 is a good start for the lowest backing amount, but from there, the goodies start piling up big time! 

ALL backers, regardless of the amount, will have their name (or business name) listed in a special ‘thank you’ section in issue #1 and on Zelphacomics.com 

 

$15 Terrific Tulip

A signed copy of Petalianne #1 (signed by both Lue Nuwame and George Leon,  embossed seal and certificate of authenticity)


 

$30 Valued Vine

Signed copies of Petalianne #1 and 2 (#2 sent in February/March 2013) (All signed by both Lue Nuwame and George Leon,  embossed seal and certificate of authenticity)
(Button is being designed and will be uploaded once complete)

$55 Loveable Lilac

Signed copies of Petalianne #1 to 3 (All signed and embossed seal and certificate of authenticity)
+ a Petalianne button
+ an exclusive Petalianne 9-card trading card set (comes with plastic sleeves)

 

$120 Petal Power

Signed Petalianne #1 to 3 (signed and embossed and certificate)
+ a Petalianne button
+ Petalianne 9-card trading card set
+ 6-piece Petalianne fridge magnet set
+ Petalianne t-shirt (please specify size: SM, M, L, XL)


 

$250 Courageous Cacti (limited to 50)

Signed Petalianne #1 to 3 (signed and embossed and certificate)
+ a Petalianne button
+ Petalianne 9-card trading card set
+ 6-piece Petalianne fridge magnet set
+ Petalianne t-shirt
+ Petalianne #1 Board-cover Edition (numbered to 50 copies and embossed)

$525 Dynamite Daisy (limited to 20)

Signed Petalianne #1 to 3 (signed and embossed and certificate)
+ a Petalianne button
+ Petalianne 9-card trading card set
+ 6-piece Petalianne fridge magnet set
+ Petalianne t-shirt
+ Limited Edition Handmade cardboard Flower Sword (individually made by the Homemade Game Guru; limited to 20 copies) (Note: the flower sword will be introduced in issue #3)

$1050 Ravishing Rose Regent (limited to 12)

Signed Petalianne #1 to 3 (signed and embossed and certificate)
+ a Petalianne button
+ Petalianne 9-card trading card set
+ 6-piece Petalianne fridge magnet set
+ Petalianne t-shirt
+ A handmade Homemade Game Guru prototype 3D Petalianne board game (signed by Lue Nuwame, certificate of authenticity and limited to only 12)
+ ¼ color advertising space for your business within issue #2 and #3.

 

And unlike some other campaigns, shipping is NOT extra – you already provided a donation, so why ask you to pay more for postage?  We’ll ship the goodies worldwide and worry about the postage stamps. 

We will do our best to get rewards out before Christmas, but we can’t guarantee that.  By January all rewards will be sent out (the only exceptions being issues #2 and #3, which will be sent once published)

 

Extra Reward is Goal is surpassed…

In the event, by some form of magic or virtue, we surpass the $10,000 goal, EVERY backer will also receive a bonus 12x18 Petalianne promotional poster embossed, numbered and signed by Luanga Nuwame and George Leon. 

 

Thank You

We appreciate the time you have taken to read about our campaign, watching our video and providing funding to help Petalianne become a reality.  We hope to exceed everyone’s expectations and make a series that girls (and boys) worldwide will enjoy and cherish for decades to come.  Issues 1 to 3 are the start…issue 100 is the goal!

story:
Awwww man.

Long story short, my camera got stolen. It sucks right? I enjoyed making YouTube for so long and to have it all taken away from me due to a burglary is depressing to say the least. I don't like asking for money, but crowd funding might be the way to go. Please watch the video featured to have a better understanding of my current situation.

Donate anything and get something!

I'm determined to make this campaign worth your while. The smallest donation means something to me, the tiniest amount of support won't go unheard. 

Thank you for your support of my online project and I hope this allows me to continue producing online comedy shorts for years to come!

Please note, I do accept PayPal donations! Send money to tobiaslunghiyep@gmail.com (I shall be quick to reply to confirm that I've claimed anything you've sent me!)

story:
Valor, The Trailer


Short Summary


What We Need 

Our goal for this campaign is $5500. With the money raised, we will be able to begin a proper advertising campaign to raise awareness about ‘Valor.’  We plan to heavily utilize online avenues in our advertising campaign. Here’s the breakdown:

  • Roughly $4400 for production and distribution on Amazon and Barnes & Noble 
  • Roughly $1100 on YouTube and Google AdWords

What You Get

Guess what? You get swag! Everyone who is able to contribute to our campaign at select levels will be gifted with perks. Maybe you would like a poster with the Inhael Army marching, or maybe you want your own personal Inhael flag, or you might even want a T-Shirt, or maybe you’ve always wanted to be featured in a comic book. There are a few different perk options that await when you contribute to our campaign!
Poster Perk 


T-Shirt Perk


Inhael National Flag (Symbol)


      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand that contributing, while ideal, is not always possible. If you find yourself in that position, you can still help! All you have to do is share our Indiegogo campaign on Twitter and Facebook to spread the noise. Once you’ve shared this campaign, get your friends to share the campaign as well. That’s all we ask!

      Also, feel free to please like our Facebook pages (https://www.facebook.com/thecollectivecomics), follow us Twitter (@JointCollective), and be on the lookout for updates on Valor and other upcoming titles on our website (www.jointhecollective.org). Get your friends to share this campaign as well! When you spread the love on Twitter, promote our campaign by using #ValorComic.

      Thank you for your help. We are so excited to partner with you!
