story:
My name is Johan Julian Lee. As a North Borneon I take pride in being Sabahan & have always asked how come we never released a comic book about our own heritage? Sabah is a unique land and is comprise of 36 ethnic races, each with a very distinct culture, tradition, lifestyle & folklore. 

These stories are slowly fading and I took it as a personal project to get these stories out & share them in a medium most easy to absorb. Comic Books.

I have gathered stories from our local libraries, archives, spoke to local historians & also gathered a group of Sabahan artist to kickstart this project. But this project requires the funding and that is why I'm here in indiegogo.

 

What is SABAH (North Borneo) FOLKLORE PROJECT (SFP)?

SFP is a project to create the 1st Sabahan Folklore comic book. The aim is to retell our folklore to the younger generation using comic as the medium. All artist involve with this project are all Sabahans & we intend to raise fund to pay all artist, print, promote & launch a 10 stories by 10 different artist with different art style, 120 pages, fully colored comic book to be printed in 1000 copies. 

We hope to launch the book to everyone & especially to the younger generation here in Borneo to keep their heritage alive. 

 

This project is the first of it's kind & we hope you would support us to make it happen. Not only will you contribute greatly to helping people recognizing North Borneo artist but also help stir the comic industry in this part of the world since there really isnt any initiative like this project.

We have the talent but we need the funding.

I leave you here with a link of our facebook page for you to check on our updates and news. check us here.

You may also email me here at: silver_hand81 at yahoo.

story:
Help me print my first full-length graphic novel!

Hi, I'm Jenny McKeon! I'm a comic creator and translator based in western MA. Previously, my work has appeared in anthologies like Dirty Diamonds and Restless Minds, and in the webcomic Eerie PD. I've also created minicomics like Blush and Japanese Journal, which I sell at conventions, local shops, and on Gumroad.

You can see more of my work on my art blog or portfolio site!

Now I'm trying to self-publish my first full book, and I need your help! ABC: Anime Boston Confidential is based on my experiences from attending the same anime convention for the past ten years. It's a 70-page graphic novel full of costumes, romance, misadventures, and some lessons I've learned in my time at AB. The pencils and lettering for the book are complete, and I'm working on finishing the inking and screentones right now. Then I'll debut the book at Conbust in Northampton, Long Island PopCon, and of course, Anime Boston 2015! (Not 2014 as I said in the video, whoops.) You can pick up your copy and other rewards at any of these cons, or have them shipped to you.

In progress in Manga Studio

I want this book to be enjoyable for convention newbies and veterans alike - the former can learn from my mistakes, and the latter can laugh at me for them. Even if you're an outsider to convention culture, I hope this book will provide a look into that world, as well as a glimpse of my own personal experiences. A lot can happen in ten years!

What's all this money for?

The goal I'm aiming for with this campaign is $800 or more. A print run of 200 books costs $540, shipping them out will cost at least $100, and the rest is for IG and other fees and printing other rewards. Any additional money will go toward convention costs, travel, and printing more copies of the book.

Don't get stuck waiting for your copy!

If we reach the full $800, I'll throw in an original piece of artwork with each physical reward tier! I'll also introduce more stretch goals like bookmarks, bookplates, and so on. (If we don't reach it, I'll be charged more by IG and may have to reduce the size of the print run - but you'll still get the book.)


The fun part!

Any pledge of $5 or above gets you a PDF copy of the book shortly after its completion, and $10 or up means you'll receive a physical copy as well! But there's more - higher tiers mean you could get an original commission from me, or even a cameo in the book itself or on the cover!

The print/back cover in progress - I left room for you!

And if you choose to pick up your book in person (just let me know you'll be attending one of the conventions) instead of having it shipped to you, you'll receive a con-exclusive ABC print!

Challenges, more ways to help, and more previews!

I already have a printer lined up and a sizeable portion of the book completed. I am in a bit of a time crunch, and will have to work hard to finish the book in time to debut it at AB and the other conventions - but I'm up for the challenge, and you'll receive your books by May even if the worst should happen!
As always, even if you can't afford to contribute financially (we've all been there), any sharing would be appreciated! Tweet, tumble, Facebook, email, maybe share it with your high school anime club! (Unless you're not in high school anymore, then you should maybe leave that one be.) You can also help by buying my other comics digitally on Gumroad - most of them are pay-what-you-want, or a dollar or two at most!

You can preview some more pages by clicking on the Gallery tab above - I'll add more as the campaign goes on! Thanks so much for taking the time to read all this. I hope you're as excited about this book as I am!

story:
Short Summary

Voluntaryist is the tale of a superhuman hero who finds himself pitted against the government as the government tries to enslave humanity once and for all.  He is a young man with extraordinary powers created through a chance encounter with cosmic radiation. His personal mission is to rescue his parents from government agents, but that objective is often frustrated with the likes of giant monsters, super-villains, and even the armed forces.

The comic takes a contemporary look at the question, "What does it mean to be truly free?"

HISTORY: Voluntaryist was created by liberty fanatic and costumer Jaime Sherman, whose passion for liberty is only matched by his passion for cosplay photography. He began the long process of creating the series while trudging through his graduate studies.

The Voluntaryist comic series has been in the prototyping process for 5 years and is finally ready for an official and complete canon origins story. The script has been written and revised and the characters have been established through several future-verse comic issues available at www.volcomic.com

GOAL: To get the Voluntaryist Origins story fully finished to share with you, and, eventually, the world!

PAGE COUNT: 50 new pages estimated for a 100% funded campaign.

We will produce as much of the comic as we can get funded for! The storyline may set with “to be continued” to tailor to the funding level.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $10,000 to get this graphic novel’s potential fully going.

The expenses are largely for the cost of hiring artists to produce the comic and the expenses associated with putting the comic into print format. 

You can support us by making a contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card or Paypal.

In addition, you can redeem perks for your support such as:

The digital early release ($10)

The signed graphic novel. ($40)

In-comic and mailer advertisement. (Starting at $50)

An action figure in packaging. ($350)

A movie prototype screenshot. ($400)

A Voluntaryist supersuit. ($600)

AND MUCH MORE!

STRETCH GOALS!

If we raise above funding we will continue to prototype cells for a Voluntaryist film. Those who support this campaign with physical perk purchases will receive a special print from the prototyping process. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have pocket change to spare, you can still help us get the message out by sharing our campaign and sharing our videos on YouTube.

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

WEBSITE: http://volcomic.com

FACEBOOK: http://www.facebook.com/volcomics

YOUTUBE: http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists

Share Tweets about the campaign with: #voluntaryist

ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Jaime at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 

And that’s all there is to it. ( :

story:
YOUR SECOND CHANCE!

This is another opportunity to get Micah Curtis' debut comic book! ENGLEWOOD is the story of Chicago's new superhero, the Saint of Englewood. A book for the street level comic fan in all of us, ENGLEWOOD #1 shows the incident that led former MMA heavyweight champion Elijah Wallace to clean up the Windy City, and how a hero was Born in Blood.

The only available version this time is the Director's Cut, which contains Issue 0 and Issue 1, for 36 pages of story, plus bonus content featuring early sketches, character breakdowns, and the winners of the fan art contest. The books will ship shortly after the campaign ends, so you've got 30 days to snatch this up along with the new cover!

THE DEBUT OF NEW TALENT!

ENGLEWOOD #1 is the first published comic from writer Micah Curtis, artist Brian Martinez, and colorist Armand Strange. The team will be working together on ENGLEWOOD for the foreseeable future and will be in comics for a long time, so make sure to pick this up so you can have a copy of their first published work! Plus it features the impeccable lettering of Eric Weathers, creator of FLYING FORTRESS and BATTLE BRICK ROAD!

WHAT'S NEW?

The Gym Shirt!

After the first campaign, many people requested a t-shirt based on the Solomon's Temple Gym from the comic, in the style of other gym logo shirts out there. We thought it was a fantastic idea, and are pleased to offer it for this campaign!

The Cover Poster!

The original wrap-around cover of ENGLEWOOD #1 was iconic, and a couple of backers requested it as a poster. Though we're not reprinting that cover again, we decided to give it it's own sort of second chance, this time, as the requested poster! This will be an A2 size poster, 16.5" x 23.4", perfect for framing!

Stretch Goals?!

Yup, we're doing stretch goals! But just a few small ones.

$3,000 - Solomon's Temple business cards for all backers!

$4,000 - Saint of Englewood trading card for all backers!

$5,000 - ?????????????????????

story:
This will raise money to get print copies of Popcorn night.
As well as fund possibly better better new issues.
By helping me out, I will award you with, copies of the book, and actual pages and original art used in making the comic. 

Mister Fuck or "Popcorn Night" is a story about a young man, who can't seem to fall asleep. so he does what any filthy human with insomnia does, he pops sleeping pills and watches movies. As he tries and tries to sleep, he starts hallucinating; whether these are dreams, or an over dose from the pills, is unclear to him. He will find out how FUCKED he is when his Hallucinations become reality.

story:
Help fund The Daily Cartoonist for a year

Eight years ago when I started The Daily Cartoonist (TDC), I was just hoping to get to year five. The popularity and influence of TDC has surpassed any of my expectations. The media landscape has changed quite a bit in those years. Social Media is the go-to place for news and conversation. Mobile phones and tablet devices are increasingly the screen of choice for staring into for web content. This next year I’m investing heavily with my time and efforts to improve every aspect of the blog from how news is gathered, organized, delivered and read.

My top goals for the blog are:

  1. Redesign – This is more than just a lipstick and a pretty bow, Visually, I’m redesigning the site to provide a better experience for both tablet and mobile phones, but architecturally I’ll be moving the blog to a different CMS that has better scalability, security and performance.
  2. Refocus of content – I’m going to simplify the content structure to simply focus on Creators, Publishers, Issues, and Technology. I won’t be cutting back on my current “beat” of print/newspaper based cartooning but expect the circle of creators and publishers to get bigger.
  3. Reorganize my sources – News is moving faster thanks to social media. I’m going to spend a lot of time reevaluating how I gather news and improving filtering genuine news from the noise that is social media.

What do you get out of this?

At the end of this process (I’m shooting for end of January) The Daily Cartoonist will have more news, be better focused, better sourced and look fantastic on your mobile phone or tablet at 2:00 am (or any other time, really).

The Rewards

So each year (okay, mostly every year), I run a NPR-style guilt-trip induced fund-raiser to ask for money to pay for hosting, allow me to attend various cartooning events and provide goodwill support for my time running the blog. This year, because my investment of time and efforts will be so much bigger, I’m using Indiegogo to raise more money than I’ve ever raised before and I’ve reached out to several friends of the blog to help provide exciting incentives for all the donors.

BONUS PERK: Last THREE days

Any new donors from Monday through Wednesday OR any previous donors who increase their donation by $10 will get a eBook of my best cartoons. It's a mix of:

Editorial cartoons and comic strips that put me on the finalist list for the Charles M. Schulz award for best college cartoonist

My Christmas cartoons

My first submission to the syndicates

And several comic strips that I explored (like the one about becoming a parent of a set of triplets)

The eBook will formatted for easy reading on tablets or desktop and be delivered before Christmas.

Plus, as always you can select other great perks such as:

Exclusive King Features Syndicate calendars

These calendars are given to KFS's clients. You won't find these online or in stores. I have six at the $15 donation level.
Limited Edition Wages of Sin Volume II by Keith Brown
Keith is also adding a signed print of your choice.

And I have lots of book collections generously donated by Universal Uclick:

  • The Argyle Sweater 2014 Day to Day Calendar, Scott Hilburn
  • The Mighty Alice, Richard Thompson
  • The Fuzzy Bunch, Darby Conley
  • Reheated Lio, Mark Tatulli
To be listed soon (I need to figure out shipping costs on these heavy collections)
  • Celebrating Peanuts, Charles Schulz
  • The Complete Calvin & Hobbes, Bill Watterson (paperback)
  • The Complete Far Side, Gary Larson

Please scroll down the right hand side. There are many other great perks for donating.

What happens if the goal isn’t met?

This is a flexible funding, so every dollar helps, even if I don’t reach the goal!

Spread the word

If you’re not in a financial position to support The Daily Cartoonist through this campaign or want to help more - there are several things you can do. The biggest thing you can do is spread the word through your blog, Tumblr, Facebook, Twitter or other awesome media channels. Indiegogo has some neat share tools as well that make it all very easy.

Watch The Daily Cartoonist for new announcements. You can also follow me on Twitter or Like The Daily Cartoonist on Facebook.

Thank you. All three of you who made it to the bottom of this post.

story:
Italian translation below (click here).

WHAT IS A META-DIMENSIONAL COMIC BOOK?

“A Story of Light: Polaris” is a comic book that speaks about real people that we may meet in the street or – in this case – in a gym. These people however, live in a world very similar to ours, where some elements are new and mysterious. A world where we will find aliens, monsters, incredible technology and superhuman threats that can only be faced with a legendary weapon... In this world we will also find friendship, value, courage, compassion and so much adventure.

“A Story of Light: Polaris” is a meta-dimensional comic as it allows you to know (and recognise) the protagonists and places where Light Saber Combat is fought in the real world.

THE STORY

Jake is a young man who loves music, his friends, his Vespa and his favourite sport. In the gym he goes to in Milan, he will discover something that he would never have imagined: his Masters are not who he thought they were, and more importantly, the weapon he uses for light saber combat can actually be activated, turning into a lethal weapon. Which of his course mates knows the secret of Polaris? But above all, what do the Masters and their most loyal followers have in mind? Together with his friends, Jake will go on a journey to discover the truth, meeting adversaries and allies, and will discover that it is not always easy to know the difference between them.

THE FIRST SEASON’S HEROES

SABNAK AND NEMO
Founder Masters of LudoSport, Jake’s first Masters, but above all the keepers of a big secret and an uncomfortable truth.

POL
Jake’s best friend, his companion in adventures right from childhood. He is impulsive and generous, and never spares himself.

J.P.
American, a former soldier from the special forces. He is an old, expert warrior. His advice and his arm are firmly in the service of justice.

NOGRA
Educated by the Masters in the secrets and construction of the Polaris sabers, he is essential to clearing the mist and hidden plots. He is an opponent that shouldn’t be underestimated in combat.

RYO
Legendary warrior, good friend and blade brother of Rock, will he enter the field to spread light over the incumbent darkness?

LORK
Legendary warrior, fearless and sarcastic, with exceptional, overwhelming technique. He secretly collaborates with HUGO.

HUGO
A true support to the Masters, we will discover his wisdom and hidden talents and – thanks to his calculating mind – his way of always being one step in front of the others.

 

YOU CAN BE A PROTAGONIST TOO!

Reality becomes fiction. The first season of "A Story of Light: Polaris" has some of Ludosport’s most well-known athletes plus the winners of the LudoSport 2016 LightSaber Combat World Championship as its protagonists. The winners of the 2017 edition will be present as characters in season two, and so on in future years. However, the adventure does not finish here: the protagonists will travel in the various LudoSport gyms around the world and anyone who is a pupil could recognise their own instructor or even themselves at a lesson in a storyboard. Meta-dimensionality has no geographical boundaries.

 

THE PROJECT

Series: A Story of Light
Comic Book: Polaris
Season: 1
#1 issue of 6: "The truth about the sword"
Format: comic book
Pages: 22+4
Languages: Italian, American English

 

THE AUTHORS

Giovanni Gualdoni, Valeria Favoccia, Daniele Rudoni, Simone Spreafico and Gianluca Longo.

 

ORIGINAL PROJECT

Gianluca Longo, Simone Spreafico

The LudoSport Founder Masters developed the heart of a story years ago when the real and imaginary planes merge, where real people could move from one plane to the other via sports competition.

SHOWRUNNER, SCRIPT AND SCREENPLAY

Giovanni Gualdoni

One of the leading comic authors in Italy, Giovanni has worked for years at Sergio Bonelli Editore where he developed stories for Dylan Dog, Martin Mystère and many others. After several experiences as producer of comic series, he contributed to the creation of the “A Story of Light: Polaris” universe, together with Gianluca and Simone, who have also collaborated with him as consultants for combat scenes.

ILLUSTRATIONS

Valeria Favoccia

With her great talent of dynamic portrayal and in creating combat scenes, Valeria was recruited by the “Assassin’s Creed” franchise to visually develop the comic book “Assassin’s Creed: Reflections”. She then joined this project and helped the authors to materialise the world that they had imagined and made it unique and fascinating.

COLOURS

Alessandro Musumeci, Daniele Rudoni

With long-standing experience as a professional colourist, Daniele and his team have coloured for the big names: Marvel, DC comics, Image, Penguin, Devil’s Due, Sergio Bonelli, Soléil and several others. Their careful, vivid touch further embellishes each storyboard of “A Story of Light: Polaris”.

THE COMIC WITHIN THE COMIC

“A Story of Light: Polaris” contains a “special feature”: each issue hosts a single lightsaber combat technique developed by the LudoSport Masters and practised within the network. A special illustrated insert by the artist Anna Diaz will describe the technique in detail to satisfy the curiosity of even the most careful.

 

THE GOALS OF THE CAMPAIGN

At the first goal we will be able to realise the first issue of Season 1 in Italian (printed) and in the English translation version (PDF).

Achieving Stretch Goal 1 will allow us to realise the first issue of Season 1 in printed version, also for the English translation.

Achieving Stretch Goal 2 will allow us to realise the entire Season 1 in printed version, in Italian and in English.

THE TYPES OF PERK

The [ITALIANS] perks are dedicated to Italian supporters, who can also access all the other categories, anyway.

The [WORLD] perks are dedicated to everyone, and guarantee access to the personalised stretch goals, where indicated.

At STRETCH GOAL 1:
+ the first issue in English (printed copy)
+ a flash drive with more digital bonus materials

At STRETCH GOAL 2:
+ the second printed issue in English or Italian (language chosen by the backer)
+ the official poster signed by all the authors (numbered copy)

The perk [COLLECTORS] are dedicated to fans of the genre, and guarantee access to the personalised stretch goals where indicated.

At STRETCH GOAL 1:
+ the first issue in English (printed copy) with a special variant cover
+ printed ghost table (post credits issue one, included in first issue
+ a flash drive with more digital bonus materials

At STRETCH GOAL 2:
+ the second printed issue in English or Italian (to be decided by the backer)
+ ghost table (post credits issue one) printed and bound in the first issue
+ a special table signed by all the authors (numbered copy)

The [LANGUAGE] perks are dedicated to French, Spanish and German language supporters.
On reaching 70 perks for each language, we will be able to translate the first issue and deliver it in PDF.

ITALIAN VERSION

COS’È UN FUMETTO METADIMENSIONALE?

“A Story of Light: Polaris” è un fumetto che parla di persone vere, reali, che si possono incontrare per strada o – in questo caso – in una palestra. Queste persone però, vivono in un mondo molto simile al nostro, in cui alcuni elementi sono nuovi e misteriosi. Un mondo in cui troveremo alieni, mostri, tecnologie incredibili e minacce sovrumane che si potranno affrontare solo con un’arma leggendaria… In questo mondo troveremo anche amicizia, valore, coraggio, compassione e tantissima avventura. “A Story of Light: Polaris” è un fumetto metadimensionale perché permette di conoscere (e riconoscere) nel mondo reale i protagonisti e i luoghi in cui viene praticato il Light Saber Combat sportivo.

LA STORIA

Jake è un giovane che ama la musica, gli amici, la sua Vespa e il suo sport preferito. Proprio nella palestra che frequenta a Milano, scoprirà qualcosa che non avrebbe mai immaginato: i suoi Maestri non sono chi credeva che fossero, e soprattutto l'arma che utilizza per praticare il light saber combat può essere realmente attivata tramutandosi in uno strumento letale. Chi tra i suoi compagni di corso conosce il segreto di Polaris? Ma soprattutto cosa hanno in mente i Maestri e i loro seguaci più fidati? Assieme ai suoi amici, Jake viaggerà alla scoperta della verità incontrando avversari e alleati, e scoprirà che non sempre è facile distinguerli.

GLI EROI DELLA PRIMA STAGIONE

SABNAK E NEMO
Maestri Fondatori di LudoSport, Primi Maestri di Jake, ma soprattutto portatori di un grande segreto e di una altrettanto scomoda verità.

POL
Il migliore amico di Jake, compagno di avventure fin dall’infanzia. Impulsivo quanto generoso, non si risparmia mai.

J.P.
Americano, ex militare nei corpi speciali, è un vecchio ed esperto guerriero. Il suo consiglio ed il suo braccio sono saldi al servizio della giustizia.

NOGRA
Educato dai Maestri ai segreti ed alla costruzione della spade Polaris, elemento essenziale nel dipanare le nebbie e le trame nascoste. E un avversario da non sottovalutare in combattimento.

RYO
Guerriero leggendario, grande amico e fratello di lama di Rock, entrerà in campo per dare luce all’oscurità che incombe?

LORK
Guerriero leggendario, impavido e beffardo, dotato di una tecnica ineccepibile e travolgente. Collabora in segreto con HUGO.

HUGO
Vero supporto dei Maestri, ne scopriremo la saggezza e le doti nascoste e, grazie alla sua mente calcolatrice, il suo essere sempre un passo avanti agli altri.

 

ANCHE TU PROTAGONISTA!

La realtà diventa fiction. La prima stagione di "A Story of Light: Polaris" vede protagonisti alcuni tra i più noti atleti LudoSport più i vincitori del campionato mondiale 2016 di Light Saber Combat LudoSport. I vincitori dell'edizione 2017 saranno presenti come personaggi all'interno della seconda stagione, e così negli anni successivi. Ma l'avventura non finisce qui: i protagonisti viaggeranno nelle diverse palestre LudoSport in giro per il mondo, e chiunque sia un allievo potrebbe riconoscere in una tavola il proprio Istruttore o perfino sé stesso durante una lezione. La metadimensionalità non ha confini geografici.

IL PROGETTO

Collana: A Story of Light
Fumetto: Polaris
Stagione: 1
Albo 1 di 6: "La verità della spada"
Formato: comic book
Pagine: 22+4
Lingue: italiano, inglese americano

GLI AUTORI

Giovanni Gualdoni, Valeria Favoccia, Daniele Rudoni, Simone Spreafico e Gianluca Longo.

PROGETTO ORIGINALE

Gianluca Longo, Simone Spreafico

I Maestri Fondatori LudoSport svilupparono anni fa il nucleo di una storia in cui il piano reale e quello immaginario si confondessero, dove persone reali potessero passare da uno all’altro attraverso la competizione sportiva.

SHOWRUNNER, SOGGETTO E SCENEGGIATURA

Giovanni Gualdoni

Tra i migliori autori di fumetto in Italia, Giovanni lavora da anni in Sergio Bonelli Editore dove ha sviluppato storie per Dylan Dog, Martin Mystère e tanti altri. Dopo numerose esperienze come produttore di serie a fumetti ha contribuito alla creazione dell’universo di “A Story of Light: Polaris” assieme a Gianluca e Simone, che hanno collaborato con lui anche come consulenti per le scene di combattimento.

ILLUSTRAZIONI

Valeria Favoccia

Con il suo grande talento nella raffigurazione dinamica e nella realizzazione di scene di combattimento, Valeria è stata reclutata dal franchise “Assassin’s Creed” per sviluppare visivamente il fumetto “Assassin’s Creed: Reflections”. Si è quindi unita a questo progetto e ha aiutato molto gli autori a materializzare il mondo da loro immaginato e a renderlo unico e affascinante.

COLORI

Alessandro Musumeci, Daniele Rudoni

Con una grande esperienza come colorist professionista, Daniele e il suo team hanno colorato per le grandi: Marvel, DC comics, Image, Penguin, Devil’s Due, Sergio Bonelli, Soléil e tante altre. Il loro tocco accurato e vivido arricchisce ulteriormente ogni singola tavola di “A Story of Light: Polaris”.

IL FUMETTO NEL FUMETTO

“A Story of Light: Polaris” contiene una “special feature”: ogni numero ospita una singola tecnica di light saber combat sportivo sviluppata dai Maestri LudoSport e praticata all’interno del network. Uno speciale inserto illustrato dall’artista Anna Diaz descriverà nel dettaglio la tecnica per soddisfare la curiosità dei più attenti.

GLI OBIETTIVI DELLA CAMPAGNA

Al primo goal potremo realizzare il primo numero della Stagione 1 in italiano (cartaceo) e nella traduzione inglese (PDF).

Raggiungere lo Stretch Goal 1 ci permetterà di realizzare il primo numero della Stagione 1 in versione cartacea anche per la traduzione inglese.

Raggiungere lo Stretch Goal 2 ci permetterà di realizzare l’intera Stagione 1 cartacea, tanto in italiano quanto in inglese.

LE TIPOLOGIE DI PERK

I perk [ITALIANS] sono dedicati ai sostenitori italiani, che possono comunque accedere anche a tutti gli altri.

I perk [WORLD] sono dedicati a tutti, e garantiscono, dove indicato, l’accesso agli stretch goal personalizzati.

Allo STRETCH GOAL 1:
+ il primo numero in Inglese (cartaceo)
+ una flashdrive con ancora più materiali extra in formato digitale

Allo STRETCH GOAL 2:
+ il secondo numero cartaceo in Inglese o Italiano (a scelta del sostenitore)
+ il poster ufficiale firmato da tutti gli autori (copia numerata)

I perk [COLLECTORS] sono dedicati agli amatori del genere, e garantiscono, dove indicato, l’accesso agli stretch goal personalizzati.

Allo STRETCH GOAL 1:
+ il primo numero in Inglese (cartaceo) con una speciale variant cover
+ una ghost table (post credits numero uno) cartacea, inserita nel primo numero
+ una flashdrive con ancora più materiali extra in formato digitale

Allo STRETCH GOAL 2:
+ il secondo numero cartaceo in inglese o italiano (a scelta del sostenitore)
+ una ghost table (post credits numero uno) stampata e rilegata nel primo numero
+ una tavola speciale firmata da tutti gli autori (copia numerata)

I perk [LANGUAGE] sono dedicati ai sostenitori di lingua francese, spagnola e tedesca.
Al raggiungimento di 70 per ciascuna lingua, potremo realizzare la traduzione del primo numero e la consegna in PDF.
story_txt: Italian translation below (click here). WHAT IS A META-DIMENSIONAL COMIC BOOK?“A Story of Light: Polaris” is a comic book that speaks about real people that we may meet in the street or – in this case – in a gym. These people however, live in a world very similar to ours, where some elements are new and mysterious. A world where we will find aliens, monsters, incredible technology and superhuman threats that can only be faced with a legendary weapon... In this world we will also find friendship, value, courage, compassion and so much adventure.“A Story of Light: Polaris” is a meta-dimensional comic as it allows you to know (and recognise) the protagonists and places where Light Saber Combat is fought in the real world.THE STORYJake is a young man who loves music, his friends, his Vespa and his favourite sport. In the gym he goes to in Milan, he will discover something that he would never have imagined: his Masters are not who he thought they were, and more importantly, the weapon he uses for light saber combat can actually be activated, turning into a lethal weapon. Which of his course mates knows the secret of Polaris? But above all, what do the Masters and their most loyal followers have in mind? Together with his friends, Jake will go on a journey to discover the truth, meeting adversaries and allies, and will discover that it is not always easy to know the difference between them.THE FIRST SEASON’S HEROESSABNAK AND NEMOFounder Masters of LudoSport, Jake’s first Masters, but above all the keepers of a big secret and an uncomfortable truth.POLJake’s best friend, his companion in adventures right from childhood. story:
[Scroll down for English!]

SYNTH/org è un’antologia di fumetti fantascientifica che ruota intorno al tema della vita sintetica, dell’intelligenza artificiale, degli androidi in ogni declinazione: insomma, i protagonisti questa volta sono i robot!

Il volume, che costituirà la pubblicazione principale di Attaccapanni Press per il 2019, riunirà 16 artisti italiani e conterà quasi 200 pagine completamente a colori in formato 16x23 cm, rilegato in brossura fresata; per la prima volta sperimenteremo la stampa in offset, per regalarvi una qualità ancora migliore.

L’obbiettivo è, come per le antologie passate, di darci appuntamento a Lucca Comics & Games 2019.

Contiamo sul vostro sostegno per poter realizzare anche quest’anno una raccolta di storie emozionanti, atipiche e indimenticabili!

Attaccapanni Press è un'etichetta di micro-editoria fondata nel 2017 dopo il successo di Grimorio. Ariel Vittori e Laura Guglielmo si sono così divertite a curare ed editare quel libro da volerne fare molti altri: Melagrana, Ave, Grimorio II e ora SYNTH/org.

All'interno le 13 storie sono firmate da autori tra i migliori del panorama editoriale tradizionale e indipendente, tra punte di diamante già conosciute e fantastici esordienti che vi stupiranno, riuniti sotto una cover d'eccezione di LRNZ, al secolo Lorenzo Ceccotti. Farà da introduzione alle storie una prefazione di Adrian Fartade!

Potete già vedere anteprime del loro lavoro nel video, nella gallery e sulle nostre pagine social durante il periodo della campagna!

I pacchetti di quest'anno vanno dal Bit all'Exabyte, preziosissimi dati di cui vi sveliamo qui il contenuto in maniera più approfondita.

L'ebook di SYNTH/org: un file PDF con dentro tutte le storie dell'antologia. Solo nel perk Bit.


Il volume di SYNTH/org! Da ritirare a Lucca o da ricevere a casa, la copia fisica dell'antologia. Dal perk Byte in su.

 

Cover di Leonardo Mazzoli.

L'esclusivo artbook digitale di SYNTH/org: schizzi preparatori, work in progress, varianti di personaggi e definitivi. Presente in tutti i perk da Kilobyte in su.

Un bellissimo sticker 50x70 mm a sfondo trasparente, firmato da Eleonora Bruni esclusivamente per il nostro crowdfunding! Presente in tutti i perk da Kilobyte in su.

Il segnalibro con un'immagine esplosiva dalla storia di Luca Claretti per l'antologia, stampato su speciale carta perlata. Dal perk Kilobyte in su.

Una bellissima enamel pin da collezione, con design di Laura Guglielmo, la nostra amichevole grafica di quartiere. Per esporre con orgoglio il vostro amore per la robotica! Solo dal perk Megabyte in su.

*design temporaneo, non definitivo

Una strepitosa maglietta in stampa serigrafica con un esclusivo design di Walter Baiamonte. SOLO nel perk Terabyte.

 

*copertina di Impronte temporanea, non definitiva

Nel perk Gigabyte troverete invece solo libri, nello specifico: tutti i libri di Attaccapanni Press previsti per il 2019! Oltre a SYNTH/org ci saranno quindi:

Iconoclast di Walter Baiamonte, spillato, 52 pagine. La dinamica sfida a colpi di flash di un mostro sacro della fotografia e di un talento emergente che ne stravolge le regole. Chi sarà consacrato come artista, e chi invece sarà dimenticato?

Clessidra n°2 con storie di Ariel Vittori, Genny Ferrari, Chiara Raimondi e Yi Yang, spillato, 62 pagine. Il secondo numero del nostro annuale sul tempo torna con 4 storie di 12 pagine, stavolta sui quarti di giornata: alba, mezzogiorno, tramonto e mezzanotte.

Impronte di Stefano Martinuz, brossurato, 80+ pagine. Un racconto di formazione riccamente illustrato, il viaggio di un protagonista rimasto senza casa che si trova a incontrare ogni genere di creatura, luogo e pericolo - fino a trovare, forse, una nuova famiglia. [in uscita in Autunno]

Immagine di esempio di Francesco Guarnaccia.

Nei rarissimi pacchetti Exabyte potete trovare, oltre al contenuto del perk Megabyte, una commission per ognuno dei seguenti artisti presenti nel libro: Albhey Longo, Arianna Climaci, Francesco Guarnaccia, Enrica Leone, Laura Guglielmo, Zeno Colangelo. Non perdete l'occasione di avere un originale di uno di loro!

Un libro amico del codice binario non potrà che avere una tiratura di 1000 copie! Per coprirne la realizzazione utilizzeremo circa il 50% dei fondi. Quest'anno la base richiesta è più alta per via del passaggio dalla stampa digitale alla stampa offset, tramite i servizi della tipografia veneta Printsoon.

Il resto verrà ripartito tra la produzione degli altri perk (15%), spese di spedizione e packaging (15%), tasse e oneri vari di Indiegogo (10%), marketing e promozione (5%) e alle spese amministrative di Attaccapanni Press come associazione culturale per il 2019 (5%).

 

E in caso riuscissimo a superare le aspettative, abbiamo previsto degli allettanti stretch goal per voi!

A €8300 arricchiremo la splendida copertina di LRNZ con una finitura dorata, rendendola ancora più preziosa.

 

E dopo? Abbiamo una sorpresa speciale per lo stretch goal di €10.000, ma dovrete aspettare di avvicinarvi un po' di più prima di saperlo!

Questa sarà la quinta campagna crowdfunding di Attaccapanni.

Per tutte quelle precedenti il goal è stato raggiunto e il libro è stato consegnato in tempo: tutti gli imprevisti di spedizione o tipografici superati con successo. Siamo pronte anche questa volta ad affrontare ogni sfida per portarvi il prodotto migliore possibile!

I nostri artisti sono già al lavoro da molto, e il libro verrà stampato in estate. L'unico vero rischio è non raggiungere il goal: e per quello, servite voi!

Sia che possiate supportare la campagna direttamente o meno, condividetela! Parlatene con amici, cugini, nella fumetteria sotto casa, al lavoro.

E, soprattutto, sui social! Usate gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo per far arrivare la campagna oltre l'orizzonte degli eventi, al di là del tempo e dello spazio. Così che da questa scintilla il circuito si attivi, e la vita sintetica possa nascere.

Ci trovate su:

Facebook attaccapanni.press

Instagram @attaccapanni.press

Twitter @grimorio_comic

Tumblr attaccapannipress.com

 

[ENG version starts here! Please note: all physical books will be in Italian. A digital English PDF will be available for all who buy physical perks upon request. The digital ebook is available in English!]

SYNTH/org is a sci-fi comics anthology all about synthetic life, artificial intelligence, androids: that is, robots!

The volume will be our main publication for 2019, it will bring together 16 italian artists and will have almost 200 pages in full color, at 16x23 cm (6.2x9 inches), perfect bound. For the first time we will print in offset, to give you an even higher quality.

The goal is, like for our past anthologies, to present the book at Lucca Comics & Games 2019.

We count on your support to bring you for yet another year a collection of thrilling, unusual, unforgettable stories!

Attaccapanni Press is a small self-publishing label founded in 2017 after a first project, the Witchcraft Anthology Grimorio in 2016. Ariel Vittori and Laura Guglielmo had so much fun curating and editing that book, they never wanted to stop and made many others: Melagrana, Ave, Grimorio II and now SYNTH/org.

The 13 stories inside are signed by some of the best authors of both traditional and indie publishing. There are already renowned names but also fantastically talented first-timers that will surprise you.  With an introduction by Adrian Fartade, and an incredible cover by Lorenzo Ceccotti, aka LRNZ!

You can already admire some preview of their work for the anthology in our video, in the gallery, and on our social media pages during the whole campaign!

Our perks this year range from Bit to Exabyte, full of juicy data and merch. Curious? All is here revealed.

SYNTH/org, the ebook: a PDF file with all the comics of the Anthology. Available in English! Only in the Bit perk.


SYNTH/org, the book! You can either get it shipped to your home or pick it up at Lucca Comics. Italian only, but you can ask for a complimentary English PDF if you buy the physical copy! From the Byte perk above.

 

Cover by Leonardo Mazzoli.

The exclusive digital artbook of SYNTH/org: work in progress, studies, alternative designs and more. Available in all perks from Kilobyte above.

A gorgeous sticker 50x70 mm with a transparent background, designed by Eleonora Bruni exclusively for our crowdfunding! Available in all perks from Kilobyte above.

The bookmark with an explosive image from Luca Claretti 's story for the anthology, printed on special pearl satin paper. From the Kilobyte per above.

A beautiful collection-worthy enamel pin designed by Laura Guglielmo, our friendly neighborhood graphic designer. To proudly show your love for robots! Only from perk Megabyte and above.

*placeholder design, not final

A sensational t-shirt screen printed with an exclusive design by Walter Baiamonte. ONLY in the Terabyte print.


 

*Impronte's cover design is a placeholder, not final

In the Gigabyte perk you will only find books instead, all the books that Attaccapanni Press is making in 2019! That means besides SYNTH/org you will get:

Iconoclast by Walter Baiamonte, saddle-stitched, 52 pages. The dynamic challenge between a master of photography and a talented rookie eager to steal the spotlight and break the rules. Who's going to come out on top and be hailed as the true artist?

Clessidra n°2, with stories by Ariel Vittori, Genny Ferrari, Chiara Raimondi and Yi Yang, saddle-stitched, 62 pages. The yearly magazine about time and the ways it interacts with people is back with the second issue, this time telling tales of dawn, midday, dusk and midnight.

Impronte by Stefano Martinuz, perfect bound, soft cover, 80+ pages. A touching and wonderfully illustrated coming of age story about a nameless protagonist seeking a new start (and a new family) after losing everything.  [coming this Fall]
 

Sample image by Francesco Guarnaccia.

The exclusive Exabyte pack features, alongside everything from the Megabyte perk, an original commission by one of the following artists: Albhey Longo, Arianna Climaci, Francesco Guarnaccia, Enrica Leone, Laura Guglielmo, Zeno Colangelo. Don't miss out on this awesome opportunity!

 

A book that's binary code friendly needs 1000 copies to be printed, of course! To cover printing costs we will use around 50% of the funds. It will take more than usual because we are switching from digital printing to offset, thanks to the services of Printsoon.

The rest will be needed for the production of other perks (15%), shipping and packaging (15%), Indiegogo fees and taxes (10%), marketing and promotion (5%) and our administration expenses as an Association for 2019 (5%).

 

And if we can go beyond our goal, we have some enticing stretch goals ready!

At €8300 we will make LRNZ's amazing cover even more precious with a gold foil, turning the book into a piece of art.

 

And after that? We have a special surprise for the €10.000 stretch goal, but you'll have to wait for us to get close to know exactly what it is!

This is our fifth crowdfunding campaign.

All the previous ones have been funded, and the perks have been delivered on time, any unexpected trouble with shipping and printing services was successfully overcome.

We are ready for anything that may come our way to give you the best book possible!

Our artists have already been working for many months, so the book will be printed in the summer. The only true risk is not making the goal: that's where you come in!

Whether you can support us directly or not, you can still help us out: share the campaign! Talk about it with friends, cousins, the comic book store closest to you, with co-workers.

And, most of all, on social media! Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to let the campaign go towards infinity and beyond. Let this spark activate the circuits, so that synthetic life may come to light.

You can find us here:

Facebook attaccapanni.press

Instagram @attaccapanni.press

Twitter @grimorio_comic

Tumblr attaccapannipress.com

story:
Copper Coins

Co-creators Charles Denton and Lars Kommienezuspadt exhume the genre of Midcentury horror. Copper Coins is an anthology of chilling tales of psychological hauntings, exploring the grim depths of the human experience.

Writer, Charles Denton of Blue Flame and Lars Kommienezuspadt, creator of THEIA and The Spoils, finally collaborate on this homage to the era of classic EC Comics titles like Tales From the Crypt, The Vault of Horrors and Weird Fantasy.

An allegory of suffering, loss and madness told by Charon, the Ferryman of The River Styx [...our ode to The Crypt Keeper], while traversing souls to the realm of the dead. 

Passchendaele, our first story and the catalyst for our crowdfunding efforts, tells the story of the forgotten nightmare of WWI. While Verdun and The Somme claim the historic relevance, those who died in The Battle of Passchendaele endured unfathomable horrors, swallowed by the earth.

Otto, a German infantry man, imprisoned in mud at the bottom of an artillery hole, impulsively shoots Ira, an Australian solider. As Ira's corpse plummets to the cold November waters, Otto's guilt and increasing madness consume him. The unforgiving rain of Ypres slowly condemns Otto to the same inevitable fate of his fallen company as both men contemplate life, death and the troubled nature of human existence.

Sustainability of the Horror Genre

Copper Coins is for those who remember reading black and white tales of horror like Eerie and Creepy. Our hope is to revitalize and honor that era; to stand on the tombstones of the legendary artists and writers that established the genre some 70 years ago. 

For over a year, Charles and Lars have met weekly to develop Copper Coins, Passchendaele and several stories on deck waiting to cross the River Styx to the page. Your contribution and support provides the creators an opportunity to focus solely on the anthology. The ability to manifest the many concepts and world of Copper Coins to the page, without the constant interruptions of other work, most of which is unrelated to the title.

This Is Personal

As loyalists of horror, whether it's novels, comics or film,  avid consumers of all interpretations of the genre. As creators, every time we break a story, we're trying connect with the inherent fears and dread of the human experience.

Weekly, we meet at our darkened cafe, enduring the Minnesota winter, while building the worlds and characters of Copper Coins over hot cups of black coffee.

This Is Urgent

The most significant hurdle we face as co-creating author and illustrator is having the allotted amount of consistent time over the weeks to work together. Developing these stories will happen. It is our desire to produce our volumes of horror anthology faster and with more detail, plot depth, historical relevance, and with more gripping phycological terror. With each of us owning and operating successful companies [Lars, a professional dark pin up photographer and Charles, a professional home remodeling painter and tiler], we are asking for your help in giving us a gentle ease in focusing more time to this life-long dream.

As we started this project we underestimated the amount of time and dedication it has taken to complete Copper Coins Vol. 1. Over the last year and a half, we've been lucky to meet once or twice a month, usually spending our entire Friday nights over coffee discussing plot details and direction. Now we face a new challenge; specifically the final production details of inking, formatting digital versions, and the final artistic touches. Our ambition is to have more freedom to focus on this project, meeting more readily in the future to development upcoming volumes.

Weekly, we meet at our darkened cafe, enduring the Minnesota winter, while building the worlds and characters of Copper Coins over hot cups of black coffee.


This Is Urgent
The most significant hurdle we face as co-creating author and illustrator is having the allotted amount of consistent time over the weeks to work together. Developing these stories will happen. It is our desire to produce our volumes of horror anthology faster and with more detail, plot depth, historical relevance, and with more gripping phycological terror. With each of us owning and operating successful companies [Lars, a professional dark pin up photographer and Charles, a professional home remodeling painter and tiler], we are asking for your help in giving us a gentle ease in focusing more time to this life-long dream.
As we started this project we underestimated the amount of time and dedication it has taken to complete Copper Coins Vol. 1. Over the last year and a half, we've been lucky to meet once or twice a month, usually spending our entire Friday nights over coffee discussing plot details and direction. Now we face a new challenge; specifically the final production details of inking, formatting digital versions, and the final artistic touches. Our ambition is to have more freedom to focus on this project, meeting more readily in the future to development upcoming volumes.

story:
Hi, fans, followers, and newcomers!

I want to thank everyone including the hardcore fans, the team, the Eisner committee, and Line Webtoons for supporting me on my adventure bringing you all my book, Brothers Bond. Over 4 years ago, I came up with this story and it has been a mind-blowing journey since. Kevin was an amazing addition to make it even better. The Brothers Bond story is about the journey of the haves and have-nots, told through the eyes of a young man going through the coming of age period we all eventually go through at some point in our lives. With a spin of adventure and comedy, the main character Yoshi is on a mission with his two blind samurai protectors to fix his past mistakes and restore the land to what his people and ancestors once cherished. Of Course, any adventure with two blind samurais is always super cool! When I started this series, it was originally meant to be in print. Now I am bringing it to you as it was originally meant to be in full color and spectacular splash pages. This adventure is only beginning. Welcome to the world of Brothers Bond.

- Ryan

 

 

 

 

 

ABOUT BROTHERS BOND: Brothers Bond is a 2018 Eisner Award-nominated webcomic.  This is your chance to be the first to get your hands on the reformatted print edition of season 1, which is approximately 250 pages of content!

Brothers Bond centers on Yoshi, the young, arrogant crown prince set to inherit an empire. After falling into trouble with his father, the one man he fears, Yoshi runs from home. Picked up by two blind, wandering samurai, Yoshi grows up to learn honor and strength. He then decides to return to his homeland, to claim his birthright and save his people from a demon invasion.

A story about good versus evil, dark versus light, and brother versus brother, Brothers Bond is an intriguing tale of honor, respect, and tradition. Fantastical in its art form, yet true at heart to issues everyone can relate to, this is a comic written on many different levels.

 

 

Pages

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Characters

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Shipping

Please note that shipping costs are not included in your pledge. We are working with CRWN on fulfillment services and you will pay actual shipping depending on your region and the size of your order during the BackerKit survey phase.

 

Follow Us on Social

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The book is already reformatted and at the printer. While there can always be a hiccup in production or shipping, this book is done and on its way! We kickstarted the book last year and this a second chance for anyone who missed it to get it on the first printing and the Add Ons!

 

More Pages

story:
Efter förra årets kritikerfavorit, seriesamlingen Ordningen upprätthålls alltid, gör nu den prisade författaren Pär Thörn och den mästerliga serietecknaren Lars Krantz – duon bakom en av de hyllade serienovellerna – en hel bok tillsammans!

I Äganderätten måste ständigt omförhandlas får läsaren följa en SS-dolk från trettiotalets Berlin till tvåtusentalets Borås. Genom århundradet kommer den att ägas av bland annat black metal-musiker, samlare, ockultister och en försupen brevbärare. Det är såväl en hårdkokt och spännande historia som en reflexion kring nittonhundratalets mörka historia, fetischer och våld. 

Äganderätten måste ständigt omförhandlas är en massiv inbunden pjäs på 70 sidor, i ett kvadratiskt format (ca 22x 22 cm) där samtliga illustrationer är tecknade som uppslag. 

Äganderätten måste ständigt omförhandlas kommer att tryckas i en liten, begränsad upplaga – endast 666 numrerade exemplar kommer att finnas till försäljning. Därför hoppas vi på ditt stöd för att finansiera denna totalt  kompromisslösa produktion.

Äganderätten måste ständigt omförhandlas ges ut av Apart Förlag och kommer att finnas i butik från och med hösten 2014. Den kommer dock att finnas till försäljning redan på Bokmässan i Göteborg (26–28 september) – där även de båda upphovsmännen kommer vara på plats för att signera boken i vår monter (A01:31).
De kommer även att ha ett samtal om boken på Seriescenen på lördagen, kl 12.00–12.45. Missa inte det!

Pär Thörn är en av de mest framträdande författarna i sin generation. 

Lars Krantz är den moderna skräckmästaren bland samtida svenska serieskapare.

Dessutom har skribenten Tony Ernst försett boken med ett insiktsfullt och personligt efterord.

– – –

Alla som backar boken kommer att få sitt ex signerat av både Pär och Lars, en anledning så god som någon. Men det finns också ett annat skäl – det ekonomiska: 
a) Till att börja med kommer en större del av köpesumman att gå direkt till förlaget – utan att tunnas ut via en massa mellanhänder som tar procent och provision.
b) På så sätt kan vi snabbare nå break even – vilket innebär att fler smala och alternativa projekt av den här typen kan ges ut.
c) Sist men inte minst: Bokens båda upphovsmän, Pär Thörn och Lars Krantz, kommer få en högre royalty-ersättning i och med punkt a).
(Backar du dessutom ett av Lars Krantz original kan hans ersättning rent av hamna i närheten av en skälig timlön.)   
 

OBS! Backare kommer få sina rewards på posten kort efter Bokmässan!
De som av någon anledning råkar vara på Bokmässan kan med fördel hämta sin(a) reward(s) i vår monter (A01:31) – och får då 50 kronor i rabatt på valfri Apart-bok eftersom vi slipper frakt och emballage.

Ett stort tack till alla som hjälper till att göra detta vansinnesprojekt möjligt!

– – –

*Ordningen upprätthålls alltid är Pär Thörns första deckare och består av 26 noveller (såväl true crime som rena fantasifoster), som illustrerats av 27 av de bästa tecknare och illustratörer som Sverige har att erbjuda. Boken gavs ut 2013 på Apart Förlag** och hyllades unisont av allt från traditionella serieläsare och bokslukande bloggare till poeter och skribenter på kultursidorna i flera av landets största tidningar.
**Flera av novellerna har (eller kommer att) publicerats i den klassiska serietidningen Agent X9 (Egmont Publishing).
    
PRESSRÖSTER OM ORDNINGEN UPPRÄTTHÅLLS ALLTID:

"Det är en hårdkokt och minimalistisk övning i existentiell krimi. Fåordig, slagfärdig och i bästa Oulipo-anda reglerad."
Niklas Qvarnström, Sydsvenskan

"Ett gäng roliga och dråpliga berättelser från samhällets skuggsida, om ond bråd död och om ett system som i varje enskilt fall och i minsta detalj förstärker rådande norm. Det är underhållande och finurligt.”
Marie Pettersson, Helsingborgs Dagblad

"Ett av årets bästa svenska seriealbum." 
Bengt Eriksson, Kvällsposten

"Detta album är en av de största positiva överraskningarna jag varit med om de senaste åren när det gäller den svenska utgivningen."
Staffan Dahlberg, Staffars serier

”Den grafiska novellettsamlingen kallar sig deckare och det stämmer men den innehåller också så mycket mer. Vi hittar, för att nämna några av verkets många spår, poesi, film noir-pastisch, samhällskritik och existentialistiskt filosoferande.”
Martin Memet Könick, Konstpretton

”Jag gillar faktiskt allt, men vill ändå slå ett särskilt slag för Lars Krantz!”
Roger Bengtsson, Ikon 1931

”Skräckserietecknaren Lars Krantz bidrar med en mörk och grafiskt tilltalande grej om en kille som tror sig vara Kurt Wallander!”
Pidde Andersson, Toppraffel

”Allra läckrast tecknad är Lars Krantz ”Polisen med patos” som inte är vad den först verkar. Jag skulle verkligen vilja läsa ett ny längre skräckserie av Krantz.”
Richard Karlsson, Shazam

Mer information om Ordningen upprätthålls alltid hittar du här.

PS. Om du mot förmodan inte redan har Ordningen upprätthålls alltid så passa på att backa ”Pär Thörn-paketet” – då får du båda böckerna, signerade av såväl Pär som Lars (och kanske någon till som en extra bonus om du har tur…).  


Arkivarie

Black metal-konsert


New York

Knarkare 1

Knarkare 2

Ritual 1


Ritual 2


Snutar i regnet


Lobotomioperation


Smuggling


Revolver och dolk


Rånet


Barliv


Döden


På resande fot


SS-soldater på vakt

Dolken

story:
A stand-up comedian makes people laugh.

We have laughed till it hurts. We have laughed till we cried.

But to get us there, a comedian needs to be honest, courageous, and authentic, in order to tell jokes that the audience connects with.

And there is one comedian I know who embodies all of that – Kumar.

 

I am producing a documentary on the struggles and pain of Kumar as a stand-up comedian.

We need YOUR help to make our fundraising a success. We need funds for a crew, to procure equipment, and honor Kumar for his time and effort.

 

This will be a documentary on the brutal honesty and courage behind the excruciating difficulties and ugly sides of comedy.

Comedy gets us to be honest about ourselves, with ourselves.

Comedy is about pain, it is about struggle, and sometimes it hurts.

Comedy inspires us to be real, and comfortable in our own skin.

Presenting: Laughing Till It Hurts.
