story:
Update: STRETCH GOALS!

We've met our goal AND our first stretch goal, and we're working on our second stretch goal: If we raise $16,000, we'll make a poster of this comic and ship it out to backers at $75 and above (others will get a chance to buy it!): 

Also the price of our "relationship consultation" and "relationship counseling" perks has just been dropped to $500!

It's a Kimchi Cuddles Book!

Hi, I'm Tikva Wolf! Two years ago, I created Kimchi Cuddles, a webcomic that explores alternative relationships in a variety of different ways. Kimchi spreads awareness about poly, queer and genderqueer issues in a way that's both funny and touching. The comic took off at a rapid pace, and I get emails every day from people sharing how much the comic has helped them or inspired them to be more authentic and loving in their own relationships. I feel incredibly happy about having touched so many lives. But I want to do more.

This book will be a compilation of the “best of Kimchi Cuddles,” arranged by topic to create an inspirational guide for navigating alternative relationships and explaining them to others. You can help bring this incredible book into existence by contributing to this campaign, AND you’ll get awesome prizes for doing so!  Check out the reward details below, donate whatever you can, and spread the word to everyone you know! Let’s make a Kimchi Cuddles book!

Who am I?

I've been drawing ever since I could hold a crayon. After undergoing many different artistic incarnations, I realized that what I primarily care about in art (and life) is connecting to people, creating dialogue and spreading awareness.  I've always taken delight in making people laugh, and in doing so also unveiling hidden perspectives.  Comedy has the ability to transform heavy topics into something that’s easier to digest.  I use humor as a way of being seen deeply, and as a way of encouraging others to deeply see themselves and each other.

The book will also have a foreword from the amazing Sophie Labelle, creator of the webcomic Assigned Male!



I'm working with Thorntree Press: a new, independent publishing company based in Portland, Oregon. They specialize in non-fiction books on relationships, love and sexuality, with particular focus on non-traditional relationship models. They're also focused on rational, evidence-based approaches to sex and relationships, as well as sharing real-life stories. They're the publishers of More Than Two by Franklin Veaux and Eve Rickert, The Husband Swap by Louisa Leontiades, The Game Changer by Franklin Veaux, Stories From the Polycule by Elisabeth Sheff, and Lessons in Love and Life to My Younger Self, written by Louisa Leontiades and illustrated by me!

Thorntree Press uses crowdfunding to fund production and marketing for all of its books, so they can maintain high production standards, take bigger risks on their titles, and give creators a bigger share of royalties. They've already completed two successful crowdfunding campaigns, for More Than Two and their 2015 season, with hundreds of happy backers!

The money raised in this campaign will go toward editing, layout, proofreading and production and marketing costs.


The Rewards

If you support me, you can get my book, as well as a bunch of other cool Kimchi Cuddles stuff—including original artwork from the series! At higher backer levels, you can also get a sneak peek at the book before it's published.

I'm also excited to be able to offer print and e-books of all the other Thorntree Press titles, and a bunch of other things from other poly and poly-friendly folks. Check out what you can get!

International backers: We will ship to backers outside the USA, but we'll be asking you for a little extra to help out with costs. Thorntree Press is handling fulfilment and will be in touch with you after the campaign to request a small additional amount based on your location and perk.

Kimchi book & other goodies

Of course, you can get the Kimchi Cuddles book in both paperback and e-book. And everyone who backs the campaign will get digital access to an exclusive secret Kimchi Cuddles comic, plus a personal thank-you on the Kimchi Cuddles Facebook page.

We've also got these awesome stickers for backers starting at the $10 level.



Kimchi Cuddles "Ask me about polyamory!" buttons!


Original hand-drawn artwork from the series, and personalized notes from me—with kisses!



A high-quality art print of cosmic dancing Kimchi.


A custom portrait of your own polycule!

A handmade Kimchi doll! Now you can cuddle Kimchi! Only one available.

An original Kimchi painting (only one available).

If you back at a top level, I'll hang out with you by Skype!


Books from Thorntree Press

We're making the entire Thorntree Press list available in print and e-book format!

Lessons in Love and Life to My Younger Self: A Companion Guide to The Husband Swap (e-book only)
Louisa Leontiades, 2015
Illustrations by Tikva Wolf, foreword by Franklin Veaux
What does opening your relationship teach you about the nature of life, love and yourself?

Stretch goal! If we raise $12,000, we'll be able to create a print edition of Lessons—and send a free print copy to all backers at $50 and above!


The Husband Swap: A True Story of Unconventional Love
Louisa Leontiades, 2015
Foreword by Noël Lynne Figart

Four ordinary people challenge monogamy to pursue a utopia of limitless love.


Stories from the Polycule: Real Life in Polyamorous Families
Dr. Elisabeth Sheff, cover illustration by Tikva Wolf

An anthology of work from people living in polyamorous families of all configurations.

The Game Changer: A Memoir of Disruptive Love
Franklin Veaux, 2015
Foreword by A.V. Flox

Franklin and Celeste’s open marriage seemed perfectly safe—until the day Amber entered his life and showed them why the heart does not obey rules.

More Than Two: A Practical Guide to Ethical Polyamory
Franklin Veaux and Eve Rickert, 2014
Foreword by Janet W. Hardy

The long-awaited, wide-ranging resource exploring the often-complex world of living polyamorously.

Thorntree Press is also offering original artwork: interior drawings from More Than Two, or the cover illustration from The Husband Swap.
And if you back me at the top $5,000 level, you'll get a lifetime subscription to Thorntree Press: e-book and paperback copies of every book they ever publish!

Other goodies!

I'm excited to be able to offer perks from some of my supporters, who have amazing talents of their own! Here's what else is on offer:

CDs of steampunk time lord rock from the Ken Spivey Band (only 5 available).


3.5" Handmade solid glass infinity-heart paperweight in red and gold, from Trevor Lewis. (Photo to come!)

Consultations and counseling

Two lucky $500+ backers will have a chance to get a session with Sheffa Ariens or Elisabeth Sheff. We only have one session per person available!
Counseling session, Shefa Ariens

Sheffa Ariens is a licensed marriage and family therapist in North Carolina. She has a master's degree in counseling psychology with a specialization in body-oriented psychotherapies and group process. She has more than 10 years of experience working as a psychotherapist in private practice with individuals, couples and poly groups.

Relationship consultation, Dr. Elisabeth Sheff

One of just a handful of global academic experts on polyamory and the foremost international expert on children in polyamorous families, Dr. Sheff is an educational consultant and expert witness serving sexual and gender minorities.

Dr. Sheff's consultations are designed to answer clients’ questions regarding their own actual or potential relationships using research data. Sessions aim to provide information and help clients to clarify their own thoughts and expectations, and consider some of the pitfalls that are common in this type of relationships, how other people have dealt with these difficulties, and how those various strategies worked out. While clients often discuss their emotions during these consultations, they are not counseling sessions and Dr. Sheff is not a therapist. Dr. Sheff is happy to provide referrals for clients seeking counseling.

Stretch goals!

Because you are amazing, we've got two stretch goals for the campaign:

  • If we hit $12,000 we will issue a print edition of Lessons in Love and Life to my Younger Self, which has 32 original illustrations from me! All backers at $50 and above will get a copy!
  • If we hit $16,000 (OMG you guys really?!) we will be able to create a Kimchi Cuddles poster of this comic and ship it out to backers at $75 and above (others will get a chance to buy it!): 


What my fans say

"Thank you so much for doing the Kimchi Cuddles comic. It's the perfect mix of humor, politics, heart, and earnestness that helps reassure me that my lifestyle isn't some crazy freak of myself!"

"Your comic was a beacon to me in a very dark time, that I am coming out of the last few months, now with curiosity and gratitude. I've felt the urge to validate you for (one of) your life's work(s), for it has validated mine too, and helped save it. Much love, hope, and curiosity to you!"

"Thank you so much for your insights thru your comics! You very well have started a revolution, or at the least, gave an already existing revolution the atom bomb of love and acceptance!"

"Anyway, I stumbled across your comic at the most necessary of times and first wanted to let you know how grateful I am that you are producing this kind of stuff for the world to see- such poignant and funny language for really rich content and wisdom. So thank you thank you thank you thank you. You saved me a couple of times."

"I wanted to thank you for the character of Marco. I'm an AFAB genderfluid/transmasculine dude and always felt like my phases of feeling or presenting female invalidated me from being able to claim a trans male identity. He helped me learn that I can live life as a trans dude without having to get surgery for the genitals I like sometimes, and continue to express my femininity however I choose! I can be a guy who's "totally a hot chick sometimes," and my true friends won't tell me I'm not a real guy or a real trans person. I came to your comic ready to learn more about my poly identity, and now I've discovered how to be myself in a new way!"

"Thanks for all you do - your art is a truly beautiful and helpful thing for many. I know it's helped me and those I love to name and recognize and talk about our feelings and experiences on many occasions. Thank you."


Video notes

Our awesome campaign video with animated Kimchi was created by Derek Alan Rowe of Doctrine Creative. And the woman with two boyfriends in the opening mashup is filmmaker Terisa Greenan, creator of Family: a 2008 YouTube series documenting the adventures and misadventures of a Seattle-area polycule. 


Questions?

Got a question about something not covered here? Send an email to press@thorntreepress.com.
story_txt:
Update: STRETCH GOALS!
We've met our goal AND our first stretch goal, and we're working on our second stretch goal: If we raise $16,000, we'll make a poster of this comic and ship it out to backers at $75 and above (others will get a chance to buy it!): 





Also the price of our "relationship consultation" and "relationship counseling" perks has just been dropped to $500!

It's a Kimchi Cuddles Book! 
Hi, I'm Tikva Wolf!  Two years ago, I created Kimchi Cuddles, a webcomic that explores alternative relationships in a variety of different ways.  Kimchi spreads awareness about poly, queer and genderqueer issues in a way that's both funny and touching. The comic took off at a rapid pace, and I get emails every day from people sharing how much the comic has helped them or inspired them to be more authentic and loving in their own relationships. I feel incredibly happy about having touched so many lives. But I want to do more.
This book will be a compilation of the “best of Kimchi Cuddles,” arranged by topic to create an inspirational guide for navigating alternative relationships and explaining them to others. You can help bring this incredible book into existence by contributing to this campaign, AND you’ll get awesome prizes for doing so!  Check out the reward details below, donate whatever you can, and spread the word to everyone you know! Let’s make a Kimchi Cuddles book!

Who am I?



I've been drawing ever since I could hold a crayon. After undergoing many different artistic incarnations, I realized that what I primarily care about in art (and life) is connecting to people, creating dialogue and spreading awareness.  I've always taken delight in making people laugh, and in doing so also unveiling hidden perspectives.  Comedy has the ability to transform heavy topics into something that’s easier to digest.  I use humor as a way of being seen deeply, and as a way of encouraging others to deeply see themselves and each other.


The book will also have a foreword from the amazing Sophie Labelle, creator of the webcomic Assigned Male!






I'm working with Thorntree Press: a new, independent publishing company based in Portland, Oregon. They specialize in non-fiction books on relationships, love and sexuality, with particular focus on non-traditional relationship models. They're also focused on rational, evidence-based approaches to sex and relationships, as well as sharing real-life stories. They're the publishers of More Than Two by Franklin Veaux and Eve Rickert, The Husband Swap by Louisa Leontiades, The Game Changer by Franklin Veaux, Stories From the Polycule by Elisabeth Sheff, and Lessons in Love and Life to My Younger Self, written by Louisa Leontiades and illustrated by me!
Thorntree Press uses crowdfunding to fund production and marketing for all of its books, so they can maintain high production standards, take bigger risks on their titles, and give creators a bigger share of royalties. They've already completed two successful crowdfunding campaigns, for More Than Two and their 2015 season, with hundreds of happy backers!
The money raised in this campaign will go toward editing, layout, proofreading and production and marketing costs.


The Rewards
If you support me, you can get my book, as well as a bunch of other cool Kimchi Cuddles stuff—including original artwork from the series! At higher backer levels, you can also get a sneak peek at the book before it's published.
I'm also excited to be able to offer print and e-books of all the other Thorntree Press titles, and a bunch of other things from other poly and poly-friendly folks. Check out what you can get!
International backers: We will ship to backers outside the USA, but we'll be asking you for a little extra to help out with costs. Thorntree Press is handling fulfilment and will be in touch with you after the campaign to request a small additional amount based on your location and perk.

Kimchi book & other goodies


Of course, you can get the Kimchi Cuddles book in both paperback and e-book. And everyone who backs the campaign will get digital access to an exclusive secret Kimchi Cuddles comic, plus a personal thank-you on the Kimchi Cuddles Facebook page.


We've also got these awesome stickers for backers starting at the $10 level.



Kimchi Cuddles "Ask me about polyamory!" buttons!


Original hand-drawn artwork from the series, and personalized notes from me—with kisses!



A high-quality art print of cosmic dancing Kimchi.







A custom portrait of your own polycule!


A handmade Kimchi doll! Now you can cuddle Kimchi! Only one available.



An original Kimchi painting (only one available).


If you back at a top level, I'll hang out with you by Skype!



Books from Thorntree Press
We're making the entire Thorntree Press list available in print and e-book format!


Lessons in Love and Life to My Younger Self: A Companion Guide to The Husband Swap (e-book only)
Louisa Leontiades, 2015
Illustrations by Tikva Wolf, foreword by Franklin Veaux
What does opening your relationship teach you about the nature of life, love and yourself?
Stretch goal! If we raise $12,000, we'll be able to create a print edition of Lessons—and send a free print copy to all backers at $50 and above!



The Husband Swap: A True Story of Unconventional Love
Louisa Leontiades, 2015Foreword by Noël Lynne Figart
Four ordinary people challenge monogamy to pursue a utopia of limitless love.






Stories from the Polycule: Real Life in Polyamorous Families
Dr. Elisabeth Sheff, cover illustration by Tikva Wolf
An anthology of work from people living in polyamorous families of all configurations.


The Game Changer: A Memoir of Disruptive Love
Franklin Veaux, 2015Foreword by A.V. Flox
Franklin and Celeste’s open marriage seemed perfectly safe—until the day Amber entered his life and showed them why the heart does not obey rules.





More Than Two: A Practical Guide to Ethical Polyamory
Franklin Veaux and Eve Rickert, 2014Foreword by Janet W. Hardy
The long-awaited, wide-ranging resource exploring the often-complex world of living polyamorously.



Thorntree Press is also offering original artwork: interior drawings from More Than Two, or the cover illustration from The Husband Swap.
And if you back me at the top $5,000 level, you'll get a lifetime subscription to Thorntree Press: e-book and paperback copies of every book they ever publish!


Other goodies!
I'm excited to be able to offer perks from some of my supporters, who have amazing talents of their own! Here's what else is on offer:



CDs of steampunk time lord rock from the Ken Spivey Band (only 5 available).


3.5" Handmade solid glass infinity-heart paperweight in red and gold, from Trevor Lewis. (Photo to come!)
Consultations and counseling
Two lucky $500+ backers will have a chance to get a session with Sheffa Ariens or Elisabeth Sheff. We only have one session per person available!
Counseling session, Shefa Ariens

Sheffa Ariens is a licensed marriage and family therapist in North Carolina. She has a master's degree in counseling psychology with a specialization in body-oriented psychotherapies and group process. She has more than 10 years of experience working as a psychotherapist in private practice with individuals, couples and poly groups.


Relationship consultation, Dr. Elisabeth Sheff


One of just a handful of global academic experts on polyamory and the foremost international expert on children in polyamorous families, Dr. Sheff is an educational consultant and expert witness serving sexual and gender minorities.


Dr. Sheff's consultations are designed to answer clients’ questions regarding their own actual or potential relationships using research data. Sessions aim to provide
information and help clients to clarify their own thoughts and expectations, and
consider some of the pitfalls that are common in this type of relationships,
how other people have dealt with these difficulties, and how those various
strategies worked out. While clients often discuss their emotions during these
consultations, they are not counseling sessions and Dr. Sheff is not a
therapist. Dr. Sheff is happy to provide referrals for clients seeking
counseling.





Stretch goals!

Because you are amazing, we've got two stretch goals for the campaign:

If we hit $12,000 we will issue a print edition of Lessons in Love and Life to my Younger Self, which has 32 original illustrations from me! All backers at $50 and above will get a copy!
If we hit $16,000 (OMG you guys really?!) we will be able to create a Kimchi Cuddles poster of this comic and ship it out to backers at $75 and above (others will get a chance to buy it!): 










What my fans say


"Thank you so much for doing the Kimchi Cuddles comic. It's the perfect mix of humor, politics, heart, and earnestness that helps reassure me that my lifestyle isn't some crazy freak of myself!"
"Your comic was a beacon to me in a very dark time, that I am coming out of the last few months, now with curiosity and gratitude. I've felt the urge to validate you for (one of) your life's work(s), for it has validated mine too, and helped save it. Much love, hope, and curiosity to you!"
"Thank you so much for your insights thru your comics! You very well have started a revolution, or at the least, gave an already existing revolution the atom bomb of love and acceptance!"
"Anyway, I stumbled across your comic at the most necessary of times and first wanted to let you know how grateful I am that you are producing this kind of stuff for the world to see- such poignant and funny language for really rich content and wisdom. So thank you thank you thank you thank you. You saved me a couple of times."
"I wanted to thank you for the character of Marco. I'm an AFAB genderfluid/transmasculine dude and always felt like my phases of feeling or presenting female invalidated me from being able to claim a trans male identity. He helped me learn that I can live life as a trans dude without having to get surgery for the genitals I like sometimes, and continue to express my femininity however I choose! I can be a guy who's "totally a hot chick sometimes," and my true friends won't tell me I'm not a real guy or a real trans person. I came to your comic ready to learn more about my poly identity, and now I've discovered how to be myself in a new way!"
"Thanks for all you do - your art is a truly beautiful and helpful thing for many. I know it's helped me and those I love to name and recognize and talk about our feelings and experiences on many occasions. Thank you."



Video notes
Our awesome campaign video with animated Kimchi was created by Derek Alan Rowe of Doctrine Creative. And the woman with two boyfriends in the opening mashup is filmmaker Terisa Greenan, creator of Family: a 2008 YouTube series documenting the adventures and misadventures of a Seattle-area polycule. 

Questions?
Got a question about something not covered here? Send an email to press@thorntreepress.com.

story:
UPDATE: Thanks for your support guys! $400 puts a huge dent in my printing costs. If you're in Phoenix in May, come to Phoenix Comicon and visit my booth.

Dylan McVillain

Dylan McVillian is a Web Comic about a Super Villain that might actually be less of a threat to his city than the resident Super Heroes. This first book covers his reluctant role reversal as he attempts to save the city from alien invaders (so that he can take it for himself of course).

 Who am I?

I'm Kevin Coulston, creator of Dylan McVillain. You might also be familiar with my long running Web Comic "StaleBacon".

I created Dylan McVillain after a dissapointing experience at a convention last year. Turns out kids love my art style and their parents are more than willing to purchase my books for their kids... until I inform them of StaleBacon's subject matter (Ocassional Adult Humor/Bad Language). I've also wanted to create a comic with characters and a story for quite a while (something I don't do with StaleBacon).

My solution to both of these problems was to create a story driven all ages comic that both kids and adults could enjoy.

This Indiegogo campaign was created to print the first collection of Dylan McVillain Comics. "Dylan McVillain: A Super Villain with the Best Intentions". Over 100 pages (including content you won't find online). 

You should also be aware that if you pledge for a book, you will recieve a book regardless of what I raise. If I reach my goal I will add more bonuses including some that will be awarded to everyone that pledged before the goal was met.

If you're here to buy a book, or you're just an occasional reader. I thank you for your continued support.

- Kevin Coulston

The Book

Sketch Book Page Example

story:
NEW PERK! IN COMICS ALLIANCE COVER!!!
 


$45K STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED: 8 ADDITIONAL PAGES OF CONTENT!

I'm going to add 8 pages to LONESTAR #1, and fill it with special thanks, listing every public supporter as a permanent member of the LONESTAR SQUADRON!  And with the rest of the room, I'll be adding pages of artwork, a sketch-book section as it were.  :)

$50K STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED: LONESTAR SQUADRON FIRST BRIGADE DOG TAGS!

If you are a first mover in these first 30 days of LONESTAR on indiegogo, AND you bought any level perk that requires shipping, you are not only a permanent member of the LONESTAR SQUADRON, you get DOG TAGS to PROVE IT!  Sorry, but if I can't ship you anything, I can't ship you your FREE DOG TAGS EITHER!

$60K STRETCH GOAL: TRADING CARDS!

COVER A:May I summarize?

Hello! And welcome to my first Indiegogo campaign!  My name is Mike S. Miller, I'm a 26 year veteran of the comic book industry, best known for my artwork in the NYTimes best selling, and #1 digital comic book in the world, INJUSTICE: GODS AMONG US, and INJUSTICE 2 for DC COMICS.  I'm also the cover artist for A GAME OF THRONES, you've probably heard of that one...  

I'm from San Diego, California, where I live with my amazing and beautiful wife, and 5 insane children who pull me in every direction!  I've gone rogue from the mainstream comics plantation, and have struck out on this new venture to reshape the very nature of comicdom itself!  What's that you say?  Aiming a little high am I?  Well, I figure if I aim for the moon, I might hit the top of the mountain.  But either way, it's a long, steep climb, and I'll need your help to get this thing started!

COVER B:

A little bit me, a little bit you...

I'm aiming less high with my initial funding request, just enough to cover the printing, distribution, and fees of the comic, plus some money for my colorist and letterer.  I'm really hoping to make enough that I don't have to focus on finding other work and can start building the future that I envision for Blacklist Universe!

We're keeping the perks simple, and the prices as low as feasible:

$5 Gets you permanent membership in the Lonestar Squadron!

$15 flat Gets you a digital copy of Lonestar: Heart of the Hero #1

$20 Cover A or B + Shipping

$25 signed A or B + Shipping

$30 signed cover A PLUS Digital copy

$40 both copies signed + shipping

$80 - Lonestar for troops - Buy 5 signed copies for yourself and we'll send minimum of 5 to USO. If we can, we will send more. NO SHIPPING! (best deal?  HECK YEAH!)

$100 Lonestar slabbed!  CGC graded 9.8 

$100 also gets you the LATE BLOOMER'S SPECIAL! Both covers signed, plus metal prints of two additional images, the punch Hitler history image, and the 'origin' story piece.

$100 Cover B with a remarque a head sketch on it!)  + shipping

$200-300 gets you a blank sketch cover with a full drawing of a bust or torso, not just a doodle, an honest to goodness pen and ink drawing!

$250 gets you a SLAB of SLABS!  5 CGC 9.8 copies of LONESTAR #1!

$250 is a retailer special (but available to anyone) you get 25 copies, 12 of each cover SIGNED, and one comes with a head sketch!

For $750, you can BE IN LONESTAR!  You'll either be a vampire or a victim in one of the upcoming LONESTAR books!

SOLD OUT - Name an Unknown Soldier after yourself (or whoever, but not Adolf or Benito, or I.P. Freely...) + sketch cover + 10 copies so you can brag to your friends and family that you're in a comic book!

$3000 - Be a character! I will replace a character in the book by name and face to match you, AND draw you and Lonestar together in a piece of original art you can frame! + Plus all comic tiers.

$10,000- ONE cover.  I am not selling the original pages to Lonestar.  Sorry, collectors.  The ONE piece of art that will be available from this first, historic comic book will be ONE of the TWO alternate covers.  You buy this perk, you will be the ONLY PERSON ON EARTH besides me who owns original Lonestar: Heart of the Hero published work.  And YOU get to pick which cover you want!  Hope you brought bags o' money, because this one ain't cheap!

Please check the perks out for more specific details!

Do Do you want to believe in heroes again?

Can you feel it?  In the air?  That whiff of hope? The hairs standing on end, telling you there is change coming?  That is LONESTAR.  That is the BLACKLIST UNIVERSE!  And that's what you are helping to build by supporting this campaign!  We ARE going to change the world!  We're going to move the needle!  We're going to make Comics GREAT AGAIN!

I'm no spring chicken.  I've been doing this for a quarter of a century, PLUS, and the Blacklist Universe has been culminating in my mind and on my computer and in my sketches for all that time, yearning to break free with this one faithful step.  This one fateful project.  This one great hero who will bring joy and hope and faith back to the comic book world.  Oh, yes, you WILL believe in HEROES again.  And it all starts NOW!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Lonestar needs you, as much as you need him.  Like the flower needs the rain, oh, yes, he needs you. He needs your support, not only financially, so that he can live, and thrive and grow, but he needs your voice!  He needs your LOVE!  He needs you to get out there and tell the WORLD about him!  And even if you can't afford to help him now, it costs nothing to spread the good word...

There's a hero coming.  Let the people know.  Hope is on the way.  LONESTAR IS HERE!

Here's a preview of the first 10 pages of LONESTAR!!!

Thanks for looking!  I hope we have your support for LONESTAR: HEART OF THE HERO #1!!!

story:
When Dynamite Entertainment made headlines with their sales of the new Vampirella ongoing series, it made me a bit nostalgic for my time spent on previous Vampirella titles. She's been one of those characters I love to draw and my time spent on titles like "Dawn/Vampirella" and "Roses for the Dead" are some of my favorite projects.

The video above shows you how I developed this new cover from concept to finished art piece, but I hope the fans can also see the passion and energy behind it. Attention to detail has always been a focus of mine and this cover was no different!

Dynamite and I worked closely together to include this cover with their print run and that means the cover is already printed and ready for fans!

SKETCHED COVERS!

I'm also offering a select number of the "black and white virgin" cover with an original head sketch by me! Your choice of Dawn or Vampirella...

PREVIOUS GRAPHIC NOVELS!

My previous Vampirella titles are also available to help some fans catch-up with my previous Vampirella tales...

Linsner created Dawn, the sensual goddess of birth and rebirth, in 1989 for the indie sensation anthology Cry for Dawn. Her indelible design instantly captivated fans thanks to Linsner's talents. As of today, Dawn has starred in half a dozen series and other appearances, helped by one of the most passionate fanbases in independent comics.

Together with his writing partner and Vampirella super fan, Kristina Deak-Linsner, he created the critically acclaimed Vampirella: Roses for the Dead limited series which brought the Daughter of Drakulon's ally Evily the witch back to prominence. The Roses for the Dead hardcover collection released this August.

story:
What Are You Backing?

This is first issue of a new comics magazine. The type of stories will be scifi and fantasy. This issue will have two stories, for a total of 48 pages.  If this is successful, subsequent issues will have more content. 

What are the stories?

Three sisters in arms travel the land in search of riches and adventure. Follow Gala, Cayla and Seyelia on their journey as they make use of their powers and skills to defeat villains, vanquish demons and perfect their craft. A fantasy action tale for lovers of manga, anime and fighting games.

Our planet had been taken over by an alien race. The last vestige of human is on its last leg. Their only hope is an old mecha that no one seems to be able to active. 

 

 

Joshua Metzger

Writes the crime comics Punch Drunk (Arcana Comics), Metzger and Pawlak Presents: Villain (Evoluzione Publishing) and Le Fay (No Sleep/Evoluzione Publishing).

Matteo Leoni 

Matteo Leoni was born in Albano Laziale (metropolitan city of Rome) in the 1992. He attended the “Scuola Internazionale di Comics” in Rome and, after obteining the diploma, starts to work immediately for italian little publishers. In the 2016 published with Manfont the post-apocalyptic/fantasy comic “2700 Apocrypha” and, from 2017 to 2018, works on Sci-fi comic “Space Anabasis” published by Edizioni Segni D’Autore.

In the 2018 he also worked on a itaian Indie comic called “Midnight Roads“ and currently he’s drawing the Destiny NY spinoff “Cherry Gilbert: The Necromancer”,  published by Space Between Entertainment and written by Vita Ayala and Pat Shand

Guido Martinez 

Torn-S

In 2016, until now, open for commission comic / manga / pinup / design character on art websites such as Devainart / Pixiv and Facebook.ธนธรณ์ สนองบุญ  ( Thanathorn Sanunboon ) or  artist name Torn-S was born in 1985 Bangkok (Thailand). Started working on comics at the age of 17 by becoming an assistant cartoonist at Cx comic company.
Age 19, started working on his comic action / sci-fi "Control Battle" with Siam inter comic company and Thai cartoon studio (in Thailand)
After that, he made comic books from "Summoner master" (in Thailand) and comic books / Action / fantasy "The last Avata elixir of war".

story:
To quickly find out what our comic is about, you can watch the video. But if you still have questions, we’re here to answer them!

Yes, it’s a comic book with 24 pages filled with chills, humor and a little real-life pathos. 

Well, do you like…

  • Fun comic books like Sabrina, Saga and Crossed?
  • Fun movies like Evil Dead 2, The Breakfast Club and Beetlejuice?
  • Fun TV shows like Stranger Things, The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina and Friday Night Lights?

Then you’ll probably like this comic too! (However, if you don’t like fun, we have a tedious copyright disclaimer written in our best legalese that might be right up your alley!)

Five teens take on H.P. Lovecraft’s monsters and their small-town high school … They’re just not sure which is worse.

Miskatonic High is an ongoing series packed with light horror, tongue-in-cheek humor and the amazing artwork of Ryan Mendoza (who can draw just about anything with a tentacle).

Parental advisory: There’s so many great series for young adults nowadays that you might be fooled into buying this for your five-year-old, but this series is rated PG-13 and more for teens and above.

In the rustic hills of a small New England Berkshire town lies the prestigious Miskatonic High School. When the Community Service Club goes on a field trip, they’ll be launched on a terrifying adventure that will change their lives while birthing an evil into our modern century. 

This is the beginning of the six-issue first season of the new high school horror series Miskatonic High.

We hope so, but here are some unbiased reviews.

Jenn Marshall of Sirens of Sequentials said:

“Miskatonic High is a fun story that balances everything you want in a good horror story. There is some gore, but not so much that you get overwhelmed. The jokes are funny, but they don’t make the story feel like a parody of something else. It was well thought out, and I cannot wait to see where it is going to go next.”

“Artist Ryan Mendoza brings a level of detail to the story that perfectly compliments the writing style. It fits the spooky storytelling by adding shadow to hide monsters, and the detail in the backgrounds make you want to spend time on each panel.” 

“The monsters are very Lovecraftian. … Because they have that Lovecraftian feel to them, the monsters really are both written and drawn in a way that affected my Lizard Brain.” Read the full review

The Pullbox called it “the bastard lovechild of John Hughes & H.P. Lovecraft.” (We’re pretty sure they meant that in a metaphorical way, because if that’s literal, well… ewww.) 

Here’s more from Paul’s review: “It brings a mismatched group of high schoolers together, throwing them against evil the likes of which you’d find in a dusty tome full of impossible to pronounce names. The beauty is in the execution. Despite some pretty heavy themes -- mounting madness, eternal torment, human sacrifice -- Mike Shea’s story stays fairly tongue in cheek. [Artist Ryan Mendoza] knows how to get his Lovecraft on. So many tentacles…” Read the full review

Items

Before you back Miskatonic High, check out some of the items we have to offer. We offer shipping to anywhere in the world, but shipping costs are separate from the costs.

 

 

Of course. Here’s the first few pages of Miskatonic High #1 so you can see if you like it.

Stick with us as through the six-issue first season, Alex, Matt, Sarah, Simon and Ren will travel through time to come face to face with Abdul Alhazred and his Necronomicon, descend into the darkest pits under the earth, and learn what is really going on in the public library when no one is looking.

So please join us for the fun!

We’re raising funds to pay for a small print run for our Indiegogo backers and the old one lurking down in the basement. But comics are expensive to make. Printers, the Postal Service and shipping supplies will be taking most of what we raise. Indiegogo takes their percentage, as does payment processing. If anything is left over, we might go nuts on McDonald’s Dollar Menu!

Is that an existential question, because we haven’t gotten that far in AP English Lit yet. 

Yes, there are two guys working hard to bring Miskatonic High to life. The comic was written and lettered by Mike Shea and drawn and colored by Ryan Mendoza. We’d say more about ourselves, but we’re actually really busy putting the finishing touches on issue 8! 

So you can feel comfortable getting invested in Miskatonic High, because you’re sure to find out the answers to what is really going on!

Additionally, you can follow Miskatonic High on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Plus there's a Miskatonic High website where you can sign up to our mailing list for the latest updates.

Haven't I seen you before?

We did a successful campaign on Kickstarter but have heard that Indiegogo has its own indie comics community and wanted to see if we could find any supporters over here. Consider this a trial for us to settle the whole Indiegogo vs. Kickstarter thing.

Attribution

"Hey guys, who did that amazing music in your video?" 

Glad you asked, it's a track called Wizard by Jahzzar, which is available on the Free Music Archive. We edited the track to fit our video.

The cover and pages for the issue are completed and are just waiting to go to print. We have quotes from several printers which specialize in on-demand comic printing and fulfillment. The pages will be sent in late-May and the issues take approximately two weeks to print. It will take another week or so for all of the items to ship. You should receive the items around the end of June, but we'll keep you updated on the schedule as we find out.

So, really, the biggest risk is an aquatic monster dismembering you and dragging you down your drainpipe. But don’t worry, we know the number for a really good reanimator.

story:
Become a Meta Hero

(or a Meta Villain, Cyborg, Kaiju, shiftless Meta Drug Dealer, Saucy Kaiju Sex Worker, etc.)

in a future issue of DOSE!

You can become whatever your heart desires within DOSE!, if you've got the cubits to pay, and for the tidy sum of $500, you can become a character within a future issue of DOSE!.  

Ever dream of becoming a superhero in a comic book?  Or perhaps you've always wanted to become a super villain?  Here's the opportunity to become the character you've always wanted and be forever immortalized within a future issue of DOSE! as a character based on YOU!!! 

After a brief correspondence, Sean Ellis, the writer of DOSE!, will craft a unique origin story for your character.  Following this, John Gebbia, the artist of DOSE!, will then incorporate this origin story and create an original piece of artwork for you to own.  Soon after, your new and original character will appear within a future issue of DOSE!. 

Here's your opportunity to not only make your first appearance as a character within a comic book, but also receive a beautiful piece of comic art to add to your collection.  Become a Meta Hero, Meta Villain, Cyborg, Kaiju, shiftless Meta Drug Dealer, Saucy Kaiju Sex Worker or even your very own human self! 

Don't miss this opportunity to live out your dreams and forever become a character within the pages of DOSE!  ONLY 5 AVAILABLE!  Now, on to the rest of the campaign. . .

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Andrew Modeen, a writer and filmmaker from the Seattle area. I’m a lifelong fan of the TMNT, and am also the guy responsible for the Image TMNT comic book conclusion that you can read about here: http://www.thegreenlanterncorps.com/tmnt/vol3.html
  • “Odyssey” is a 90+ graphic fan novel that features four elderly Mirage TMNT plucked from near-death to reunite and go on one last journey across Time and the Multiverse (including peeks into the various other TMNT universes fans may be familiar with including the original cartoon, the 4Kids cartoon, the Archie universe, and more surprises) to stop the erasure of all of existence by a sinister evil with ties of his own to the four brothers. Also haunting the TMNT are Savanti Romero and his resurrected wife, Savanti Juliet. Along for the ride familiar faces aid the Turtles including Renet, Cudley Cowlick, Slash, and more. Think "The Dark Knight Returns" meets "Turtles Forever" with a dash of "The Neverending Story" and you might have some idea what to expect.
  • The book is illustrated by Jim Lawson, veteran TMNT artist who has been drawing the TMNT since nearly the very beginning. Classics like “Sons of the Silent Age,” “Return to New York,” “City at War,” Tales of the TMNT Vol. 1, the entirety of TMNT Vol. 2 (Mirage), TMNT Vol. 4, and a great deal of Tales of the TMNT Vol. 2… this is the guy.
  • Dan Berger, another TMNT veteran, also contributes a 3 page prologue.
  • Rick McCollum and Bill Anderson (“Twilight of the Ring,” “Juliet’s Revenge”) are illustrating the cover. Ross Campbell is also doing a bit of the interiors. Also Angie Sternitzke, and Arseniy Dubakov.
  • We have a variety of rewards in store for people able and willing to contribute to the project, as you will see below.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Jim Lawson has very graciously attached himself to the project, however he does need compensation. 37 pages of “Odyssey” have already been commissioned and completed, and to complete the project additional funding is needed.
  • We are not asking for money to help publish or profit in any way, shape, or form – we are only looking for funds to continue commissioning Jim Lawson for the pages that remain. In addition to helping bring to fruition this project contributing is also a big way to give back to a man who has given a great deal to TMNT as we know it today.
  • Any and all funds received up to the $3,270 will go directly to Jim Lawson to complete the remaining pages. Any additional funds beyond that amount received – if any – will go toward other aspects of the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can’t contribute? You can help by getting the word out about our campaign, spreading the word about “Odyssey” and this Indiegogo page to other Turtle fans.
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Story

My name is Carlos Samudio, Publisher of Black Frog Studios. I am working in collaboration with Caleb Straus and Dusty Johnson of Snout Productions. A multi media studio. We are currently asking for contributions to Snout Productions, latest endeavor-It's Over Tribulations. A story about right v. wrong. Evil v. Good. You get the idea. This movie is starting to generate buzz all over the media blogs, such as Slackerwood, INDTv to name a few. We hope you consider making this dream possible for the boys at Snout Productions.


The Impact

If this book receives 100% funding, that means it will enable Snout Productions to continue their mythology through film and books before the end of summer 2012.  If it doesn't meet its goal, it will take longer to produce this finely crafted story, which means a delay in people being enveloped in the mythology of It's Over.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to raise $750.00 to start off our publishing for It's Over Tribulations. Any contribution would be greatly appreciated. Any money raised would go directly into the publication of the book. Black Frog Studios will cover any shortcomings of our intended goal. What is in it for you? A chance to be part of something great. A new fantasy myth that could possibly be something bigger in mainstream media soon. For each donation of $10.00.-you will get your name listed in the graphic novel on a "Thank You" page, and for $20.00 you get a free copy of the graphic novel as well as your name in the book. Anything above $25.00 and beyond-a copy of the graphic novel, a free autographed copy of the movie-It's Over signed by the creators  as well as a thank you to larger contributors with your name and short bio-could be a quote from you or your website name also or the name of your band-whatever you want to list. All funds will go 100% into the publishing of the book. We thank you for your interest and contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the trailer or have seen the dvd anywhere and believe in their cause-GET THE WORD OUT! Help us spread the word to everyone you know. Go to Twitter, FAcebook, whatever else you can possibly find.

story:
Ascend: Hell Climber is the first graphic novel in a trilogy by Thomas Pringle, concept artist in the film and game industry (A Quiet Place, Star Trek Discovery, Transformers, Pet Sematary, Neuromancer, Mass Effect, Bioshock). With story editing by Steve Spencer Baker (Slabscape series, Tomato creative collective) and trailer score by Adam Edwards.

About me:
I'm a concept artist and illustrator who's been working in film and games for the last 15 years. Chances are you've seen some of my work if you've watched:

A Quiet Place
Transformers
Star Trek Discovery

Or played:

Mass Effect
Bioshock
Deus EX
Infamous
Call of Duty 
And many more...

You can check out more of my work at: 
https://www.pringleart.com

Or sign up for the Ascend: Hell Climber news letter here:

https://www.ascendhellclimber.com/

Risks and challenges

The book is finished!

I finalized the printing quote and done a few test books. The quality is great and I am very satisfied with how its turned out.

The last step is to raise the minimum amount needed to realize the printing. So if this sounds like a project you'd like to support, please do so and in the process receive an awesome book!

Thank you.

Thomas Pringle

story:
STORY 

From the bowels of a massive Pacific Ocean garbage island, THE SQUID, while in a decades long coma, is cast out of his trash cocoon by the tsunami of 2011 and set adrift toward the Japanese shoreline. He's eventually plucked out of the sea by a ship that happens by where, over a day, he becomes conscious and jumps overboard-narrowly escaping becoming the possession of a wealthy man bent on putting him in a fish tank. After arriving on land and hooking up with a group of kids headed to a mall, he starts to piece together his past and is pursued by the dangerous forces of his future. 


THE SQUID 3 expands this world as he is unwittingly hunted down by a hi-tech paramilitary unit launched by someone introduced in previous issues, an individual with grave reasons for his elimination while unseen incidents place powerful weapons in the hands of the unprepared. 
The book is an ongoing series which I've mapped out over several issues and the current story arc should come to a blistering (or at least slightly chaffed) close in THE SQUID 5. The story so far has brought us to coastal and central Japan, New Guinea, and into the future somewhere in subsaharan Africa. 

My generous supporters have already helped me get THE SQUID 1 printed and I went on to use my own funds to self publish THE SQUID 2. This third issue will of course be made but it would help greatly to get some support for this third issue so I can use the funding to print books and create a few promotional items to get the word out about this story. I didn't have the resources to accomplish that for issue two and I would love to give THE SQUID 3 the big boost it deserves. 

You may be wondering why I want to print books instead of putting them on a print per purchase comics site. You're saying: 'hey Earl, that's stupid, why would you waste your precious time and resources printing books without the guarantee of a sale and why the hell are you asking me for help? Don't you know I'm on a fixed income?' The answer to the first part of that question is that I'm a very small potato in terms of the comics world right now. If I were to sell my books in that manner I would be quickly tucked away into a digital backwater to be found only by the occasional person who is already familiar with my work. That stinks for me! Your generous contribution to my project would translate into me being able to print my book but it would also allow me to promote my comic through stickers, business cards and trade shows. To answer the second part of the question I guess I could say simply that I'm asking for your help to assist me in growing. I'm not a name, you people are my audience right now. It's so much fun to share these stories with you and your enthusiasm fuels my desire to keep creating. Your support will mean a lot to what I can produce, the evolution of my skills and the ability to keep going with the characters I've constructed. In the long run, It may also be the gateway in which I can pass from a person selling my hours to selling my skills...Boy, that would  be something, wouldn't it?  


Cold Facts

Aside from some proof reading and advice from my circle of friends, I'm pretty much a one man show. I write the story, design the characters, lay the pages out, pencil the pages, ink them, letter them, edit the final work, create supplementary art for the comic, create and color the covers, fashion promotional material, build an online presence, construct a fundraiser, work on the next issue, practice drawing, work a 9am-5pm job and attempt to have some sort of a life outside of working all the time so I have some ideas to pour back into the stories. I'm not complaining, just saying it's a shit ton of work and your financial assistance would mean very much to me. It would translate into me being able to put the book out much faster than I would be able to do by myself and help me afford some of the most basic forms of self promotion available. Since it's all me, you would truly be a patron of a singular artist if you participated in funding me. Not to toot my own horn but the work keeps getting better issue by issue. 

Risks

All of the artwork for THE SQUID 3 has been completed and is standing by for printing so the risk of not receiving your comics and stickers is, for the most part, non existent. If I don't reach my goal it should be understood that my ability to ship your products anywhere near a timely fashion will be seriously affected.  


Other ways you can help

If you're not into comics but know someone who is, please help me get the word out by sharing my link-tell your family and friends about the project. There are tools on this website that you can use to help me spread the word.
story_txt:
STORY 

From the bowels of a massive Pacific Ocean garbage island, THE SQUID, while in a decades long coma, is cast out of his trash cocoon by the tsunami of 2011 and set adrift toward the Japanese shoreline. He's eventually plucked out of the sea by a ship that happens by where, over a day, he becomes conscious and jumps overboard-narrowly escaping becoming the possession of a wealthy man bent on putting him in a fish tank. After arriving on land and hooking up with a group of kids headed to a mall, he starts to piece together his past and is pursued by the dangerous forces of his future. 




THE SQUID 3 expands this world as he is unwittingly hunted down by a hi-tech paramilitary unit launched by someone introduced in previous issues, an individual with grave reasons for his elimination while unseen incidents place powerful weapons in the hands of the unprepared. The book is an ongoing series which I've mapped out over several issues and the current story arc should come to a blistering (or at least slightly chaffed) close in THE SQUID 5. story:
Update June 6, 2014: Contest!!!

We're randomly giving away 20 original hand-drawn Bombo watercolor illustrations by the master himself, Bombo's creator, Alessandro Barbucci, to people who ordered a plush Bombo in this campaign (non-Bombo perks aren't eligible, unfortunately). So buy one now quickly while you can (and so far, chances of getting a drawing are pretty good, as only four Bombos have been ordered so far)!



You love Monster Allergy? Get your very own plush Bombo to cuddle all day!




Monster Allergy is possibly one of the best comic book series ever. With its brilliantly witty writing, fantastic art and matchingly awesome coloring, it has garnered a world wide fan base. But even if you only know the tv show of the same name (that is actually based on the comic books, NOT the other way round!), you'll know that everyone's favorite is -- of course -- Bombo, the giant, naive, but good-hearted and super cute eat-it-all.

dani books' publisher, Jano, loves Monster Allergy so much that he doesn't only publish the new German edition of the comic book, but also always strives to find ideas for fan items that he offers his fellow fans at production cost.

Now, for the first time ever, you'll be able to own your very own plush Bombo. It's a handmade high quality product made in Germany and we are running this campaign to get most of the funds for the minimum production run of 50 plush Bombos.



Bombo - The exclusive first plush version


The ultimate plush Bombo has been designed to look as close to its comic book version as possible. dani books hired Steiner Plüsch, a company specialized in custom handmade plush toys, to create this awesome, unique Bombo, that every MA fan will fall in love with at first sight. He even wears his signature sneakers (that he, of course, snagged once again while Zick wasn't looking. ;)).










Prototyping has been finished and the image shows you what the final version of Bombo will look like (height: 28 cm or about 11"). However, since this is a very complex plush toy made in Germany (not in a sweatshop somewhere!) with lots of added detail (all of Bombo's back circles are stitched on, for instance), the production cost per toy is pretty high. Since we can't afford to just have some random number of 50 EUR toys produced without knowing how many fans will want one in the end, we're offering you this chance to preorder your own personal Bombo.

Get it while it's hot! There will most likely be only one single production run of these plush Bombos ever and the number of Bombos produced will only be very slightly higher than the actual number of preorders.

What else is there?

If you're an MA fan (and we just gonna assume that you are if you visit this campaign page), but don't want a plush Bombo, can't afford it, or just want other items in addition to Bombo, there are some fun other perks you can pledge for:

Postcards: We got a set of three postcards for you, one of which features exclusive art by MA creator Alessandro Barbucci that he did for Jano in early 2013. It has never been printed before.



Keychain: Another dani books exclusive that has been produced as a promo item for the books. A fun soft rubber keychain featuring Zick and Elena, based on an artwork by Alessandro Barbucci and the coloring by Barbara Canepa.



(German) Books: This campaign is about the plush Bombo, but since our main product is the German collected paperback edition of MA (to which the plush Bombo is a promo item), we're offering the books here, too. Probably only interesting if you're from Germany, Austria or Switzerland (or can read German), but if that's true for you, you can get books 1 and/or 2 right away or pledge for a subscription of all 8 volumes (which will include all 29 episodes of MA).

Funding and Shipping Details

To assure the fastest production of Bombo, we chose Indiegogo's "flexible funding" option, where all contributions remain valid even in case the original campaign goal isn't reached. Bombo will definitely be produced if we get about 30 to 40 preorders (the campaign goal of 2000 EUR is equal to 40 Bombos). In case we only get a handful of orders and really don't produce Bombo in the end, those Bombo orders will be refunded, of course.

Bombo has been finalized and is ready to go once we know how many we need to have produced. According to the Steiner company, the Bombos should be ready for shipping about five weeks after we place our order, so you should receive your plush Bombo in the near future after the end of this campaign.

Everything else is ready for shipping right away (if you choose the book subscription as your perk, you'll get the first two books now and the remaining ones as single shipments directly after each one is released).

Shipping is included in all perk prices. Please make sure to select the right perk for your country if you pledge for plush Bombo (i.e. please choose the correct GERMANY, EUROPE or WORLD perk).



What's more?

If this campaign is successful, we might be adding more stuff to our MA comic book promo fan item line in the future. Maybe a plush Timothy? More keychains? Feel free to send us your suggestions in the comments section of the page! :)

All material on this campaign page is © 2014 dani books/Centomo/Artibani/Barbucci/Canepa. All Rights Reserved.

story:
Hello!

Hello! I'm Irma Eriksson and I create the comic "Imy" which I've been publishing on my website (http://www.imycomic.com) twice a week since November 2007.

To this date I've published 4 "Imy" books, exhibited at New York Comic Con for 4 years and Stockholm Comic Festival for 5 years, and I've even had "Imy" published in Swedish in the Gothenburg based newspaper Göteborgs-Posten.

My 5th book is in the making right now and THAT is why you are here reading this!

I need to get "Imy: Vol 5.0" printed and ready in time for New York Comic Con this year.

"Imy Vol. 5.0" will be printed in full, vibrant color, and will contain strips #406-#500, an extra exclusive story all about Imy and her favorite niece, Zoe, and some more fun extras!

For those of you who want the book but won't be attending NYCC (which I think is most of you!), this Indiegogo campaign is your surefire way to grab your own copy of "Imy: Vol. 5.0." I don't keep a large stock, so take advantage of this opportunity so you don't get caught without this book in your collection!

And even if you don't want a book, there are some other great incentives you can choose from!

Or you can just drop a simple donation of any amount my way. I appreciate any help you can give me!

And one of the best things you can do for me is to spread the word to your Twitter and Facebook followers!

Now, let's move on to the goodies...

So, which perk do you want?







    Stretch goals! YEAH!

    If I end up surpassing my goal, I have stretch goals ready to go!

    • At $900 - I will get new bookmarks and business cards printed, and I will include a bookmark in every shipped order! 
    • At $1500 - New con display materials to make my table look more professional and approachable.
    • At $2000 - I'll restock one or more of the other volumes.
    • At $3500 - I can replace my poor 4 year old laptop!

    When will you receive your goodies?

    You can expect your stuff by January 2015. Anything digital, like PDFs, will most likely come to you earlier. But plan on January for your merchandise.

    Have you never read my comic before?

    That's fine! You can go to the site and read them all! Enjoy! And THANK YOU!

    http://www.imycomic.com

story:
The Devil Within Issue #2 Pre-Sale is designed to get funding to cover the cost of printing Issue #2. 

The Devil Within is a 6 issue comic book series that follows Adam and his two friends, Hex (Hector) and Des (Desirée), through a life-changing supernatural event. 

Rated: Teen

Issue #2

After a ghost hunt gone wrong, a Demon has been released from his imprisonment from within an ancient skull!  

Adam’s world is turned upside down as he and the Demon are now bound together. 

Adam must find his way through truth, loyalty, and morality when confronted with the world of the supernatural.

What affects will the events of Issue #1 and the presence of the Demon have on his friendships with Hex and Des?

Find out what happens when The Devil Within starts to take over! 

Issue #1

 

An ancient evil that was thought to have been contained centuries ago is released back into the world. Adam, Hex, and Des are three high school students from a small town in Colorado. Hex and Des try to convince Adam to join them on a ghost hunt at an abandoned farm house where two people were murdered decades before. Adam, being a sceptic, is uninterested and sees this as a waste of time. Hex and Des use the fact that Adam is the only member of the school’s A/V club to their advantage and convince him to come so he can film the hunt. However, on the ghost hunt, they have an unexpected experience that will change their lives and friendship forever. 
 

Issue #1 of The Devil Within sets the stage for what will become a major test for Adam and his friends.

story:
Our Story

Eight years ago my cousin Jesse Davidge and I embarked on a creative journey together.  I had written scripts for a series of comic stories about seven mathematicians from various eras in history who are mysteriously banded together to take on problems of a grand and metaphysical nature.  Jesse, who had only recently become an animator, began working on the tales of the Wandering Stars in his spare time.

 

In 2010 we were excited to have our work released as a 100 page graphic novel by Bayeux Arts as part of their new imprint, Rosencrantz Comics.  Mathemagick & Mystiphysics Volume One: The Probabilities of Pandemonium by the Davidge Cousins has been well-received by various audiences ranging from elementary students to university professors to comic book fans. 

 

Last summer I completed the manuscript for Mathemagick & Mystiphysics Volume Two: Apples and Origins.  It goes more indepth into the characters' true histories while also further developing the cartoon cosmology we are creating.   

 

Jesse, who now is co-owner of a small animation studio, is understandably not in a positon at this stage in his life to work on Mathemagick without compensation.  This project budget would provide him $50 per page which is still far below industry standards.

 

Completion of this graphic novel would bring a work of artistry and literature into the world that is intelligently entertaining and distinctly educational.  If Jesse is unable to complete the illustrations in a timely manner we will potentially lose out on publishing opportunities that have been gained by the momentum of the first volume.

 

All proceeds from this fundraising initiative will go to Jesse to complete the illustrations from the already completed script. Any extra money earned will go to the inevitable final production expenses.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us out by getting the word out to anyone who may be interested in supporting the creation of quaility comic literature.  Share this page or send off this link.

story:
Norris & Parker's 

All Our Friends Are Dead


Please help two well meaning, average looking, middle class actresses take their urgent, political and primal piece of theatre to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.


NOW FOR THE SOB STORY...

We are Katie Norris and Sinead Parker and we met six years ago on the BA Hons Charades (Acting) course at The Manchester Met School of Theatre. 

Sinead is shy and from a broken home and Katie is from Somerset and is better than this.

We discovered we shared a birthday (26th February) and shared a love for dark and surreal comedy - The League of Gentlemen, Father Ted, Julia Davis (Nighty Night, Hunderby) & Chris Morris (Brass Eye, Jam). Thus began our own adventure as the comedy duo, Norris & Parker. 

THIS SUMMER we are taking our dark and anarchic sketch, character and musical comedy show, All Our Friends Are Dead to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. 

 As 'Norris & Parker' we have written and performed shows at the Manchester, Camden & Edinburgh Fringe Festivals to sell out audiences and great reviews.

***** THE SKINNY

***** THE PUBLIC REVIEWS

***** TUSK JOURNAL

***** THE GOOD REVIEW

**** WHATSONSTAGE

Last year we performed our show at The Lowry, as part of the Re:play Festival which celebrated the best work of the fringe. This was a massive personal and professional achievement for us both and more importantly, our parents. 

 We have huge ambitions to move into TV and radio and believe this years trip to Edinburgh could build upon our growing reputation, cult status and modesty. 


So this is happening...

We have brought in (for the first time ever) a brave director by the name of Lucia Cox (One Hand Clapping, Cuckoo). One Hand Clapping has just returned from a sell-out run at the Brits off Broadway festival in NYC. Lucia is yet to laugh at any of our material but we remain hopeful.

We have also made the financially riskier decision of performing at a paid venue in order for the show to gain a higher profile and hopefully attract some really glamourous media attention and some lonely, drunk and vulnerable men.

For the amount of money it is costing us (80% Norris), we could have married each other, paid for a really extravagant Pagan Wedding with a free bar, enjoyed a honey moon in Las Vegas and put our adopted Cambodian children through University AND still have enough left over for a bitter divorce.

But instead we're going to Edinburgh and to give you an idea of our costs...

Here are our open books...

Venue- 1500 pounds

Accomodation- 2400 pounds

Fringe registration- 295 pounds

Advertising, marketing, publicity, flyerers-  1000 pounds

Music/Music licence- 400 pounds

Costume, Props (Quiche, moustaches and catsuits)- 200 pounds

Travel - 200 pounds

Valium, gin & thai prostitutes- 4 million pounds 


If you choose to donate to our campaign your money will go towards all of the above.


'Norris & Parker' allows us to take ownership of our creative careers, gives us an outlet for our vulnerabilities, anxieties and sexual aggression without inhibitions and gives us a legitimate reason to dress up as men.

We've always been very lucky to have a great support network and are very thankful to those who have helped us so far. 

We would be eternally grateful for any monetary donations, slightly less but still grateful for any valium donations and if you're too stingy to give us money or relaxation aids then a tweet or a facebook share will do.

Alternatively, please tell spread the word of All Our Friends Are Dead to All Your Friends Who Are Alive.

The show is on throughout the fringe at:

Just The Tonic at The Caves (Just up the stairs)

8.35pm

6-29th August (except 18th & 24th)

Wish us luck.

AND THANK YOU

N&P xxxx
story_txt:
Norris & Parker's 
All Our Friends Are Dead 
Please help two well meaning, average looking, middle class actresses take their urgent, political and primal piece of theatre to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.




NOW FOR THE SOB STORY...
We are Katie Norris and Sinead Parker and we met six years ago on the BA Hons Charades (Acting) course at The Manchester Met School of Theatre. 
Sinead is shy and from a broken home and Katie is from Somerset and is better than this.
We discovered we shared a birthday (26th February) and shared a love for dark and surreal comedy - The League of Gentlemen, Father Ted, Julia Davis (Nighty Night, Hunderby) & Chris Morris (Brass Eye, Jam). Thus began our own adventure as the comedy duo, Norris & Parker. 

THIS SUMMER we are taking our dark and anarchic sketch, character and musical comedy show, All Our Friends Are Dead to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. 
 As 'Norris & Parker' we have written and performed shows at the Manchester, Camden & Edinburgh Fringe Festivals to sell out audiences and great reviews.
***** THE SKINNY
***** THE PUBLIC REVIEWS
***** TUSK JOURNAL
***** THE GOOD REVIEW
**** WHATSONSTAGE
Last year we performed our show at The Lowry, as part of the Re:play Festival which celebrated the best work of the fringe. This was a massive personal and professional achievement for us both and more importantly, our parents. 

 We have huge ambitions to move into TV and radio and believe this years trip to Edinburgh could build upon our growing reputation, cult status and modesty. 


So this is happening...

We have brought in (for the first time ever) a brave director by the name of Lucia Cox (One Hand Clapping, Cuckoo). One Hand Clapping has just returned from a sell-out run at the Brits off Broadway festival in NYC. Lucia is yet to laugh at any of our material but we remain hopeful.

But instead we're going to Edinburgh and to give you an idea of our costs...
Here are our open books...
Venue- 1500 pounds
Accomodation- 2400 pounds
Fringe registration- 295 pounds
Advertising, marketing, publicity, flyerers-  1000 pounds
Music/Music licence- 400 pounds
Costume, Props (Quiche, moustaches and catsuits)- 200 pounds
Travel - 200 pounds
Valium, gin & thai prostitutes- 4 million pounds 



If you choose to donate to our campaign your money will go towards all of the above.
'Norris & Parker' allows us to take ownership of our creative careers, gives us an outlet for our vulnerabilities, anxieties and sexual aggression without inhibitions and gives us a legitimate reason to dress up as men.
We've always been very lucky to have a great support network and are very thankful to those who have helped us so far. 
We would be eternally grateful for any monetary donations, slightly less but still grateful for any valium donations and if you're too stingy to give us money or relaxation aids then a tweet or a facebook share will do.
Alternatively, please tell spread the word of All Our Friends Are Dead to All Your Friends Who Are Alive.

8.35pm

story:
Hey Indiegogo-ers!

My name’s Stacey Rebecca and I’m a model and cosplayer from London, England. 

I started cosplaying a year or so ago when I did my Mary Jane cosplay recreating the cover of Amazing Spider-Man #601 - you might have seen it!  Since then I have been working hard on costumes, photoshoots and attending conventions regularly, jumping headfirst into the cosplay community.

What I Need and What You Get

Over the last year I’ve built up a huge fanbase of people from all corners of the world, the US being my largest.  I'm often asked if I can attend a con in this state or that state, and unfortunately most of the time the answer is no - it's just not financially possible to fly across the pond on a regular basis.  This year, I am trying my very best to make it out to as many conventions as possible in the States to spend time with the people that make all of this cosplay nonsense possible - my fans.

I am trying to make it out to New York Comic Con, the second largest comic book convention in North America, and I need to raise a little bit of money to cover my flights and accommodation costs.

Previously I have sold prints and posters to fund my trips, but this time I wanted to do something a little different.  I really wanted to do something a bit more special for you guys.  Take a look at the perks I've created for you!

I hope that there’s something for everyone, I hope you guys enjoy the perks, and hopefully I’ll get to see some of you very soon!

Stacey Rebecca

xxx

story:
Our Story

  

                    


Hello, We are the Better Than Sex Ice Cream Girls, we are making a comic book series, and we need your help. We are on this platform to raise money for our 4 issue comic book called "C.R.E.A.M." which stands for: Callipygian Rebels  of Evil, Anarchy and Mayhem. The funds are to publish the first issue of a 4 ISSUE series.  The initial book is a 24 page, 8.5 x 11 issue. The Comic is wrapped loosely around our great  tasting Brand: Better Than Sex Ice Cream, which can be bought online @www.betterthansexicecream.com.

Any who, the story is about a group of  six sexy heroines who are recruited from all over the world in an effort to thwart the evilness of the day. The man behind the formation of this elite group of sexy vixens is the great philanthropist/ business mogul Mr. Harris. Harris searches the globe to find these seven sensual sirens, all with a special skillset that helps them in their new superhero/mercenary roles. After found they are "enhanced" and trained to make them  sexy superior warriors. All the while doubling as ice cream models for Harris' Ice cream Company.

What we looking like!

 Artists

Beautiful drawn by comic great Ricardo Plata with graphics by De'Romeo Harris and a variant cover from another great John Statema, this edgy comic will be truly excite all of your senses. The story line is to run initially  four issues, but with  a well reception we will definitely consider this a start to a long running  series.


Even Heros need help!!!

We've come to find out that you can't just jump into the phone booth and change into Mr. Money.  Or even turn bad guy and pull an "Italian Job" We honestly need you to help  publish this series.

Here's the break down:

$3500.00 Artist Fees: inking, coloring, lettering

$2500.00 Printing Cost

$1500.00 Promotions

$1500.00 perks and Indiegogo fees

With your help we can reach our goal of $9000 to produce the first issue. After that we can use proceeds to produce further issues to complete the series.

PERKS!

Because we are a band of  artist, we have the opportunity  to offer great perks. Take a look at our tiers and find  the best fit for you. Also, Thank you in advance for any consideration you have given us!

                           

8 PK ICE CREAM SAMPLER  ACETATE CELL SHEET  ORIGINAL AIRBRUSH TEE

   OFFICIAL C.R.E.A.M. T-SHIRT            C.R.E.A.M. MOTION COMIC  DVD
...AND MUCH MORE!!!!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We're not asking for a handout, but merely a hand up! Your voice can carry as much weight as your wallet. Spread the word about our campaign by posting links on your social medial pages. There's nothing sexier than Success!

story:
Nix Western Comics #3

Nix Western Comics is an ongoing series following the past exploits of the two larger than life characters who met their demise in the first issue:  The Earl Vance, the stalwart sheriff of New Stockholm, Nevada and the Vagabond outlaw Johnny Skell.  

Each issue is 28 color pages and features complete stories, so readers can pick up any issue without feeling lost.  (The characters are recurring, but the stories aren't serialized.)  In Issue #3:

  • The Coward Earl Vance:  A stranger comes to town and accuses Sheriff Vance of being a civil war deserter and all hell breaks loose!  The townspeople mostly side with their leader, but new school marm Emma McCoy has her doubts about Vance's integrity. 

  • The Devil's Hands: Johnny Skell takes on a gig as a bodyguard for travelling boxer Peerless Purdue and his promoter.  When the duo attempts to fire Skell without pay, they learn the hard way not to jilt a gunslinger.

Creators:
Ken Eppstein:  Lead writer, editor and publisher of Nix Comics.  Curator of the Columbus Alive's Sketch in the City series.  
Bob Ray Starker (The Devil's Hands): Illustrator for Nix Comics Quarterly, Nix Western Comics, Pander Bear.   Co-creator of Johnny Skell, Earl Vance and Nix Western comics. Musician with the Sovines, Whoa Nellie and the Sin Shouters.
Michel Neno (The Coward Earl Vance): Writer, illustrator and creator for The Signifiers, Nix Comics, Caliber Press and Cracked Magazine.  Co-Creator of The Vicar in Nix Comics Quarterly.
Glen Ostrander (Cover): Artist and illustrator.

Help me with Printing Costs

I would like for this crowd-funding campaign to pay for the initial print run of Nix Western comics #3 of at least 300 copies.  As with all Nix Comics books, I am paying the artists and printing costs out of pocket for this project.  The more copies I pre-sell as part of this campaign, the lower my overhead.  That lower overhead translates into me being able to pay for more new comics over the course of the year!   You get some cool comics and I get to make cool comics.  Wotta bargain!

"Hey man, that's all cool, but what's in it for me?"

I'd never ask for something for nothing.  This campaign is essentially a platform for selling pre-order copies and back issue sales.

Nix Western Comics in SPACE! ($4)
Nix Western Comics will be debuted  at the Small Press and Comics Expo (SPACE) in Columbus, Ohio on April 11th and 12th. If you'd like a copy of Nix Western Comics #4 and would like to save on shipping, select this option for a $4 copy.  ($1 off cover price!)

Pony Express ($7)
Nix Western Comics #3 delivered to your home, office or jail cell.

The Digital Dime Novel ($10)
A PDF copy of all three three issues of Nix Western Comics with additional commentary from yours truly, author Ken Eppstein.

The Posse ($25)
All three issues of Nix Western comics to date, including the issue #1 dee-luxe comic and record set complete with a laser cut sheriff badge 45 adapter. 

The General Store ($18)
Five copies of Nix Western Comics #3 for shop owners and prudent folks who like buying in bulk!  If you're interested in carrying more copies or other Nix Comics titles, send an email to ken@nixcomics.com and we'll work out a pledge amount that suits your needs!

The Speculator ($75)
Test pressings of the record from issue #1 with illustrations of Earl Vance and Johnny Skell by creator Bob Ray Starker on both sides.   Nix Western Comics #3 signed by Eppstein, Neno and Starker. (Limit two, first come first serve on course of illustrations.)


The Nix STAMPEDE!!! ($85)
A complete introduction to Nix Comics for that unlucky son of a gun who has never heard of Nix Comics before stumbling on this pre-sale campaign. You'll get Nix Western Comics #1-3, Nix Comics Quarterly, the Rock n Roll Horror Anthology issues #1-7, Nix comics for Kids #1-3, Pure Entertainment #1, Mark Rudolph's Closing Doors, Do You Remember Rock N Roll Record Stores and Belligerent Kitties #1 for one low price!

Risks & Challenges

The risks are for folks pledging.  Nix Western comics #3 is coming out regardless of the outcome of this campaign, the only difference will be the number of copies I end up printing.
