story:
"Definition: A mulligan, most simply put, is a "do-over." Hit a bad shot? Take a mulligan and replay that stroke..."

...or, a comic about second chances.

Short Summary

Nineteen years ago, Milo "Daws" Dawson moved away from home to go to college and come out. After graduating, he chose closeted, corporate life instead of a U-haul back to his hometown with his college boyfriend and high school friend...until his job was outsourced fifteen years later. Now, 37 years old and broke, he's moved back home, to rent a room in his ex's house, and to find himself all over again. He's in a boarding house run by his ex-boyfriend, Thomas Mulligan, shared by three other boarders, all trying to repair their own lives. As Daws tries piecing his own life together in his old hometown, he graples with the possibilities of his own second chances.

What We Need & What You Get

Media costs money: sketchbooks, coffee, inking stuff, pen nibs, coffee, licenses for graphics programs (sorry Sai-crackers, not cool), more coffee, domain registration, webhosting on a site where I've got some independence, still more coffee, maybe a downpayment on a laptop I can use to publish/produce strips somewhere other than my room, and more coffee. So here's what I'm offering up for incentives:

$25: A mention of thanks and gratitude on the website

$50: Background cameo in a stip

$100: Featured cameo in a single-installment (8-10 panels)

$250: Buy your way into the cast as a semi-recurring, biographied, supporting character. You'll get to suggest a single subplot (7-8 installments) per year and shape the scripts for it. And who knows, your character may pop up elsewhere?

$500: The Full Monty. Ten full-color pictures of your favorite character(s) doing anything legal in post "Lawrence vs Texas" America.

The Impact

I'm just a queer Gen-X'er with body image issues who never really saw himself reflected in the gay comics out there. They were either too campy, too twinky, too quirky, too oversexed, or too circuit-driven. I just want to tell a little slice-of-life narrative, splashed in with the occasional editorial commentary, with characters I'd actually want to hang out with...and hope that a few people might appreciate the journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word once the strip is live. No, seriously, use that "like" button for something other than captioned cat pics...

 

...and coffee. Really. Send gift cards for coffee. ;)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alex Nall. I'm a cartoonist and teaching artist living in Chicago, Il. I have been self-publishing comics since 2011 and have been teaching since 2013. Last year, with the help of Indiegogo, I successfully funded the publication of my first book Teaching Comics: Volume One. This campaign is being created to help raise funds for the publication of a new comic, Let Some Word That Is Heard Be Yours. The comic is an overview of Fred Rogers' life and how he came to be  the man behind the influential children's television program 'Mister Roger's Neighborhood'. While there have been many books written about the success of 'Mister Rogers' Neighborhood', very few highlight Rogers' biography and moments in his life that led up to him creating one of the most beloved children's television program in history. LSWTIHBY showcases scenes from Rogers' childhood and teenage years, up to the turning point in 1968 when he created 'Mister Rogers' Neighborhood' for PBS. The book also continues to show scenes of my life as an early-educator and how the lessons Mister Rogers' taught over thirty years ago are still relevant in and out of the the classroom today.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I'm trying to raise $2000 to fund the publication of 500 copies of LSWTIHBY. The book is 50 pages and will be printed in color, which drives up the printing costs.
  • By supporting the campaign you'll be able to pre-order a copy of the comic, have access to previously published comics and minis, as well as the opportunity to have an original ink drawing of Mister Rogers for your collection!
  • Any funds that are raised will be used for the publication of the comic book.  I'm hoping to have this book ready by mid-May/beginning of June. A significant portion of the book is already done (pencilled, inked, colored) and I'll be posting new pages here for campaign supporters to see.

The Impact

  • I used Indiegogo last year to successfully publish my first book Teaching Comics: Volume One. I had a great time coming up with a campaign and perks for supporters to follow and was met with plenty of enthusiasm from campaign supporters. I'm hoping to do the same here for people who have enjoyed my comics and have an interest in Mister Rogers' life.
  • As a self-publisher I'm free to create whatever content I want to and share it online, but my goal is to have a printed book that I can sell/give away at small press conventions. The money it costs to print such a book is hard to fund on my own, so anything helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I completely understand if you can't contribute a financial donation. You can also help by spreading the link for this campaign on social media and sharing it with a friend or family member that has fond memories of watching Mister Rogers.

Thanks for reading! 

Alex
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Alex Nall. I'm a cartoonist and teaching artist living in Chicago, Il. I have been self-publishing comics since 2011 and have been teaching since 2013. Last year, with the help of Indiegogo, I successfully funded the publication of my first book Teaching Comics: Volume One. This campaign is being created to help raise funds for the publication of a new comic, Let Some Word That Is Heard Be Yours. The comic is an overview of Fred Rogers' life and how he came to be  the man behind the influential children's television program 'Mister Roger's Neighborhood'. While there have been many books written about the success of 'Mister Rogers' Neighborhood', very few highlight Rogers' biography and moments in his life that led up to him creating one of the most beloved children's television program in history. LSWTIHBY showcases scenes from Rogers' childhood and teenage years, up to the turning point in 1968 when he created 'Mister Rogers' Neighborhood' for PBS. The book also continues to show scenes of my life as an early-educator and how the lessons Mister Rogers' taught over thirty years ago are still relevant in and out of the the classroom today.


What I Need & What You Get

I'm trying to raise $2000 to fund the publication of 500 copies of LSWTIHBY. The book is 50 pages and will be printed in color, which drives up the printing costs.
By supporting the campaign you'll be able to pre-order a copy of the comic, have access to previously published comics and minis, as well as the opportunity to have an original ink drawing of Mister Rogers for your collection!
Any funds that are raised will be used for the publication of the comic book.  I'm hoping to have this book ready by mid-May/beginning of June. A significant portion of the book is already done (pencilled, inked, colored) and I'll be posting new pages here for campaign supporters to see.



The Impact

I used Indiegogo last year to successfully publish my first book Teaching Comics: Volume One. I had a great time coming up with a campaign and perks for supporters to follow and was met with plenty of enthusiasm from campaign supporters. I'm hoping to do the same here for people who have enjoyed my comics and have an interest in Mister Rogers' life.
As a self-publisher I'm free to create whatever content I want to and share it online, but my goal is to have a printed book that I can sell/give away at small press conventions. The money it costs to print such a book is hard to fund on my own, so anything helps!



Other Ways You Can Help
I completely understand if you can't contribute a financial donation. You can also help by spreading the link for this campaign on social media and sharing it with a friend or family member that has fond memories of watching Mister Rogers.
Thanks for reading! Alex

story:
Novo Doba needs your support!

Listen friends, lovers and patrons! Novo Doba – the best festival of alternative, non-aligned, mind-altering comics in Eastern Europe (and beyond) – needs your help. 

Novo Doba is the New Era. It is a self-organized, inevitable and life-changing organism that grew out of Belgrade, Zemun and Pančevo and the domestic post-Yugoslav new-wave comics scene. It is a meeting point for artists, publishers, connoisseurs and curious crowds with a hunger for graphic highs. It is an indispensable node in the world-wide network of small press festivals. It is in fact much more than a festival, a nursery for new visions and a transmitter of weird frequencies. This September we are planning the 7th edition of the festival. But this time we can't pull it off without your help.  


We wouldn't ask for your help if it wasn't for the sudden and unexpected misfortune that left us without public funding this year. We, the organizers, obviously invest all our time and hard work to make the festival happen for free. But we need money to pay for travel expenses and accommodation for our guests, as well as for printing the renowned festival catalogue and showcasing the best new works of some of the world's most interesting artists. If you help us now you will not only get our eternal respect and gratitude, you will also be rewarded with perks so rare and exquisite that no money can buy (just your money just this time). You are a patron of the future, you help us stay independent, wild and idealistic! 


This year's festival programme is as ambitious as ever. In six days, from September 20th to 25th, we will host six separate exhibitions in carefully chosen venues. We move around the city, always exploring new places and new partner institutions or anti-institutions. Among this year's guests are famed and infamous artists such as Wostok (Serbia), Igor Hofbauer (Croatia), Craoman (France), Pakito Bolino (France) and Attila Stark (Hungary). 

The exhibitions will be accompanied by insanely noisy concerts from the cellar of the underground. Novo Doba is self-organized and therefore our ambitions never cease to grow. We expand every year like a hungry movement, a crossroad where experimental artists, editors, printers, musicians, readers, groupies and hobos meet. We are all eternal volunteers of the festival. 

The 7th edition of Novo Doba is subtitled 'All the best'. All the best is just an expression, a common way to end disputes and quarrels, a polite way to say goodbye when goodbye means good riddance, to deflate the tension, to clear the table of dirty plates and make room for dessert - but don't you move! let the butler do it, he's paid to do it - you can relax and in your mind begin to close those old chapters, end the internal debates and tirades, let the curtain fall and contemplate its exciting design.

All the best means you are given permission to exit the cursed cycle and anticipate fresh beginnings, an expression perfectly suited to say goodbye to this rusty era and clear the way for the parade that celebrates the New Era, the "Novo Doba", a festival where we all dress up in drawings and music and take part in something better, crazy-er, cozy -er, much, much more bubbly.  

Thank you, we appreciate your help. It is urgent. The New Era is coming.

story:
Who are we?

We are a team of content creators with interests spanning from comics to entertainment to tech. Meet the creators!

The Creators

Eshun Melvin - Co-Creator - actor/entrepreneur/comic creator

Reggie Melvin - Co-Creator - techpreneur/actor/writer

We are very excited about this project, which is being written in a format that is easily adaptable to film and television. The gritty and realistic story elements will capture the reader’s imagination, taking them along a journey with this character in an amazing new universe.

The Artists

Jimbo Salgado - cover pencils/inks - Batman: Arkham City for DC Comics, Atlas Unified for Atlas Comics, Grimm Fairy Tales for Zenescope, as well as Transformers work for IDW Publishing

Bong Kimyan - panel pencils/inks - ManyActs Studio, Star Wars Republic for Dark Horse Comics, Deadpool, Moon Knight, Thunderbolt for Marvel, Superman, Flash

Bryan Magnaye - colors - Zenescope Entertainment, Advent Comics, Titan Comics

Jessica Jimerson - letters - Zindan: The Last Ansaars, Infinite Glory, Acheron: Dark-Hunter, Legacy

Your contributors will help us achieve our goal of crafting an amazing product. Grimlock is truly a unique and amazing character.

What We Need & What You Get

To be transparent, here is our budget and some of the perks you can receive.

Budget Breakdown

  • 28 page comic
    • Artists (pencils/inks/colors/letters) - $4k
    • Printing - $2k
    • Miscellaneous - $2k
    • Total: $8k
    • Asking: $8k

We WELCOME PUBLISHERS AND SPONSORS who may be interested in partnering with us on this journey. We have two pages available for any advertisers who may be interested in a spot in the comic. You will benefit from exposure to an ever growing audience of comic book lovers, from those just getting started to veterans and every walk of life in between. We plan to place Grimlock strategically on the shelves of comic book stores throughout the country as well as showcase at comic cons.

If we don't reach our entire goal, your contributions will go towards paying our amazing roster of artists.

Perks

We have some pretty cool perks that you can receive for certain donation levels. These include posters, t-shirts, and hoodies branded with Grimlock artwork. See our perks section for more details.

The Project

The Grimlock series follows a young adult named Brandon Grout (a descendent of a magical bloodline) who, as a child, was abandoned by his parents and sent to an abusive foster home located in a place called ScarCity. Later as a teen, Brandon is bullied and ridiculed. Resenting society and life in general, Brandon drops out of high school, gets involved with the criminal underworld, and becomes a street racer. Brandon develops into an egotistical, rebellious, independent character who is a master at street racing, having everything he ever wanted and more - money, power, cars. During one fateful race, Brandon’s racing career screeches to a staggering halt when he is possessed by a spirit called the “Galaxo” and crashes. Waking up to find himself in the hospital perfectly ok after a violent, car crash that should have taken his life, things start to get weird for Brandon. It is here where he discovers his new abilities. Throughout the series, Brandon discovers more about his powers, where the mysterious spirit came from, and most importantly, what really happened to his parents.

In this comic, we uncover a universe ridden with dark alleys and secrets. Given this comic deals with the occult realm, we will focus on showcasing some of the dark arts, creating a realistic view of the unknown from a realistic perspective and showcasing the intensity of the supernatural.

All in all, our goal is to open up on a seemingly normal human being with normal problems and a relatively normal life and transition that into a fast paced, supernatural rollercoaster filled with unexpected twists and turns. We follow this character through the series, watching him grow and evolve over time, as he discovers more and more about the truth of his past and how it’s intertwined with his present and future.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks or challenges other than trying to get funding to launch our project.

Fan Art Contest

Congrats to Christian Salazar (Instagram: @kristherion) for winning the 1st round of our Grimlock Fan Art Drawing Contest!!!

We're still calling all artists! We are holding a fan art contest. If you want to be considered for the next round, draw a cool version of Grimlock, post it on Instagram with hashtag #grimlockspirit

We’ll post the winner of the drawing contest on our Instagram page @grimlockspirit AND this crowdfund page!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. We ask that you make a splash by making some noise about the campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do so!

Follow Us on Social Media!

Instagram: @grimlockspirit

Twitter: @grimlockspirit

Inquiries

grimlockspirit@gmail.com

story:
About

Our team: we are a company of friends, which consists of industrial designers, programmers and cinematographers.

We have always had passion for design, concept art, movies, games etc. Once, we decided to create the most innovative comic based on concept art. First issue is coming soon. Now it's  designed exclusively for iPad, but in the future we are planning to release it for other platforms. With our app you'll be able to see a new world!


Synopsis

You'll see the rise of new civilization in a post-apocalyptic world. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to create new issues and keep 'em coming regularly. 

Here is some art from working process:


And here is how it finally looks

story:
THIS JUST IN! We've reached our goal amount, so that means that it's time to announce (and hopefully unlock) Stretch Goals! Here's the first:

What is MAXIMUM WIDOW EXHIBITION?

  MAXIMUM WIDOW EXHIBITION is a new collection of cover art from the extensive history of my WIDOW series, first published in 1992. Last year, I released a similar comic, MAXIMUM WIDOW UNCOVERED, a pin-up book featuring a slew of cover art images from the various adult variants that have been published over the years (UNCOVERED is available as an Add-On, by the way- see the bottom of the page for Add-On books). Many crowdfunding backers really enjoyed that one, and I've had numerous request to release a similar book that collects Emma's PG-13 cover appearances, so here it is, with exclusive Indiegogo variant covers!

  MAXIMUM WIDOW EXHIBITION contains 24 pages of full color art, reprinting the best and most unique WIDOW images ever, by artists such as Michael Avon Oeming, Karl Waller, Jude Millien, Dan Parsons, Jason Christensen, and others, including (naturally) me.

  Many of these images came from the covers of my FANGS OF THE WIDOW series, while others are from the WIDOW X reprint series that was published by Avatar Press. The only problem with producing this book was that I don't have any of my original art, nor do I have a single digital file of any of the final, colored cover art. What I had to do was obtain printed copies of all of the books I needed, scan the covers, then do a crap-ton of Photoshop work on them to clean them up and digitally remove the various company and series logos. That was NOT easy, but the work is done and the book is ready to go to press!

What kind of goodies will you get by backing MAXIMUM WIDOW EXHIBITION?

   The main perk is the wraparound cover edition of MAXIMUM WIDOW EXHIBITION, available in either print or digital. But you guys know me, and I know what you like... So I've created a nude cover variant, sporting steamy, never-before-seen art!

  And oh, no... It doesn't end there! I've also created a scorching hot "Valentine" variant for the true collectors out there!

   As you might have noticed in the graphics above, I'm making ALL THREE editions super-collectible by making all print copies signed and numbered, and limited to the number of backers! Let's say, for example, that only 30 of you reserve a copy of the nude edition- That means that this signed & numbered edition will be limited to ONLY 30 COPIES! CRAZY, huh?

  What other goodies am I offering to make this even more attractive? How about those ever-popular WIDOW TRADING CARDS?

  These three cards are a booster set to the existing WIDOW card set and can be enjoyed on their own, but the entire, previous 35-card set can also be obtained at various levels or as an add-on. The first 26 cards that come with this set were printed in 1997 and are already rare collectibles! Includes signed & numbered autograph card!

  There's the basics! Now, let's have a look at...

THE PLEDGE LEVELS

  DIGITAL BACKERS are up first, with a $5 level. For your pledge, you will receive a PDF download of MAXIMUM WIDOW EXHIBITION. Next come the physical rewards...

 If you love pin-up art, the level above is for you! You get all 3 MAXIMUM WIDOW EXHIBITION variants and the trading cards, PLUS GALLERY OF TERROR, GALLERY OF HORROR, GALLERY OF MONSTERS, and the adults-only MAXIMUM WIDOW UNCOVERED, at a savings of $25 when compared to the Add-On price of all of these extra books!

 The $90 level rewards you with the entire WIDOW ARCHIVES Collection(Vol. 1-5), PLUS the FANGS OF THE WIDOW ANNUAL, at a savings of $40 when compared to the Add-On price of all of these extra books!

  And if you're a collector of nude cover variants, check out the level below:

  And here's the BIG one, folks! The most exclusive, one-of-a-kind items I can offer!

 

ADD-ONS

  If you're not familiar with how Add-Ons work, they're additional items that you can add to your pledge perks. All you have to do to add an Add-On is select your pledge level, then add the additional funds to your pledge amount to cover the Add-Ons that you would like. After you make your pledge, send me a direct message here on Indiegogo to tell me what Add-Ons you would like, and you'll be ready to go! NOTE: If you are a backer from outside the United States, additional shipping costs might be necessary, depending on the weight of your Add-Ons. International backers must message me with your Add-On list before making your pledge to find out how much additional shipping funds will be necessary to cover your perks package.

Risks and challenges

This one's risk-free and challenge-free, because the work is already done! The only thing that has to be completed is the printing of the rewards, so shipping will commence shortly after that (mid-May)!

  And here's the BIG one, folks! The most exclusive, one-of-a-kind items I can offer!

  If you're not familiar with how Add-Ons work, they're additional items that you can add to your pledge perks. All you have to do to add an Add-On is select your pledge level, then add the additional funds to your pledge amount to cover the Add-Ons that you would like. After you make your pledge, send me a direct message here on Indiegogo to tell me what Add-Ons you would like, and you'll be ready to go! NOTE: If you are a backer from outside the United States, additional shipping costs might be necessary, depending on the weight of your Add-Ons. International backers must message me with your Add-On list before making your pledge to find out how much additional shipping funds will be necessary to cover your perks package.



Risks and challenges
This one's risk-free and challenge-free, because the work is already done! The only thing that has to be completed is the printing of the rewards, so shipping will commence shortly after that (mid-May)!

story:
(working cover for IT'S ALIVE! 5 YEARS AND BEYOND)

 

IT'S ALIVE! turns 5 Years Old...and we need your help!


On May 26th, 2016, IT'S ALIVE! launched its first Kickstarter campaign to publish Red Range: A Wild Western Adventure by Joe R. Lansdale and Sam Glanzman (with essays by Rick Klaw and Stephen R. Bissette). SInce then, IT'S ALIVE! is proud to have published several graphic novels, collections and comic books, including Airboy, Air War Stories, Aztec Ace, Battle For Britain, Breathers, D-Day, Dose!, Dope, Dunkirk, Family Man, Holler, Kona, Midway, Pink Lemonade, Red Range: Pirates of Fireworld, Pearl Harbor, The SIlver Metal Lover, and Voyage to the Deep.

2021 will mark the 5 year anniversary for IT'S ALIVE!

Unfortunately, right now IT'S ALIVE! is in trouble financially.

To help make sure we will be around for another 5 years, IT'S ALIVE! is hoping to raise some funds by producing a new book that celebrates the great artwork IT'S ALIVE! has published since 2016.

This NEW book will include the enormous talent of folks like Bart Sears, Bill Sienkiewicz, Bret Blevins, ChrisCross, Colleen Doran, Dalibor Talajic, Dan Day, Dave Dorman, Denys Cowan, Don Perlin, Emma Kubert, Graham Nolan, Jeff Lemire, Jim Rugg, Jim Steranko, Joe Staton, John McCrea, Kelley Jones, Matt Kindt, Michael Avon Oeming, Michael Wm. Kaluta, N. Steven Harris, Paul Gulacy, Paul Pope, Rich Tommaso, Russ Braun, Russ Heath, Sam Glanzman, Sam Kieth, Sean Phillips, Stephen R. Bissette, Thomas Yeates, Trina Robbins, Walter Simonson, and many more!  (Check out some of these incredible images below!)

I have been so lucky to work with such a talented group of artists, and I would be honored to continue publishing new works by these and many other hard-working creators.  But it is only with your help that IT'S ALIVE! will be able to do this for another 5 years!

PERKS

$40 gets you a PDF of IT'S ALIVE! 5 YEARS AND BEYOND

$50 gets you a physical copy of IT'S ALIVE! 5 YEARS AND BEYOND

$60 gets you a physical copy of IT'S ALIVE! 5 YEARS AND BEYOND, signed by Drew Ford

 

Many comics already published by IT'S ALIVE! are available as add-ons from this campaign, including: Airboy #51, Air War Stories #1, Breathers #1, Dose! #1, Holler #1, and Red Range: Pirates of Fireworld.

THIS IS THE MOST IMPORTANT CAMPAIGN IT'S ALIVE! HAS EVER DONE!

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL ENSURE THE FUTURE OF IT'S ALIVE!

We need all the help we can get.  Feel free to share this with anyone and everyone!

Please stay healthy and safe.

Best,

Drew Ford
Publisher
IT’S ALIVE!

IT'S ALIVE! is the brainchild of multiple Eisner Award nominee Drew Ford, publishing out of print comics, English translations of foreign material, original projects, and other unique collectibles.

Currently publishing Airboy, Breathers, Dose!, Holler, Pink Lemonade, Red Range, Sam Glanzman’s Kona, and much more!

 

HERE ARE JUST A FEW OF THE INCREDIBLE PIECES OF ARTWORK THAT WILL BE INCLUDED IN THIS NEW BOOK

 

Jim Steranko

 

Bill Sienkiewicz

 

Bart Sears

 

Colleen Doran

 

Jim Rugg

 

Jeff Lemire & Matt Kindt

 

John McCrea

 

Paul Gulacy

 

Paul Pope

 

Sam Kieth

 

Walter Simonson

 

Bret Blevins

 

Denys Cowan

 

Sean Phillips

 

Russ Braun

 

Dalibor Talajic

 

Rufus Dayglo

 

N. Steven Harris

 

Dave Dorman

story:
About the Book

 

     Oliver and the Stone Age tells the story of a young boy who embarks on a fantastic journey, guided by a magical book and accompanied by his faithful dog, Toby. The story starts when Oliver and his sister, Sam, go to visit his father at a scientific investigation site. Not knowing what to expect, finds himself with a life different than the city life he is used to. His sister hands him a book, previously owned by his father, containing a treasure of information about the people and fauna that lived in that same place, thousands of years ago.

     After a misunderstanding with his sister, Oliver ventures, along with his faithful friend, into what could either be his doom or the biggest adventure of his life, where he will meet strange new friends, scary beasts and learn the biggest lessons in life.

     Oliver and the Stone Age is a story about family, frienships, the magic of knowledge and the importance of a child's imagination.  The book contains 43 pages of story, fully painted digitally in Photoshop. 

 

  

What I Need & What You Get

The comic is done, save for a few updates I want to make since I finished it as a graduation project. While the project is being funded, I will take some time to translate the text from spanish, the original language, to english. I will also be revising the entire comic for any errors I might have missed, repainting some stuff I want to redo and push my work further. The estimated delivery of the comics will be July, but will be working hard to deliver them sooner.

I will also be work on some of the prizes I will be offering, like original prints.

The Impact

There are a couple of reasons why I want to publish this book. The first one would be to fulfill the parameters for my graduation and have a quality product to exhibit and offer. Second, this is a presentation card from me to those interested in digital painting and comics. I want to meet new people, share experiences, make work connections and expand to new places.

But most of all, I want to give something back to the community. I wanted to make something fun, positive, for families and children to have fun with. To introduce them  or make them comfortable with reading, with being inquisitive, with their own imaginations and to ask questions about the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute economically, you can still help by sharing this page on your Twitter, Facebook or blog!

 

About Me

     My name is Angel López, writer and illustrator for this book, and I live in Puerto Rico. I love fantasy and science fiction, and even though I wrote and illustrated a comic book, I don't consider myself a comic book artist. I love creating, imagining environments, characters, narratives, etc. Thus I imagined I could take all those things and focus on this kind of project, because, why not?

If you want to see some of my art, come visit my Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/angelillustrated

story:
Summary:

A love is lost, but new love is found.

A two-shot BL spin off of the classic fairy tales, Rumplestiltskin and the Frog Prince, we follow our hero, Russel, through a long journey of loss of love and rebirth of hope. And of course, angst and fluff is included.

Aim:

The dream…

Is to do a run of graphic novels for this two-shot which has been a culmination of 2-3 years of work. I have found a printer to do the job and they will print some really beautiful books (the cover will be really awesome and matte! It’ll be really nice to touch). In addition to the books, you receive lot of cool stuff!

How:

Most of the money will be spent on the printing, the rest is on shipping and handling so what you donate, will be everything: shipping and handling.*

Qualifications:

I am an aspiring comic book artist who has been drawing comics since I was very young. This will be my second self-published comic (the first one being a charity comic where all profits are donated to charity). I love this work, and I put my heart and soul into it. I hope that you all will have as much enjoyment if not more out of the work I create.

My previous work is available here at my Storenvy:
http://darkgreyclouds.storenvy.com/collections/64416-all-products/products/561144-you-are-so-cheesy

I have an art blog if you want to forward questions or comments or anything there!
http://darkgreyclouds.tumblr.com

Progress:

Currently, the second part of the two shot is available to read for free online here at: http://iafs.smackjeeves.com. I am half way through finishing that and as soon as it’s done, I’ll be formatting the book for publishing. There is a possibility of  an extra fluff story, however there will be extra bonuses describing the world and the characters and everything in the book. My aim is to have everything printed and shipped out by late May.

Book techical details (est.):

  • 5.5in x 8.5in (roughly A5)
  • 100-110 pages 
  • Black and white inside, color outside 
  • Free 4x6in (roughly A6) print on the inside of a character (randomized | out of 4 | printed books only)

The Loot:

In addition to funding this project, you receive:

  • Bookmarks: The full set is a set of all 4 characters, everyone receives a randomized 2 set per donation. 
  • Charms: these are 1.5”/3.65cm metallic charm phone charms of chibi couple Varen and Russel, super cute and in limited quantity ^^ 
  • PDF versions: The full book with everything in a pdf format 
  • Book: signed by me with a personally written note to you as thanks 
  • Limited Edition print: This is a limited ed run print. I will print as many as the people who order this package and then no more. 
  • Super Limited print: There will only be 10 in existence. Ever. They are printed on really high quality watercolor paper and signed personally. Comes with a protective plastic sheet. 
  • In Between Inadvertent and IAFS side story: A short story (PDF ebook) of what happened in between Inadvertent and It’s a Frog story! Russel’s adventures in school can only be described as a whole new enchilada~ 
  • Copic request + additional story: A 9x12 full color commission of any fairy tale character/couple the donator requests and a short story of their adventures in the Inadvertent/It’s a Frog Story universe. Comes plastic sleeved.

All donations are appreciated! For every donation over $10, your name will be listed in the acknowledgements. If you can’t donate, please spread the word! Thank you so much for your support and with this continued success, I can afford give you an awesome product!

story:
Introduction:

Born in Silicon Valley, California, the first time ever Kid Inventors comics is published to public right here! The Kid Inventors comics will bring you to an amazing adventure with a group of school kids! Inspiring the new technologies today and future, Kid Inventors comic series is a fun educational Comics, and a Fantasy-to-Reality story. Drawn, designed, and written by Ed Shen, Kid Inventors uses a mix of cartoon panels and descriptions, such as hints, ideas, and mentor’s explanations to help readers understand the technical and scientific background of each story. It also gives you ideas and passion to explore your imaginations to Create, Invent, and Start-up!

The Kid Inventors project is a production of comics and episodic animation movie series produced by KidInventor production led by Ed Shen, the author. Your support will make our production to the next level! 

 It’s a book for all ages, especially good for children and teens from 5 to 17 to attractive them to learn something useful in young age.  The Volume 2 and 3 will be available in 3-4 months.

Background:

Since I was a kid, inferred from my parents and grandparents, I’ve liked to make hands-on models, do scientific experiments, and create artworks and “inventions”. After completing my engineering degree, I have been working for Fortune 500 companies and start-ups in Silicon Valley, California as a technologist, engineer, and new product development leader. Also I’m an artist and art/science teacher for kids as my part-time career. In my graduate study, I created a couple of comics in my class presentation materials to demonstrate the research concepts. Then I made some comic strips, after another, and tried them in local children’s science camps and my art/cartoon classes. I received pretty good feedbacks from the professors, classmates, and my students.

My daily life—from the thrill of starting a new idea, to the long and harsh days dedicated to development, and finally to the moments of celebrating a new-product launch—all of them have inspired me to create this story. Therefore, I decided to combine my techno and education experiences, and art skills to make comics and animated film series to give today’s kids a production that’s not only for fun but also for learning something useful for their studies, careers, and future development.

Because I have a busy full-time job at a leading position of a fast-growing Silicon Valley company, plus my part time jobs, I have to devote most of my evenings, weekends and holidays to this creation. Now after several years of dedication, it's the time to start a new journey: making Kid Inventors! Publishing this book is just the beginning!

The Mission:

The mission of Kid Inventor comics and their affiliated productions is to encourage curiosity, learning desire, creativity, teamwork, leadership, and community contribution for today’s young people to create more geniuses like Steve Jobs, Nikola Tesla, Thomas Edison, Albert Einstein, Bill Gates, and Elon Musk in the future!

Early-age education is very important for students to attract them to the technical field. Most famous scientists and inventors started their learning and creating practices at early ages. These stories provide fun and interesting ways to attract children to explore their imagination and interests in technical fields.

Today’s youngsters use all kinds of high-tech stuffs, such as smartphones, tablets, computers, tech toys, etc. However, not too many students know about the scientific and technical backgrounds behind these devices.  It's a perfect reading and learning material for your kids in this Summer.  

The Story:

Eddy, a school boy, is full of curiosities and imaginations, has a lot of dramatic “Great Ideas”, and always like to do some hands-on “cool” creations. But some people think his ideas are just fantasies!

Dotty is Eddy’s younger sister. She is always the companion of Eddy, but she sometimes likes to challenge his bro, and creates something not technical, but interesting and “meaningful”!

Eddy’s classmates and friends Jenny, Coddy, Webby, and Intty each has different skills, talents, and creative ideas, and they joined with Eddy one after another with their strong desire to learn and great ambitious to invent! 

They are trying to start some interesting projects, but they have no tools, no money, no facilities, and most importantly, no enough knowledge and skills. They are facing a lot of difficulties and challenges…

But they never give up. They keep trying, learning from the mistakes, and finding more resources...

With their persistent efforts, from small to big, they made many creations… the conflicts between their wild innovative “Great Ideas”, and their limited knowledge creates a lot of challenges and a lot of funny stories!

Along the way, you'll find they created many robot characters, such as Shogogo, Smaro, Mr. Unbeatable, Cuoobal, Suparo, and Meearo, etc. with different functions, skills and personalities… 

With their persistent efforts, they talents have been recognized by their school teacher Kaity and an engineer Robby and got some supports from school and industry… They finally formed an invention team in their school’s Technology and Robotics Club… They want to make super advanced inventive projects… They want to participate the International Student Invention Competitions to challenge high school and college students!...Suddenly, disasters happened! Evil robots, virus, and neutral disasters, …to save the planet, they have to fight! They are using their inventions and capabilities, they are taking actions…

The Book:  Features and Uniqueness

Drawn, designed, and written by Ed Shen, Kid Inventors contains a lot of short stories to form many episodes. which is also for the purpose to make animation TV/Internet show series.  It uses a mix of comics and descriptions—including theme, emotion, and technical descriptions such as hints, ideas, notes, and mentor’s explanations—to help readers better understand the background of each story. The book is funny, exciting, scary, sad, happy, mysterious, lighthearted, and family friendly…and hopefully evocative of emotions and experiences you’ve encountered in your daily life or your younger days. It’s good for all ages.

Kid Inventors is not only a comic, but also an educational story that includes some new and future technology, science, engineering, and design knowledge, as well as thinking-learning-doing concepts and processes. It’s the journey of a starters or a start-up company will be experienced from vision, concept, technical feasibility, methodologies, team-up to achieving the goals. It’s a dream that many kids have and many adults had.

The stories emphasize creativity, teamwork, contribution to society, hands-on experience, and learning from mistakes through a thinking-learning-doing process to reach the goal. Kid Inventors tells us to never give up our dreams. If you keep on it, your dream will come true!

It’s good book for you to read. It’s a perfect gift for your kids for this summer 2018!

The comedy, mystery, science, and educational concepts are naturally blend in every story. 

Goal, Plan and Your Supports:  

This book is the first publication, which is a limited edition black and white series. The Book Volume 1 has about 180 pages.  Volume 2 and 3 are on the way to complete the final editing in 3 months.

As planned, in 2018, Ed and his Kid Inventors Production team will start make this comic series an animation film series for children’s TV and Internet shows. 

Your participation and support will help Kid Inventors to be successful to the next level…

The Kid Inventors is not only a comic, but also a concept of learning-by-doing, hands-on, imagination to reality, and start at young for kids and society. Stay tuned with us. I and my team will have more productions in near future!

So your support will be the MOST IMPORTANT thing in Kid Inventors history, and this limited black and white edition will a treasure to keep. It's a perfect Summer learning material for your kids!  

Join us! Join with Kid Inventors! Thank You!

Risks

There is no risk for this project itself.  The 1st book has already been done and formatted with sample books. Our team will try our best to deliver it to you on time rain or shine! We will be working with proven production and fulfillment partners to deliver high-quality items delivered in a timely fashion in July!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help us here:

  • Follow us here:        https://twitter.com/kid_inventors
  • More Info: http://kidinventors.net/Comics/kid-inventors/
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!

Along the way, you'll find they created many robot characters, such as Shogogo, Smaro, Mr. Unbeatable, Cuoobal, Suparo, and Meearo, etc. with different functions, skills and personalities… 
With their persistent efforts, they talents have been recognized by their school teacher Kaity and an engineer Robby and got some supports from school and industry… They finally formed an invention team in their school’s Technology and Robotics Club… They want to make super advanced inventive projects… They want to participate the International Student Invention Competitions to challenge high school and college students!...Suddenly, disasters happened! Evil robots, virus, and neutral disasters, …to save the planet, they have to fight! They are using their inventions and capabilities, they are taking actions…

The Book:  Features and Uniqueness
Drawn, designed, and written by Ed Shen, Kid Inventors contains a lot of short stories to form many episodes. which is also for the purpose to make animation TV/Internet show series.  It uses a mix of comics and descriptions—including theme, emotion, and technical descriptions such as hints, ideas, notes, and mentor’s explanations—to help readers better understand the background of each story. The book is funny, exciting, scary, sad, happy, mysterious, lighthearted, and family friendly…and hopefully evocative of emotions and experiences you’ve encountered in your daily life or your younger days. It’s good for all ages.
Kid Inventors is not only a comic, but also an educational story that includes some new and future technology, science, engineering, and design knowledge, as well as thinking-learning-doing concepts and processes. It’s the journey of a starters or a start-up company will be experienced from vision, concept, technical feasibility, methodologies, team-up to achieving the goals. It’s a dream that many kids have and many adults had.
The stories emphasize creativity, teamwork, contribution to society, hands-on experience, and learning from mistakes through a thinking-learning-doing process to reach the goal. Kid Inventors tells us to never give up our dreams. If you keep on it, your dream will come true!
It’s good book for you to read. It’s a perfect gift for your kids for this summer 2018!
The comedy, mystery, science, and educational concepts are naturally blend in every story. 
Goal, Plan and Your Supports:  
This book is the first publication, which is a limited edition black and white series. The Book Volume 1 has about 180 pages.  Volume 2 and 3 are on the way to complete the final editing in 3 months.
As planned, in 2018, Ed and his Kid Inventors Production team will start make this comic series an animation film series for children’s TV and Internet shows. 
Your participation and support will help Kid Inventors to be successful to the next level…
The Kid Inventors is not only a comic, but also a concept of learning-by-doing, hands-on, imagination to reality, and start at young for kids and society. Stay tuned with us. I and my team will have more productions in near future!
So your support will be the MOST IMPORTANT thing in Kid Inventors history, and this limited black and white edition will a treasure to keep. It's a perfect Summer learning material for your kids!  
Join us! Join with Kid Inventors! Thank You!


Risks
There is no risk for this project itself.  The 1st book has already been done and formatted with sample books. Our team will try our best to deliver it to you on time rain or shine! We will be working with proven production and fulfillment partners to deliver high-quality items delivered in a timely fashion in July!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help us here:

Follow us here:        https://twitter.com/kid_inventors

More Info: http://kidinventors.net/Comics/kid-inventors/

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!

story: Well the thing is...
story_txt: Well the thing is...

story:
Detective Butts is a comic book series that follows the adventures of Max Hartman, a once Handsome Man horribly disfigured during an investigation gone wrong. As a compromise for keeping the details of that particular case a secret, his former Boss and Chief of Police ensures he’s taken care of and free to practice his passion for Detective work on his own. He is often assisted by his close friend and former co-worker, Harold.

The end result of this campaign will be the launch issue of Detective Butts (the first in a two part story), available 6 months earlier than if we were to try to fund it on our own.

For your contribution, your name (and Twitter handle if you have one!) will appear on a special Thank You page at the beginning of the issue for all to see.

In addition, all of our wonderful supporters will be recieving a digital download packet that contains the Prologue of Detective Butts that chronicles how he found himself in his unfortunate situation. You don't want to miss out on that, we assure you!

 

 

 

1. Time: Drawing up the first story arc in full and laying the groundwork for subsequent storylines to stay ahead of the game.

 

  • We've gotta get this puppy prepped for release into the Wild! Boy howdy, does that ever take a lot of time and mental gymnastics. In order for our us to be able to lovingly craft every meaty curve of this world, organize the business end and not burn out, we need 2 months (July & August) to work full time to make the September deadline.

 

2. Supplies

  • Paper

  • Sharpies (and lots of ‘em!)

  • A Scanner  

  • Comic Book Backing Boards and Plastic Sleeves
  • Lots of Coffee.

 

3. Printing!

 The first print run will get us ahead of the game and bankroll the conclusion issue for the first story (slated for release this coming October). We’re going for full colour. If we don’t make our goal we may have to bump it down to greyscale/ black & white and release the colour version at a later date.

We have a choice between two companies; the Overseas option is a dollar and change less than the North American option (Ka-Blam!). If we go past our goal by enough we will be going local. We really really want to go local.


Total Estimated Cost: $2800

 

We Are Also Offering Advertising Space:

 

$100 for a full page Ad.

$50 for a half page Ad.

 

If you would like to purchase ad space instead of donating here, go ahead and contact Kat at DetectiveButts {at} gmail.com with your details. Only approved ads will run. Butts Comics will be sold in comic book stores in Ontario, Canada and on the World Wide Web... (!)

 

 

Bill Smith} Head Writer

 

Kat Smith} Creator, Cartoonist, Project Manager

@TurboToaster

 

 

Rory Giess} Writer, Goof Consultant 

@Cobaltblue72

Duncan McFarlane} Writer, Butt Understudy

@Kouerson

 

 

Retro “Fan Club” Goodies!

We want to beef these comics up with some good old fashioned Fan Club activities! The big idea is that we’ll be hiding Clues in all of the comics for you guys to chew on. These Clues will lead to Prize Packs at the conclusion of each story arc for those who figure them out first. We've always liked winning stuff and we assume you do too. 

 

Higher-Quality, Local Printing

As stated above, we want to have all of our printing done in North America. No disrespect to China, but it’s important to us that we support the most local printing option possible. Getting us to the goal and past it garners us the dollar and change more we need per issue.

 

Should we fail to meet our goal, we'll be pressing on because this is ultimately a passion project comprised of people who have been best friends since high school. We just don't know when we'd be able to get it done and printed. Perks will be fulfilled in the event that the project is successfully funded, so tell everyone you can to pitch in!

story:
CGI Buffalo Comic Series

My name is Tom De Geeter from Marathon of Dope and I'm the creator of a new comic book series called CGI Buffalo. Drawing, graphic design and music have been my passion for the last 20 years. I'm glad to say it's also been my daily income for the last 15 years.

I wrote this first script and created the comic over the course of the last year. I’m really proud of the series I created and I think you’re gonna like it. I’m asking for your support to create physical copies of the first 3 issues.

So what is CGI Buffalo about?
Its a biographical black comedy-drama, set in an innercity environment. It tells the story of Ceegee, a buffalo slash man suffering from extreme memory loss who must figure out who he is. After Ceegee gets a bunch of clues trough his every day life of being a radio host and hanging at the local record store, he goes into a downward spiral of paranoia and delusion. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this comic book series successfull, we are just looking to break even and get positive feedback from you, the reader. We want to have quality physical copies done and we are offering amazing backer awards in return. Make your choice in the right collumn.

 

Pricing Levels (see right)

SCOUT LEVEL 10€

  • CGI Buffalo: Issue 1 (Digital &Physical)
  • 2 different CGI Buffalo stickers

TRUST LEVEL 20€

  • CGI Buffalo: Issue 1, 2 & 3 (Digital &Physical)
  • 2 different CGI Buffalo stickers
  • Your name on the Backer Page of the Book

LOVE LEVEL 50€ // LIMITED TO 20

  • CGI Buffalo: Issue 1, 2 & 3 (Digital &Physical) signed
  • 2 different CGI Buffalo stickers
  • Your name on the Backer Page of the Book
  • Personalised black and white A4 format drawing

ENGAGEMENT LEVEL 100€ // LIMITED TO 10

  • CGI Buffalo: Issue 1, 2 & 3 (Digital &Physical) signed
  • 2 different CGI Buffalo stickers
  • Your name on the Backer Page of the Book
  • Personalised Coloured A4 drawing framed.

FAMILY LEVEL 250€ // LIMITED TO 3

  • CGI Buffalo: Issue 1, 2 & 3 (Digital)
  • CGI Buffalo: Issue 1, 2 & 3 (Physical) signed
  • 2 different CGI Buffalo stickers
  • Your name on the Backer Page of the Book
  • Personalised Coloured A4 drawing framed
  • Your likeness added as a character in a scene of CGI Buffalo #4

 

Risks & Challenges

Challenge #1: It's our first time.

This is the first crowdfunding project for Marathon of Dope. We know and understand that this will be learning experience for everyone involved. We hope that by setting a modest goal, we can learn from the experience and plan more ambitious projects in the future.

Challenge #2: Will I actually get a copy of the book?

Sometimes a project comes to Indiegogo before the final product is complete. We are fortunate in that 2 of the 3 books is finished. We have 26 full color pages (and cover art) ready to go to the printer. The money that we raise here will be going towards the printing and shipping costs.

Challenge #3: Why Another Comic Book? 

We understand that there are many projects out there hoping to get your support. We have tried to create backer rewards for all levels of interest in this project. We believe that our story is unique, our art is beautiful, and the product we are creating is a great value to you.

Challenge #4: Issue One to Three? Is this a series?

Yes, this is the first of what we hope will be a nine part series. We have scripts for the future books. It is our hope that readers will enjoy this book, and support future installments.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help

Sharing my video, the link www.cgibuffalo.com or mentioning this project on any social media would mean a lot to me and to the future of all creative things we are trying to do on Marathon of Dope.

story:
Short Summary

In the summer of 2015, Dustin Meadows (that's me!) founded Whiskey Bear Comedy with the express purpose of producing quality comedy shows under a memorable banner to maintain consistency while growing and retaining a dedicated comedy audience. In 2014 and 2015 I produced the Columbus Comedy Festival, a staple of the Columbus comedy scene since 2010 that focused on showcasing comedians within the city. In 2015, the Columbus Comedy Festival was expanded to include comedians from neighboring cities in Ohio, and I also produced Rock Bottom Fest, a two night comedy show featuring comedians from all over Ohio as well as Chicago and Tennessee.
The plan was always to continue building towards a festival that would showcase some of Columbus' best comics and venues while also bringing in exciting new talent from across the country as well as national headliners, to bring them to our city and show them that the 614 can actually be a pretty dope place, for comedy, as well as other things. And this year, it's finally happening with the first ever Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival, which I'm producing with fellow Columbus comedians Lisa Berry and Tom Plute.
There's a lot of great comedy going on in smaller towns, from our sister cities in Cincinnati and Cleveland to places like Fort Wayne or Knoxville. Those cities have been an inspiration to myself, and I think Columbus could one day be on the same level as those places, and that's what Whiskey Bear Comedy is all about. That's what this festival is all about.

What We Need & What You Get

We're shooting to raise $4,000 to help us cover the costs associated with producing an independent festival

$1,200-Compensation, food and lodging for our headliner and traveling show runners

$1,300-Promotional materials, website and sponsored advertising

$1,500-Amenities for performers including welcome packages and providing food/drink so we can show everyone a little Midwest hospitality

The festival will feature several local showcases and even local specialty shows like Whiskey Deep and The Pop Culture Mixtape.

We're also excited to be bringing the following shows into Columbus, some for the very first time!

  • Underwear Comedy Party, hosted by Joe Pettis
  • Dungeon: A Comedy Role-Playing Show, hosted by Remi Treuer
  • Me & Paranormal You, hosted by our festival headliner Ryan Singer


Many of the shows will take place at Mikey's Late Night Slice, located in downtown Columbus, as well as satellite shows throughout the weekend. For more details, visit whiskeybearcomedyfestival.com!

For anyone contributing to the festival, we have several sweet reward tiers for you to choose from!

1. Whiskey Bear Comedy Button ($5)

-A nice little piece of Whiskey Bear Comedy flair!

2. Ticket to One Show Of Your Choice (Thursday-Sunday) and a WBC Button ($10)

-WBC Button+admission to one show of your choice (Thursday through Sunday only)


3. Comedian Submission ($15)

-Are you a comic interested in submitting to perform? This is the place! Make your donation and then follow the instructions to complete your submission.


4. Tix to Two Shows Of Your Choice (Thursday-Sunday)+Two WBC Buttons ($15)

Got a special someone you want to impress? Have two tickets to one show of your choice (Thursday through Sunday only) and TWO WBC Buttons to seal the deal! Rather fly solo and double your value? Then have a ticket for two shows of your choice (Thursday through Sunday only)!


5. Tix to Two Shows Of Your Choice (Thursday-Sunday)+Two WBC Buttons+WBC Festival Poster ($20)

Same as the $15 deal but now there's a super dope 11x17 Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival Poster on the table as well!


6. Day Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster ($30)

Get into every show for one day of your choice (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+a super dope 11x17 Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival Poster


7. Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster ($50)

Now you can catch every show Thursday through Sunday, and you've got a button and a poster to remind you of your magical weekend at the Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival!


8. Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt ($65)

Everything in the above tier plus some sweet Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival threads for you to rock after the festival. Or wear it at the festival, we don't care! We're just here to make sure you have a good time, so you do you!


9. Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt+One Month Of Free Admission To All Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows ($100)

Everything in the above tier plus a month of free admission to any Whiskey Bear Comedy Show!


10. Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt+One Month Of Free Admission To All Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows+Special Guest On An Episode Of Whiskey Deep w/ Tom Plute ($150)

Everything in the above tier as well as the opportunity to be a special guest on the whiskey fueled live podcast/comedy show, Whiskey Deep!


11, Weekend Pass+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt+Free Admission For One Year To All Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows ($250)

Weekend Pass? Check! Button? Check! Festival Poster? Check! T-Shirt? Check! A full year of free admission to all Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows? Oh hell yeah.

12. Whiskey Bear Comedy Pop-Up Show+Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday) ($300)

You'll not only get into all of the shows Thursday through Sunday, but you'll also get Dustin, Lisa, Tom and a special guest or two bringing the comedy to you (within 100 miles of Columbus) for you and as many people as you want, putting on a stand-up show that is sure to be a good time as well as impress all your friends!


13. Go Big Or Go Home ($500)
You're gonna get a weekend pass (Thursday-Sunday). You're gonna get a button. You're gonna get a festival poster. You're gonna get a t-shirt. You're gonna get a year of free admission to all Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows. And you're gonna get a Whiskey Bear Comedy Pop-Up Show. Eat your heart out, Oprah.

The Impact

At the end of the day, the mission of the Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival is two-fold. First and foremost, we want to put on the best comedy show we can. We want to create a week of comedy programming that's just as much fun for our audience as it is for our performers.

Secondly, and in a big picture sense of things, we want people who come to Columbus to perform comedy to want to come back to Columbus to perform comedy. We want the people who live here in Columbus to know that there's amazing comedy, several nights a month, that they can come out and see and be a part of. Because at the end of the day, comics need an audience more than an audience needs comics. It's the only way we grow, it's the only way we get better. Comedy in this city has been very good. Let's make it great.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest concern in producing comedy is always "Will people come to these shows?" It's a fear that never goes away unless you're someone like Louis C.K. or Bill Burr and you're booking theaters at $40-50 a head. Having produced three festivals as well as performing in several over the past few years, you tend to pick up a few things. I've been fortunate enough to have a pretty solid track record with the festivals I've been involved in, whether as producer or performer. But that fear is still very real, no matter how many positive experiences you've had. It's a lot of work pulling off a comedy festival, and even more work pulling off a successful one. A lot of work has already gone into this festival, well before this campaign launched, and even more is going to go into it during and long after the campaign ends. The greatest fear is that if we're not successful, a lot of people are going to walk away from this festival and Columbus with a negative impression of comedy in this city. But I'm confident that when all is said and done, we'll have pulled it off. So what do you say? Let's all be heroes.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Buy tickets in advance for shows. Plan on coming out during the festival. Tickets will be available for purchase beginning in April after the campaign has ended and the final line-up has been announced. Stay tuned to Whiskey Bear Comedy or by checking out the website.
  • Spread the word! Tweet, Facebook, Instagram, yell at people on the bus, however you like to let people know about cool things! Sharing the information is a big help, especially when it's not just us comedians barking at regular folks to come listen to our jokey times.
  • Volunteer! We'll be looking for a handful of people to assist with things like running the door and providing transportation for comedians. To find out more, contact whiskeybearcomedy@gmail.com

Now you can catch every show Thursday through Sunday, and you've got a button and a poster to remind you of your magical weekend at the Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival!
8. Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt ($65)
Everything in the above tier plus some sweet Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival threads for you to rock after the festival. Or wear it at the festival, we don't care! We're just here to make sure you have a good time, so you do you!
9. Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt+One Month Of Free Admission To All Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows ($100)
Everything in the above tier plus a month of free admission to any Whiskey Bear Comedy Show!

10. Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday)+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt+One Month Of Free Admission To All Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows+Special Guest On An Episode Of Whiskey Deep w/ Tom Plute ($150)
Everything in the above tier as well as the opportunity to be a special guest on the whiskey fueled live podcast/comedy show, Whiskey Deep!
11, Weekend Pass+WBC Button+Festival Poster+WBC Festival T-Shirt+Free Admission For One Year To All Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows ($250)Weekend Pass? Check! Button? Check! Festival Poster? Check! T-Shirt? Check! A full year of free admission to all Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows? Oh hell yeah.

12. Whiskey Bear Comedy Pop-Up Show+Weekend Pass (Thursday-Sunday) ($300)
You'll not only get into all of the shows Thursday through Sunday, but you'll also get Dustin, Lisa, Tom and a special guest or two bringing the comedy to you (within 100 miles of Columbus) for you and as many people as you want, putting on a stand-up show that is sure to be a good time as well as impress all your friends!
13. Go Big Or Go Home ($500)

You're gonna get a weekend pass (Thursday-Sunday). You're gonna get a button. You're gonna get a festival poster. You're gonna get a t-shirt. You're gonna get a year of free admission to all Whiskey Bear Comedy Shows. And you're gonna get a Whiskey Bear Comedy Pop-Up Show. Eat your heart out, Oprah.
   The Impact At the end of the day, the mission of the Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival is two-fold. First and foremost, we want to put on the best comedy show we can. We want to create a week of comedy programming that's just as much fun for our audience as it is for our performers.
Secondly, and in a big picture sense of things, we want people who come to Columbus to perform comedy to want to come back to Columbus to perform comedy. We want the people who live here in Columbus to know that there's amazing comedy, several nights a month, that they can come out and see and be a part of. Because at the end of the day, comics need an audience more than an audience needs comics. It's the only way we grow, it's the only way we get better. Comedy in this city has been very good. Let's make it great.

    Risks & Challenges The biggest concern in producing comedy is always "Will people come to these shows?" It's a fear that never goes away unless you're someone like Louis C.K. or Bill Burr and you're booking theaters at $40-50 a head. Having produced three festivals as well as performing in several over the past few years, you tend to pick up a few things. I've been fortunate enough to have a pretty solid track record with the festivals I've been involved in, whether as producer or performer. But that fear is still very real, no matter how many positive experiences you've had. It's a lot of work pulling off a comedy festival, and even more work pulling off a successful one. A lot of work has already gone into this festival, well before this campaign launched, and even more is going to go into it during and long after the campaign ends. The greatest fear is that if we're not successful, a lot of people are going to walk away from this festival and Columbus with a negative impression of comedy in this city. But I'm confident that when all is said and done, we'll have pulled it off. So what do you say? Let's all be heroes.

    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Buy tickets in advance for shows. Plan on coming out during the festival. Tickets will be available for purchase beginning in April after the campaign has ended and the final line-up has been announced. Stay tuned to Whiskey Bear Comedy or by checking out the website.
Spread the word! Tweet, Facebook, Instagram, yell at people on the bus, however you like to let people know about cool things! Sharing the information is a big help, especially when it's not just us comedians barking at regular folks to come listen to our jokey times.
Volunteer! We'll be looking for a handful of people to assist with things like running the door and providing transportation for comedians. To find out more, contact whiskeybearcomedy@gmail.com

story:
Thank You for stopping by and checking this project out

 

Last year I successfully fulfilled my comic book the Canadian Shield #1.

While I waiting for art for my next comic campaign I thought I would bring this fun project to you.

 

The Cross Comic Colouring Book will have a minimum of 40 interior

pages. Each Character will have include brief history on their page unless

they have more than 1 page. A variety of people have contribute to the art

most of the pages have been done by me

 

I have chosen a flexible goal of $500 Canadian so that if I don't get to the $500

goal I will be able to still get the colouring book out to people

 

Choice of Pages for 11x15 art pages

 

Here are some pages from the book

 

Page by George Gatis below

Picture by FlyFoxPro below

Next two Pictures below by John Dillard of the Buckler campaign

 

Picture below by Flit 

I want to thank everyone for their support and if you are unable to back please share it out with all you know

story:
Short Summary

Hi I’m Lisa, aka Baggy on the web. I need $800 to cover the costs to print a variety of books based on my own comic series Madam Butterscotch.

I will be offering some fantastic perks for anyone who wishes to contribute. I’m very excited about all the progress that’s going on with the Butterscotch collection and I’m keen to share all updates with you guys.

You can read the first 3 Chapters for FREE online at my smackjeeves -> http://madambutterscotch.smackjeeves.com/

If you like what you see, then please contribute to keep the series going, so I can get it in print for all you lovely, shiny people.

You can also see my art and keep up to date with me via:

  • DeviantART - http://baggy666.deviantart.com/
  • Twitter - https://twitter.com/#!/LisaBaggy
  • Facebook Page - https://www.facebook.com/pages/Baggy/285445138178855

Who am I?:

My name is Lisa Cummins or Baggy if you’ve seen me on the web or at conventions.

I’m an animation and illustration Graduate from the UK, currently working on various freelance projects in the UK convention scene.
I’ve had my work published in magazines, including NEO Magazine and various anthologies, including Non Repro’s Nami: Manga Jiman and Yum!Jinka.

I love to draw and would love to make working in comics my career and not in my mum and dad’s pub, no matter how much I love them.

What’s the money for then?

I’ve spent the last 4 years working hard on my own comic series, Madam Butterscotch – a thriller based black and white comic about the life and (hitman!) alter ego of mother and tea shop owner, Tilda Llewellyn:

Having come out of hiding and moved to a quaint little town, she is forced to re-enter her old world to ensure peace and happiness for herself and her daughter - but can she balance being a killing machine and a mother?.

It’s full of great characters, witty banter, English satire, plenty of action, mystery, intrigue, GUNS! and Tea.

It’s been in print for a year now and I have 3 chapters available to read online. But with each chapter printed, means more costs.
By the end of this year I will have Chapter 4 and the first Volume ready; Volume 1 will contain ALL 4 CHAPTERS, a bonus short comic and some art.
I also have a stack of artwork, which I would love to be able to turn into an Art Book, which will include all the conceptual art for Butterscotch and the various characters and environments, how Butterscotch started, thumbnail process – how I go about making a page, special fan-art section of all the art that has been made of Butterscotch, as well as some special competition entries.

So to sum up…
I need $800 to fund the costs of printing;
* copies of Chapter 4 
* copies of Volume 1

-       All 4 chapters
-       Bonus Comic short
-       Bonus Art
* copies of Bullets and Sugar-cubes: the Art of Butterscotch.
-       Concept Art
-       Character Art and processes
-       How it all began
-       Page process – tutorial
-       Fan art expose

Some Stats:
Chapter 4 –

  • 24 pages
  • A5 size - approx.  8.3 x 5.8 in
  • Black and white

Volume 1 –

  • 80+ pages
  • A5 size – approx.  8.3 x 5.8 in
  • Black and white

Bullets and Sugar-cubes: The Art of Butterscotch

  • 60+ pages
  • A4 size – approx. 11.7 x 8.3 in
  • Full Colour

Sounds great! How about some pretties!

For those who are unfamiliar with my work, here’s some images from Butterscotch, as well as some other random images of mine.

 

Let’s talk Perks!

A special page will be featured in both Volume 1 and the Art Book of all the names of everyone who contributed, as my way of saying thank you. As for the perks themselves, there is a range of awesome gifts from copies of the chapters to commissions to specially made merchandise just for you guys.

$1 – Simply Tea
a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume – because every dollar counts

$8 - Camomile
Signed Copy of Chapter 1 and 2, Butterscotch sticker sheet and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

$15 - Jasmine
Signed Copy of Volume 1, 4x Butter-Badges and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

$15 – Green Tea
Signed Copy of Bullets & Sugar-Cubes: The Art of Butterscotch, 4x Butter-Badges 1 and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

$30 - Lady Grey
x2 A4/11.7x8.3inch exclusive signed Butterscotch Prints, Signed Copy of Bullets & Sugar-Cubes: The Art of Butterscotch, Signed Copy of Volume 1 and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

$50- Darjeeling
Special A5/8.3x5.8inch inked bust commission (of your choice), x2 A4/11.7x8.3inch exclusive signed Butterscotch Prints, Signed Copy of Bullets & Sugar-Cubes: The Art of Butterscotch, Signed Copy of Volume 1 and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

$70 – Earl Grey
Special A4/11.7x8.3inch inked and toned full body commission (of your choice), 4x Butter-Badges ,x2 A4/11.7x8.3inch exclusive signed Butterscotch Prints, Signed Copy of Bullets & Sugar-Cubes: The Art of Butterscotch, Signed Copy of Volume 1 and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

$100 – Pure Ceylon
Special A4/11.7x8.3inch full colour full body commission (of your choice), 4x Butter-Badges and 2x Keyrings,  x2 A4/11.7x8.3inch exclusive signed Butterscotch Prints, Signed Copy of Bullets & Sugar-Cubes: The Art of Butterscotch, Signed Copy of Volume 1 and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

$150 – The BIG Cuppa!
Butterscotch Merch Pack – 4x badges, Stickers, 2x key-rings, x8 A6 postcard prints of all the C.O.O.K Lineup, recipe card pack.
Special A4/11.7x8.3inch full colour full body commission (of your choice),x2 A4/11.7x8.3inch exclusive signed Butterscotch Prints, Signed Copy of Bullets & Sugar-Cubes: The Art of Butterscotch, Signed Copy of Volume 1 and a guaranteed thank you in the art book and Volume

Other ways to help?

Tweeting, facebooking, blogging, any kind of plugging on your social networks would be awesome!

story:
THANK YOU ALL OF OUR FUNDERS!

We are now shooting for our stretch goal of $7,000 to add an Android version to the mix!

With your help we can make the remaining $2,000 it'll cost to bring Comic Rocket's reading experience to Android devices such as phones and tablets. 

COMIC ROCKET

Comic Rocket aims to be the ultimate list of comics and serial material on the Web.  We create a seamless reading experience with our webcomic navigation tools, and help you find new comics with our recommendation system. 

Comic Rocket lists over 10,000 comics, and new comics are added daily. Our personalized recommendation system gives readers a chance to explore new comics, resulting in increased traffic to comic creators. In fact, to date Comic Rocket users have read over 2 million pages and counting and we've been steadily gaining titles and readers. Every day creators are contacting us to take ownership of their comic's Info Page. We're actively engaged in webcomics discussions on twitter and Facebook. In short, we're an up and coming company in the middle of a vibrant creative community. 

WHAT WE'RE FUNDING

In response to demand from our users it's time for us to create a free mobile application. This means we need to hire a mobile developer. But Comic Rocket has limited resources. So, in the spirit of the webcomics readers and creators we serve we're launching a crowd-funded campaign to pay for the project. 

The Comic Rocket iOS app will provide a comics reading experience optimized for iPads and iPhones.  It will include all the great features of the current website, like your personal comics reading list and the ability to follow your friends' comic discoveries.  The iOS app will also provide new features like comic update notifications and a user interface streamlined for tablets and phones with swipe and more!  Just think of sitting on your couch, seamlessly reading all your comics on your tablet or smartphone!

We have some great stretch goals planned too starting with versions for Android, the Microsoft Surface tablet, and also Kindle or The Nook and maybe even XBox! 

WHAT BACKERS GET

Let's not forget the perks. Our friends in comics have overwhelmed us with some amazing incentives to give to our donors. We've got a digipak of wallpapers, pin-ups, and other digital art. There's also three one month trials of Andy Schmidt's Comics Experience. For creative types, there are even downloads of software from Smith Micro like Anime Studio, Manga Studio, and Poser! 

CONCLUSION

So, here we are now: Seeking your help. And your friends' help. And hopefully their friends too. In fact, anyone that reads comics online should want to get in on this. Tell everyone you know that likes comics and let's make this happen!

story:
• Hi! I'm Meg McIntire, an indie comic artist from sunny San Diego. I've written and drawn two comics so far. (One mini compilation and one full length!) and It's what I love! They're called BUTTER comics. I've been at it for 3 years now and I won't stop any time soon.
  • The punk legends from here in SD wanted me to collab with them to bring out a special comic all about their story. It's going to be hilarious and for anyone who enjoys music and silly art styles!
  • All contributions of any size is greatly appreciated! You're helping a small comic company get bigger and better with your help! I'm a broke student so all of this means A LOT to me! Contributions mean a personal prize for you as well!


What We Need & What You Get


  • I need $500 to reach my goal of getting this comic off to the print man.
  • With a $5 donation you get your name inside the credits of The Zeros comic! with a $10 donation you get that, and also a copy of the comic to keep mailed to you. and for $20 you get The Zeros and also BUTTER Vol. 1/2 for a $40 donation you get a black and white BUTTER drawing for $50 or more - a custom portrait drawing of whoever you want! (I've done kids, cats, couples, david bowie, etc)
  • any and all funds go toward the comic. less money means less copies.

The Impact


  • This project is full of creativity and important to keep indie comics going strong!
  • I successfully raised $537 dollars with my last kick starter for my full length comic!
  • More than just making money for the printing process, i'd like to have goals and make more art for more people that care about comics and cartoon art. I can't wait for this project to take off! I hope to even make new friends through this opportunity.

Risks & Challenges

  • This won't be my first day on the job, but Help is always nice! Having the proper funds is a HUGE help in getting a comic done. My last one was drawn for 2 years before I could get it out to a printer finally.
  • I plan to make great art for those who donate, to give back for such kindness!

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • If you can't donate, it's understandable! If you're interested in being a big help to a small comic company - share the campaign on facebook and tell your comic loving friends to check it out!
