story:
Summary

I've been satirising the Scottish independence debate with weekly comic strips since 2012. Now I've gathered these strips together to form the basis of a limited edition book. It's the publishing event of the decade for tubas, and promises to become a historically significant record of the build-up to September's referendum, albeit one written by a complete maniac.

For One Month Only

'Greg Moodie Versus The Union' is a 144-page, full colour toon-fest in an A4 format, with a gloss laminated soft cover and matt coated paper within. Each copy will be signed and numbered, and availability is limited to the month of August. It has a foreword by Scotland On Sunday's Kenny Farquharson but this shouldn't necessarily deter you.

You'll find plenty of fluffy bunnies, nipple clamps, hot tuba action, cardboard cutout Scottish Secretaries, omnisexual nosferatu chancellors, cones for independence, and a man playing the spoons on William Hague's head. In other words, all your favourites, you twisted people. (See gallery images.)

There are four levels of perks. The Bunny-Lite is the downloadable book in pdf form. The Main Moodie is the signed and numbered first edition. The Tubatastic is the signed, numbered first edition along with five exclusive, signed A4 art prints. The Full Moodie is the signed, numbered first edition, the art prints, plus the Greg Moodie Badge Collection.

What Is Needed

The book will be printed in Scotland by Bell & Bain Ltd (who also produced National Collective's Inspired By Independence). Funds of £7000 are needed to cover this cost, along with sturdy packaging and first class postage for each copy.

In Summary

The Scottish independence referendum is a unique event and so too is the publication of this book. What they have in common besides subject matter is that both could only happen now. This is the story of the run-up to the former, as told by a non-party grassroots Yes supporter with just a pen and tablet and a long history of personal eccentricity.

The National Library of Scotland has formally requested a copy for preservation even before its birth, and the signed first edition has 'cult collector's item' written all over it, but not literally. Don’t miss this chance to own a wacky little piece of contemporary Scottish history.

"A great contribution to the debate and to Scotland. Brilliant stuff." Elaine C. Smith

Other Ways You Can Help

I know you're all busy trying on tanktops from the new autumn collections, but as this event is to be confined within the covers of August, I'd appreciate if you could help spread the word - on Facebook, Twitter and maybe some of those other ones.
story_txt:
Summary I've been
satirising the Scottish independence debate with weekly comic strips since 2012. Now I've gathered these strips together to form the basis of a limited edition book. It's the publishing event of the decade for tubas, and promises to become a historically significant record of the build-up to September's referendum, albeit one written by a complete maniac. 
  For One Month Only
'Greg Moodie Versus The Union' is a 144-page, full colour toon-fest in an A4 format, with a gloss laminated soft cover and matt coated paper within. Each copy will be signed and numbered, and availability is limited to the month of August. It has a foreword by Scotland On Sunday's Kenny Farquharson but this shouldn't necessarily deter you. You'll find plenty of fluffy bunnies, nipple clamps, hot tuba action, cardboard cutout Scottish Secretaries, omnisexual nosferatu chancellors, cones for independence, and a man playing the spoons on William Hague's head. In other words, all your favourites, you twisted people. (See gallery images.)There are four levels of perks. The Bunny-Lite is the downloadable book in pdf form. The Main Moodie is the signed and numbered first edition. The Tubatastic is the signed, numbered first edition along with five exclusive, signed A4 art prints. The Full Moodie is the signed, numbered first edition, the art prints, plus the Greg Moodie Badge Collection.What Is NeededThe book will be printed in Scotland by Bell & Bain Ltd (who also produced National Collective's Inspired By Independence). Funds of £7000 are needed to cover this cost, along with sturdy packaging and first class postage for each copy. In Summary


The Scottish independence referendum is a unique event and so too is the publication of this book. What they have in common besides subject matter is that both could only happen now. This is the story of the run-up to the former, 
as told by a non-party grassroots Yes supporter with just a pen and tablet and a long history of personal eccentricity. 
The National Library of Scotland has formally requested a copy for preservation even before its birth, and the signed first edition has 'cult collector's item' written all over it, but not literally. Don’t miss this chance to own a wacky little piece of contemporary Scottish history. 
"A great contribution to the debate and to
Scotland. Brilliant stuff." Elaine C. Smith
 Other Ways You Can Help I know you're all busy trying on tanktops from the new autumn collections, but as this event is to be confined within the covers of August, I'd appreciate if you could help spread the word - on Facebook, Twitter and maybe some of those other ones.

story:
We have recently funded The Wardenclyffe Horror in a successful Kickstarter campaign. So why are we here? The search for more money and profit?

Not exactly. My partner and I want to take this product to a comic con or two next year. Our crowd funding efforts to date will pay for most of the costs related to hiring an artist and getting it printed, but they will stretch no further. Worse - this project will still tie up most of our spare financial resources for the forseeable future. So if we really want to get the word out, we're going to need your help!

We know your help doesn't come cheap, though. Fortunately we have a pretty cool reward to offer: The Wardenclyffe Horror! 

The Wardenclyffe Horror is a 92 page graphic novel set in New York, 1908, a (mostly) unremarkable year. It follows Nikola Tesla and Mark Twain through the events of a horror story that explores what happens when fringe science goes horribly awry.

Want to know more? See for yourself (click on each picture for a larger version):

The story is finished, the script written, and the funding secured. The artists have been found, contracted, and even now are making progress toward the end goal at four or five pages a week. Sometime before the end of April, the art will be complete and we'll be off to the printers; a few weeks after that, they will arrive on our doorstep, and we will start sending them out to you, our loyal supporters. 

Then we're (hopefully) off to one or more comic cons!

Want to buy more copies?

  • If you are pledged at the $24 level and above, you can buy additional copies for $18. 
  • If you are pledged at any level that grants you an art print, you can get an additional art print for $5. 

There are worse problems to have. Money in excess of our goal will go to improve the rewards, and extend our reach. 

We have several goals in mind for the following levels of funding: 

At $500, I will attend the Denver Comic Con.

At $1000, my partner will attend a Con in the bay area. 

At $2000, I will commision a special print of Wardenclyffe Tower for all of our great Indiegogo supporters who pledge at least $30. 

At $3000, we will both also attend the San Diego Comic Con. 

At $5000, I will attend each of the above Conventions dressed as Nikola Tesla. 

Christopher Avery is a practicing anthropologist working in the fields of design and technology. In his spare time he writes comics and speculative fiction. He does most of his writing on trains, where he spends an inordinate amount of time. 

David Winchester writes creatively in his spare time, but pays his bills by working with wind turbines. He loves his day job, but would love to see more of his projects shared with like minded strangers. 

Robert Rath is an illustrator-designer-author-art director-dog walker living in Montana. He's illustrated many children's books and graphic novels. A few have even won awards. Previous clients include Lucasfilm, The History Channel, Scholastic Books, Pelican Press, Toys R Us, and many others. 

Want to contact us? try our Blog, follow us on twitter @caffeineforge,  or us our email!

story:
Short Summary

We previously did a short fundraiser that brought in a portion of what we needed.  Now with the sketchbook in house and the final bill from the printer we are hoping to raise the remaining funds needed to pay for printing/shipping the book.

Who is Steve Rude?

For those of you who don't know Steve, his career began in 1981 with his and co-creator Mike Baron’s groundbreaking “Nexus” comic series. This space saga catapulted Rude into the field of comics, where he became highly sought after by major publishers. During his first few years in the industry, Steve’s efforts led to numerous awards, such as the 1984 Russ Manning Newcomer Award, the Kirby Award for best artist in 1986, and numerous Eisner’s for artistic achievement. For over two decade Steve has drawn hundreds of comic’s greatest iconic heroes, and has galvanized the art world as a comic magazine artist and illustrator.

Don't forget to click that Facebook "like" button above and help us spread the word about Steve's book. Thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of printing and shipping the sketchbook inside the US is $6,500. 

We did a limited print run of 500 sketchbooks. Unlike previous years, this one is in full color allowing Steve to feature color commissions and paintings.  It also includes pages directly from his much sought after sketchbooks.

WE WILL BE SIGNING/NUMBERING THE SKETCHBOOK

Any funds exceeding the $6,500 needed for the book will go towards funding more new Nexus books and creating more fantastic art for the next annual sketchbook!

Specs on the book:

  • Sketchbook 72 + cover 
  • cover 100# gloss cover- full color
  • inside 80# matte text - full color
  • size: 8.5x11
  • saddle stitched
  • limited printing of 500
  • all books will be signed/numbered

International Orders – Please see perk for amount to add for shipping.


Previous Sketchbooks:

We are offering 3 prints.  All 8x10 and signed by Steve.

Artist in Motion book - This book weighs 5 pounds!  For International orders, unfortunately, that means it does not qualify for first class shipping and must be shipped USPS PRIORITY which runs around $40 for most countries.

All orders will be processed throgh our online store to ensure order accuracy.  Sketchbooks are in house and should ship within a few business days, next day once we catch up on presale orders.

Once we reach our goal we will be doing random drawings for prints, past sketchbooks, comic books, original art, and more!

story:
UPDATE

6 days to go and we've made 2% of our target. I think it's safe to assume that we won't hit 100%, but it's far from over for the Outback Ninja. The first book will release soon and there will be more, but without some money to back us up it's going to take a longer time to make each issue.

If you referred your friends to this page I thank you from the bottom of my heart, maybe even the bottom of my liver, possibly my balls but I wouldn't go any lower than that. Keep supporting the book and it'll keep getting new issues.

Thanks again,

Aaron Ross 

What's All This About?

Hello, my name is Aaron Ross and I am the creator, artist and writer of Outback Ninja, a violent but funny comic book from Australia. 

For years I've wanted to put out a book but it's taken me 28 human earth years to actually get it done. This campaign is all about helping me achieve my dream. All contributions will go towards releasing the first book - which apparently isn't cheap, who'd have known!? - and will also go towards making and distributing future issues of Outback Ninja.

At the moment there is a 6 book arc planned out for Outback Ninja but who knows what could come of the character in the future if things go well.

What's In It For Me? (Meaning You, the reader)

If we reach our goal you'll get to read a kick-ass book - not "Kick-Ass" the crime fighter, he already has a comic of his own, but in the general way that kick-ass could be used before that guy existed - but you'll also help breath life into a new Australian comic book hero. We don't have a huge comic book creation culture here in Oz and there's not many comics that take place here, so I wanted to make a book that is unique to us. Yeah, there's a ninja, but he's wearing an Akubra... So take that! 

Look to the right to see the full list of perks for contributors, needless to say, there's some cool stuff to be found in contributing to the cause. If you're still not convinced, head to the gallery for an 11 page preview of the first issue.

Other Ways You Can Help (Meaning You, the reader)

You can still contribute even if you don't want to give us any of your monies. You could share this campaign with your friends, like our facebook page or even just share the Outback Ninja website. You could also download the Preview book and share that with your friends to get them interested.

story:
Join Asylum Ink in spreading horror from coast to coast!

Asylum Ink is a young horror magazine that aims to bring entertainment you won’t find anywhere else to lovers of the genre everywhere. Our goal is to raise enough money to produce 5000 CD’s which will contain all issues of Asylum Ink Magazine and our comic book series Ellium. Once created, these CD’s will be distributed for free at comic book shows and other local venues spreading the horrifying art, stories, hand crafted items, and other devious goodies to people that normally may not consider giving this frighteningly beautiful genre a chance.

The creators of this crazy venture are Jason and Stacy Moser. Having experience publishing in print and digital mediums, we have a combined experience of over 15 years and we’re devoting all our efforts to this project. We love horror and we believe we’ve created a totally unique magazine experience, we just need to build awareness and with your help, we can make this dream a reality.

Now to the rewards!

REWARD 1: It's how we'll show our love!

REWARD 2 (+1): Reading material and a face-lift for your CPU! Awesome!

REWARD 3 (+1 through 2): Oh yeah, this will keep you busy for a while!

REWARD 4 (+1 through 3): So you need more terrifying eye candy. short stories and other horror?  Can do!

REWARD 5 (+1 through 4): Pretty pretty pictures signed by the artist and hand crafted necklaces to wear your screams and be proud!

REWARD 6 (+1 through 5): Did we just overload your computer with all this visual joy? 

REWARD 7 (+1 through 6: They ask how we can give such delicious rewards. All you need to know, is that they indeed are delicious...

REWARD 8 (+1 through 7): A beautiful example of individual creativity, excellent production quality, and a signature for bragging rights!

REWARD 9 (+1 through 7): It's finally come to this... the zombie invasion we all feared, and you get a commemorative illustration of the event!  Hope you survive to brag about it...

REWARD 10 (+1 through 7): If flesh eating zombies are too intense, wear your screams with pride in a different way!

Join us on this adventure to bring horror to the masses!  The more donations we receive the greater the distribution, so please don't hold back!

Much love from the Asylum!

story:
THE STORY

The year is 1895...An evil from a parallel dimension escaped and now roams the city of Boston. Faced with a new century and new steam technology, the social and political status quo is turned on its head. People are uncomfortable with change and, in fact, many people fear it. That fear and the violence which follows causes a psychic rift to puncture the veil of space and time allowing the entity known as "The Shifter" to escape. Feeding on the resentment and fear between the rich and poor, “The Shifter” triggers a rash of murders.

Four of the greatest minds of the time have banded together to try and stop this malevolent entity. Known only as B.E.T.H., they are:

THEY FAIL.

Against their better judgment, they look to a man driven by revenge – SAMUEL HUNTER.

 For the one mistake "The Shifter" made was killing Samuel’s wife.

An ex-Pinkerton detective, Samuel gathers his unlikely team of…

Caitlin O'Sullivan, Medium and Spirit Photographer:

 and Granville Woods, Scientist Extraordinaire:

 

They are the Boston Metaphysical Society.

Their job: Stop "The Shifter" before Boston tears itself apart.

COVER OF THE TRADE.

COVER ART BY EMILY HU. COLOR AND INKING BY GLORIA CAELI.

 

WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?

I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a BRAND NEW Boston Metaphysical Society ten page short story called, Hunter-Killer, and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship. I will be introducing three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain; Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.

And for what the story is about, well I have two words for you - Airship Battle!

The complete story of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.

Here's a teaser for you.

 

 

Samples Pages From Chapters 3,4 and 6.

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is written by Madeleine Holly-Rosing and illustrated by Emily Hu.

THE MONEY:

Where the money goes...Your backing would enable us to pay for a print run of the trade paperback which means printing enough copies to send off to backers with some leftover to sell at conventions, incentives, shipping (which includes mailing envelopes, postage and handling.) And, of course, the fees (5% off the top, plus credit card fees.)

THE TEAM:

Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A TV, feature film, and comic book writer, Madeleine holds an MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories and novellas based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Formerly a nationally ranked epee fencer, she has competed nationally and internationally. She is an avid reader of science fiction, steampunk, fantasy and historical military fiction.

Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky Cloonan, and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for BOOM! BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series.

Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre related books.

Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist. He worked as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to his work on he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work includes Bob Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.

Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist Christopher Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT bestselling anthology series.

Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6): Troy is a Los Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series for Radical Comics.

WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY ABOUT BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY:

"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling, Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)

"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)

"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them." - Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)

Nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 GEEKIE AWARDS.

 

The Story Behind The Story

I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY. Not only does it bring my love of science fiction and history together, (which by the way, equals steampunk), the steampunk time period allows me to address the themes of classism, sexism, and racism in America in a thoughtful and entertaining way. For at it's very core, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American story. And you can't tell an American story without including women and people of color.

It has been and always will be important to me to write characters who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different points of view, are able to work together for the common good.

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY began as a TV Pilot which I wrote while I was in the MFA Program in Screenwriting at UCLA. It was somewhat inspired by a script I had written called Stargazer, which was about a real life astronomer who lived in Boston in the late 1880's. (Stargazer went on to win the Sloan Fellowship.) It was suggested that I adapt Boston Metaphysical into a six issue graphic novel mini-series. I agreed and the hunt was on for an artist. Many months later, I met Emily Hu through a mutual friend and a partnership was born. Her passion for the project matched my own and I knew the story was in good hands. I launched BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY as a webcomic in May of 2012. The following year we printed a special edition of the first chapter.

Through a combination of self-funding and the generous support of Kickstarter backers like you, we were able to finish the six issue series and now we are back to print this expanded version of the trade.

However by wading into the deep end of the pool, I discovered a terrible truth – I love writing comics.

So I bring you Samuel, Caitlin, and Granville who represent the best, the worst, and every shade of gray of the society in which they live. They are products of their world yet strive for not only more, but better.

Much like you and I.

By backing this project, you would not only be supporting the printing of the trade paperback, but a vision of a future where the teamwork and sacrifice of a diverse group of individuals ultimately defeats evil.

INCENTIVES

In addition to the 156 page trade paperback which includes a brand new ten page story, we have a BRAND NEW bookmark, the anthology, Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude, scripts of the new ten page story (pdf and in hardcopy), plus a NEW LAPEL PIN with Caitlin's box camera. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique gold color. (See image below.)

 

Sample Image from Proof - Pin will be ordered after the campaign is funded.

(A big thank you to Bill Meahan for handling the technical aspects of designing the pin.)

Lapel Pin Set

And for the first time, we will be offering a reward tier which includes the set of all three Boston Metaphysical pins (Dirigible, Tesla, and the 1800's Box Camera) in a lovely gift box with our logo.

Image is for demonstration only. The set will include the following pins: Dirigible, Nikola Tesla, 1800's Box Camera. (Box Camera Pin will be ordered once the campaign is funded.)

And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society:Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers include it as either a pdf or print version.

 

Risks & Challenges

The trade is currently with my pre-press guy so it will be ready to go to the printer by the end of the campaign.

I have also successfully delivered all of the rewards from our previous crowdfunding campaigns and managed seven successful print runs of the comic (Chapter One Special Edition, Chapter 1 - 24 page edition, Chapter 2 - 24 page edition, Chapter 3 – 28 page edition, Chapter 4 – 24 page edition and Chapter 5 - 24 page edition, Chapter 6 - 24 page edition). I have also been handling fulfillment through my own website store for over four years. I do not anticipate any problems. However, if there are any shipping delays or hiccups with the printer, you'll be the first to know.
story_txt:
THE STORY
The year is 1895...An evil from a parallel dimension escaped and now roams the city of Boston. Faced with a new century and new steam technology, the social and political status quo is turned on its head. People are uncomfortable with change and, in fact, many people fear it. That fear and the violence which follows causes a psychic rift to puncture the veil of space and time allowing the entity known as "The Shifter" to escape. Feeding on the resentment and fear between the rich and poor, “The Shifter” triggers a rash of murders.
Four of the greatest minds of the time have banded together to try and stop this malevolent entity. Known only as B.E.T.H., they are:

THEY FAIL.
Against their better judgment, they look to a man driven by revenge – SAMUEL HUNTER.


 For the one mistake "The Shifter" made was killing Samuel’s wife.
An ex-Pinkerton detective, Samuel gathers his unlikely team of…
Caitlin O'Sullivan, Medium and Spirit Photographer:

 and Granville Woods, Scientist Extraordinaire:

 
They are the Boston Metaphysical Society.
Their job: Stop "The Shifter" before Boston tears itself apart.
COVER OF THE TRADE.
COVER ART BY EMILY HU. COLOR AND INKING BY GLORIA CAELI.

 
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a BRAND NEW Boston Metaphysical Society ten page short story called, Hunter-Killer, and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship. I will be introducing three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain; Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
And for what the story is about, well I have two words for you - Airship Battle!
The complete story of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.
Here's a teaser for you.
 


 
Samples Pages From Chapters 3,4 and 6.




BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is written by Madeleine Holly-Rosing and illustrated by Emily Hu.
THE MONEY:
Where the money goes...Your backing would enable us to pay for a print run of the trade paperback which means printing enough copies to send off to backers with some leftover to sell at conventions, incentives, shipping (which includes mailing envelopes, postage and handling.) And, of course, the fees (5% off the top, plus credit card fees.)
THE TEAM:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A TV, feature film, and comic book writer, Madeleine holds an MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories and novellas based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Formerly a nationally ranked epee fencer, she has competed nationally and internationally. She is an avid reader of science fiction, steampunk, fantasy and historical military fiction.
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky Cloonan, and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for BOOM! BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist. He worked as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to his work on he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work includes Bob Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist Christopher Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT bestselling anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6): Troy is a Los Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series for Radical Comics.
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY ABOUT BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY:
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling, Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them." - Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
Nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 GEEKIE AWARDS.

 
The Story Behind The Story
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY. Not only does it bring my love of science fiction and history together, (which by the way, equals steampunk), the steampunk time period allows me to address the themes of classism, sexism, and racism in America in a thoughtful and entertaining way. For at it's very core, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American story. And you can't tell an American story without including women and people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different points of view, are able to work together for the common good.
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY began as a TV Pilot which I wrote while I was in the MFA Program in Screenwriting at UCLA. It was somewhat inspired by a script I had written called Stargazer, which was about a real life astronomer who lived in Boston in the late 1880's. (Stargazer went on to win the Sloan Fellowship.) It was suggested that I adapt Boston Metaphysical into a six issue graphic novel mini-series. I agreed and the hunt was on for an artist. Many months later, I met Emily Hu through a mutual friend and a partnership was born. Her passion for the project matched my own and I knew the story was in good hands. I launched BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY as a webcomic in May of 2012. The following year we printed a special edition of the first chapter.
Through a combination of self-funding and the generous support of Kickstarter backers like you, we were able to finish the six issue series and now we are back to print this expanded version of the trade.
However by wading into the deep end of the pool, I discovered a terrible truth – I love writing comics.
So I bring you Samuel, Caitlin, and Granville who represent the best, the worst, and every shade of gray of the society in which they live. They are products of their world yet strive for not only more, but better.
Much like you and I.
By backing this project, you would not only be supporting the printing of the trade paperback, but a vision of a future where the teamwork and sacrifice of a diverse group of individuals ultimately defeats evil.
INCENTIVES
In addition to the 156 page trade paperback which includes a brand new ten page story, we have a BRAND NEW bookmark, the anthology, Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude, scripts of the new ten page story (pdf and in hardcopy), plus a NEW LAPEL PIN with Caitlin's box camera. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique gold color. (See image below.)

 
Sample Image from Proof - Pin will be ordered after the campaign is funded.
(A big thank you to Bill Meahan for handling the technical aspects of designing the pin.)
Lapel Pin Set
And for the first time, we will be offering a reward tier which includes the set of all three Boston Metaphysical pins (Dirigible, Tesla, and the 1800's Box Camera) in a lovely gift box with our logo.

Image is for demonstration only. The set will include the following pins: Dirigible, Nikola Tesla, 1800's Box Camera. (Box Camera Pin will be ordered once the campaign is funded.)
And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society:Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers include it as either a pdf or print version.

 
Risks & Challenges
The trade is currently with my pre-press guy so it will be ready to go to the printer by the end of the campaign.I have also successfully delivered all of the rewards from our previous crowdfunding campaigns and managed seven successful print runs of the comic (Chapter One Special Edition, Chapter 1 - 24 page edition, Chapter 2 - 24 page edition, Chapter 3 – 28 page edition, Chapter 4 – 24 page edition and Chapter 5 - 24 page edition, Chapter 6 - 24 page edition). I have also been handling fulfillment through my own website store for over four years. I do not anticipate any problems. However, if there are any shipping delays or hiccups with the printer, you'll be the first to know.

story:
Written and Created by Kevin Chilcoat

 

Illustrated/Inked/Colored/Lettered (everything else): Marc Olivent

 

Video Music by: http://www.bensound.com

 

I apologize for the limited information in the video for this campaign.  All information about this project is below.  

 

*Before I get into everything about the book and myself, I just want to say that this comic book turned out as well as it did because of Marc Olivent, whom I was fortunate enough to cross paths with.  He took the script and made creative choices to make each page and panel look phenomenal.  I’m in Maryland and he’s in the UK and putting this book together and collaborating was an extremely enjoyable and beneficial experience. The man is a true professional and you should look up his work the first chance you get.

*On to the introductions!  My name is Kevin Chilcoat and this is my very first Indiegogo campaign for a comic book that I’ve written Knight In The Snake Pit.  I’m going to give all of you a brief overview of my background and experience of what has compelled me to write this series.

 

*For starters, I have a film background.  My brother and I co-own a video production company who until recently have been on a bit of a hiatus.  We never made feature films, even though that was/is our dream, but we did successfully make a living for a little while doing corporate videos and live event production.  That’s a long story as short as I can put it.  I can say that writing a screenplay and writing a script for a comic book are extremely similar, so creating a comic book ends up being a lot less costly than making movies and you still get to tell your story.  The way this first issue is written is as if it was a pilot episode for a TV series.

 

*I have to be somewhat vague about the Knight In The Snake Pit story, as this first issue is only 22 pages.  I can assure you that a lot went into these 22 pages and it’s taken me a few months to even get here.  This has been a concept that I’ve been toying around with for some time and what this story does is mashes up two pretty different genres. 

 

*The first is a story set in a mental asylum with a similar setting to Shutter Island.  The year is 1947 and these sorts of hospitals are overcrowded and understaffed.  The conditions are poor and the lobotomy is a treatment that has really become the “go to” for certain patients.  Our main character, Allister Ward, awakens from his latest treatment, which is Deep Sleep Therapy, where’s he’s been in and out of comas for an extended period of time.  This therapy has led to him awakening with no memory of who he is or anything about why he has come to be a patient at this asylum.  At this point, all he has are the words of the doctors, who are telling him that in the past, he’s had delusions of another world that he and he alone travels to where there’s a kingdom in peril and a princess that needs to be rescued.   None of this seems to make any sense to Allister until he starts to experience these delusions firsthand.  Allister must now determine what’s real and discover how he’s ended up in this hospital when he’s one false move from receiving a lobotomy.

 

*This is the second comic book I’ve ever written.  The first one is titled Run For Your Lives, which was a comic book that was created for a 5k Run Event with the same name where participants are being chased by zombies.  The way the event worked was each participant had a flag belt, which resembled their health.  They would run on a zombie infested obstacle course and if they made it from the start to the finish line with any of their flags in tact, then they survived the zombie apocalypse. 

 

-The way I wrote and approached the Run For Your Lives comic book, which was brilliantly illustrated by Kyle Strahm, was I took aspects of the event and the zombie genre itself and created an origin story for the tournament.  This book shows the world ending via the zombie apocalypse and when all hope is lost, there was a billion dollar corporation who built safe havens, scattered across the United States, as a Noah’s Ark, so humanity had a chance to start over again.  When outsiders unsuccessfully try to invade these safe havens for their resources, the founder creates a tournament for new admittances to participate in to prove their worth and loyalty.  This tournament is the “Run For Your Lives” tournament, where participants have to make it from the start to finish line and not be torn to shreds in the process.  If the participants survived the tournament, then they’re admitted in the community and celebrated for their bravery.  If they don’t make it, then they just end up being additional zombies on the course.

 

-Issue #1 of Run For Your Lives was created as an origin story and along with that, I’ve written an entire script to either create a comic book series or a feature length film.  Depending on how this campaign goes and sort of response I receive, I may make one to fund the creation of the Run For Your Lives series.  This origin issue was sold at the events that went on nationwide.  After the second year running, the company who ran the event went bankrupt, leaving me with a fair amount of these comic books.  What is great is that you can’t find these anywhere else so if you donate the $15 pledge and up, you can get your hands on a copy.

 

*The way that Knight In The Snake Pit #1 differs from Run For Your Lives #1 is that it is a story that introduces all of your key characters, there’s plenty of story and dialogue to go around and will (hopefully) leave you wanting more and to find out how everything unfolds.  Run For Your Lives plays out like a one-shot where it’s all origin and paints a world where a story can take place, but there’s plenty of carnage to go around in those pages.

 

*When Issue #1 of Knight In The Snake Pit gets printed, it’ll be great to see the response and to either keep making them independently, or try to contact publishers to see about picking it up as a series.  That is the bigger picture for this series, but that all starts here.

 

*As I state in the video, for everyone who donates money to this campaign, you will all be included in the Acknowledgements/Thank You section.  I’m not trying to toot this project’s horn or nuthin, but there really is only one opportunity to get your name in a comic book’s first print of the first issue.  In the slim chance that this book becomes the next big thing, you can say you were there from the start and tell your friends that you’re the true fan, while all others are posers. 

 

*INFLUENCES:  As I said below, part of this story, being set in a mental asylum, has themes similar to Shutter Island.  While there are other great movies/stories that have mental hospital settings, such as 12 Monkeys, Beautiful Mind and One Who Flew Over The Cuckoo’s Nest, I wanted to keep this closer to the era, but also try and go for a David Fincher vibe.  With the Fantasy element, story wise, there’s aspects of Game of Thrones (that’s popular, right?) and Army of Darkness with a sprinkle of Mario Brothers.

 

*IS IT FOR THE KIDS?  Nope.  However, if I were to compare this issue to a movie, I would say it’s a hard PG-13.  I say this because there are two “F” words that are used.  I believe that they are used very appropriately…you’ll see.  Also, and I know it’s rare this day in age, but I’ve definitely seen PG-13 movies with two “F” words.  I remember because I was like, “Whoa now, let me check the rating of this again!”  Later issues of this series like the next one for instance, could definitely dwell a little in the R territory.

story:
Elite covert agent Cyrin Ex steals dangerous beta software from the company who created her, and they want it back! When ruthless bounty hunter Ron Dell discovers the awful truth about CyberShock Systems, will he join Cyrin or kill her?

 

Creative Team

Written by: Aaron Calimeri - @aaroncalimeri

Drawn by: TZU - @Art_of_Tzu

Colored by: Simon SIM Pothier - @Simon_Pothier

Lettered by: David Vila

 

 

 


 

 

 


 


 

 

 

 

Physical Specs

28 pages
FULL COLOR
Saddle stitch binding
Premium Glossy Cover Stock
Premium Glossy Interior Pages
Cover is INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE!
THIS COVER WILL NEVER BE REPRINTED!

 

 

Stretch Goals

$3,000: 4 extra pages of story and action blended seamlessly into the comic to bring the total to 32 interior pages!

$5,000: pack of 4 character and vehicle trading cards!
Cyrin Ex
Ron Dell
Meghan Dekkr
Spider Tank Vehicle

 

Progress  (Updated February 15, 2020)

Script: COMPLETE

Cover: COMPLETE

Variant Cover: COMPLETE

Line Art: COMPLETE

Colors: COMPLETE (+ Covers)

Letters: COMPLETE

Free Trading Card (physical backers): COMPLETE

story:
My name is Dominic Riggio and I’m the owner of Mess Bucket Comics a self-published, award-winning, independent comic book company. My company has released The Arcane Awakening #1, #2, and #3 in the past. The Arcane Awakening is our super hero story.

 Today my friend Ryan Craig (co-writer) and I want to tell our hockey stories through the pages of our graphic novel called Donnybrook. Ryan and I have been compiling our stories for many years and formulated a concept. We want to preserve our experience of the excitement and madness of the hockey world with the release of Donnybrook.

Donnybrook is an honest and unfiltered glimpse into hockey culture that doesn’t pull punches or hold back -- much like the classic Paul Newman film Slap Shot. We hope to bring this glimpse of our great sport to a whole new generation of hockey fans. This is not a kids book, if you have young kids this would be a great gift and investment (comic books tend to increase in value) when they are old enough for adult humor.

The entire amount that we are asking for in this campaign goes toward our artists and the printing of the graphic novels.

We aren’t just asking for money… we are getting YOU involved in the actual story. In this campaign, not only can you get your name in the book, but we can use your image and likeness as a background or recurring character in the book! There are many more exciting reward opportunities as well.

Indiegogo wants to know what will happen “If we try but do not reach our goal”… Well, sorry, Ryan and I don’t think that way. If we take a shot on goal and it doesn’t go in, then we run the goalie and keep digging until we light the lamp. If the other team gets the sticks up, then we drop the mitts and start blowing up noses and losing chicklets. “Do or do not, there is no try.” Yoda said that and he was a master fighter. Stop chirping us Indiegogo, Craigy has the fist of God!

Mess Bucket Comics is very familiar with the Indie comic book route. Mess Bucket has been grinding on the Indie comic con circuit since 2012. Mess Bucket attended 26 comic cons in 2016 alone. Mess Bucket has not only attended cons but has been monetarily successful at every convention in its history. This is a tough road but a road that is necessary for success.

A big reason for this success is the artist for The Arcane Awakening #2 and #3 Keith Grachow. Keith is a well-established artist who has had a great career with success on the highest level (Disney and Play Along Toys) as well as the Indie level (The Arcane Awakening and Concrete Martians).

Keith Grachow and Mess Bucket Comics have a long history of success and plan on keeping that tradition going.

If we take a shot on goal and it doesn’t go in, then we run the goalie and keep digging until we light the lamp. If the other team gets the sticks up, then we drop the mitts and start blowing up noses and losing chicklets. “Do or do not, there is no try.” Yoda said that and he was a master fighter. Stop chirping us Indiegogo, Craigy has the fist of God!

Mess Bucket Comics is very familiar with the Indie comic book route. Mess Bucket has been grinding on the Indie comic con circuit since 2012. Mess Bucket attended 26 comic cons in 2016 alone. Mess Bucket has not only attended cons but has been monetarily successful at every convention in its history. This is a tough road but a road that is necessary for success.

A big reason for this success is the artist for The Arcane Awakening #2 and #3 Keith Grachow. Keith is a well-established artist who has had a great career with success on the highest level (Disney and Play Along Toys) as well as the Indie level (The Arcane Awakening and Concrete Martians).

Keith Grachow and Mess Bucket Comics have a long history of success and plan on keeping that tradition going.

story:
Short Summary

 

Welcome to the second round of IndieGoGo for our project! We got off to a rough start last year. Life seemed to beat us down at every turn. Between home issues, illness issues and financial problems, we nearly hung it up. But because of the generosity and the outpouring of help from our friends, families, and supporters we pressed on and have made it through! And before we go any further, we want to extend our deepest and sincerest apologies for the length of time it took us to ship out our perk orders last time. But they were all shipped and to our knowledge, all were received. We won't have that issue again!

But we are now headed into our first year of conventions and have two on tap already. We'll be headed to Derby City Comic Convention in Louisville, KY the weekend of June 20-21st and then headed to Cincinnati Comics Expo in September. But in order to make this year the best ever, we need your help!


What We Need & What You Get

 

We'll be frank. Print media is not a cheap venue to get into. In fact, the other day, someone asked us if we were making money yet. We jokingly told them that we were losing less money than when we started. The truth is that while we are making money with this project, it is barely enough to keep things moving forward. All three of our core members are working multiple "real jobs" to help keep this project afloat and still be able to pay our personal bills. But here's what we need and how you can help us get there:

Print Costs:

We realistically need about $1000 to be able to cover our print costs in any real volume. Why so much? Well, we did some shopping and have compared pricing for printing comics. At our level of distribution, it currently costs us $2.62 per issue to print our books. And when you sell them at $3.99 per issue, you can see where other sales are what really keep the project afloat. Now if we are ever able to start bolstering our printing runs and selling more copies, this cost will obviously fall per issue. But right now, this is where we stand.

Why Not Go Digital?:

We here at Project Reclamation fervently recognize the very real connection between a reader and a printed comic book. It creates a tangible, in-the-moment connection with the book and the story. Think about it. If you grab a brand new comic book from your local comics shop, a few things happen immediately. First, your sense of sight locks onto the new book because if the banner-head or the cover art. Then, your sense of touch gets involved when you pick that book up off of the shelf. Thumbing through those pages makes the book all the more real to you. Then the strongest of your senses, your sense of smell, kicks in. You get that whiff of freshly printed ink on paper and your brain homes in on that smell and commits it to memory. You can hear the pages turning as you read, and if you happen to be a thumb-licker (using your tongue to make your thumb tacky so you can turn pages easier), then you even taste a new comic book. So there you have it. Five reasons why Project Reclamation won't ever just settle for digital publishing. But make no mistake, we will have the books available in digital format on Kindle.

Swag:

We love our stories and the artists working for us are incredible and getting better every day. We have been able to contract some truly amazing artists to supplement what we are already doing. We were able to hire industry legend Bart Sears, newcomer Erik Reeves, local artist Tressina Bowling, and we were even able to contract a young and very talented artist from Argentina named Emiliano Correa.

But as we said before, the real money isn't made selling comic books alone, we would love to have even more ways to showcase their work than just the comics. That way we would have items with a higher profit margin that would allow us to continue printing the series and not worry so much about the price break per issue. We would be able to focus on good content and fantastic art and have some awesome items for our friends and fans as well!

 We would love to have some posters, stickers and even t-shirts to put at our tables at conventions and to make available through our  (hopefully) upcoming website. All in all, it will cost us about $200 to get what we need for our first convention.

Web:

This brings us to the idea that we need a dot com. In these times, it pays to have dedicated access to your products and services. We are looking to secure our domain name and start running a site where all fans and friends of the series can come to see what's cooking and what's coming up. We also want a place that we can call home. Facebook has been great, but it would be so much nicer to be able to have the functionality that we need and not just base our marketing around whatever is available at the moment. This will cost us about $300

 Travel Expenses:

With this new expansion, we have accrued a new financial burden. It's one that we gladly bear, but one we could definitely use help with. We have been fortunate to have made enough money to be able to cover the initial costs of entrance to the two conventions we are booked for so far. But now there's the costs of hotel rooms and food and travel costs for three guys and a ton of gear. This cost is tough to put a solid figure on but it's one that we hope will continue. We love doing conventions and are super-excited about finally hitting them with our own project.

 

The Impact:

 

Here is Project Rec in a nutshell. We are all fans of the comic book medium. We have collectively been reading comics much longer than the three of us care to disclose. But be that as it may, we have all noticed a saddening trend in comics these days. There is no hope. Comics have become very dark. And while we acknowledge that entertainment media changes with the times, we also know that the "real world" is dark enough. So even though our stories start out dark, there is always hope at the end. There is always a redemptive theme. That's our purpose for getting into comics...we want the world to know that no matter how black the night, the morning always comes.

 

Risks & Challenges

 Here are the major challenges we have hit so far:

- Creating a social media presence.

     - We are currently on Facebook, Twitter, Scope, Instagram, Tumblr, Google+ and LinkedIn and our following is growing every day.

     - We recently hit 15,000 views on Scope

     - We are just shy of 800 followers on Twitter

     - We are currently building our Tumblr and Instagram presence through art posts

     - We also joined the Indie Power Alliance, created by the team at New Worlds Comics and it provides a platform for indies and self-publishers to get their work out to a broad audience through cross-marketing with other indies along several  social media platforms.

     - We also received our first outside review this year and issues #0 and #1 were met with a solid review by geek-centric indie blogger, Savannah Baldwin of The Repressed Geek blog. Here's the link: http://therepressedgeek.com/?p=718

Increasing our reach:

     - We are currently working with a small indie publisher in Mexico City to get Reclamation translated into Spanish and to build up a fan base in Mexico, Moka B. Luna Perez and her friends at Collective Triforce have been assisting us with grass-roots, social media marketing in Mexico City and they are awesome!

     - We will also be releasing the Spanish version here in the states as well.

     - We also partnered with our local public library this year to host panels throughout the summer for kids to teach them how to create and make comic books. We were approached by a local comic store owner and told about the idea and we were happy and honored to be asked to be involved. We are truly looking forward to that experience.

Shipping Costs:

     - Apart from printing costs, shipping has been the other major expense.

     - Last year, we shipped comics and posters to Hungary, South Korea, Germany, Mexico, Honduras, England, Canada and Australia. We have shipped some to Argentina this year as well. So as you can see, Reclamation is quickly becoming international!

     - To surmount the costs of shipping internationally (since we have no intention of stopping), we have partnered with our local post office and have worked out shipping rates that are much more wallet-friendly and still guarantee safe, timely deliveries to our international friends and fans.

Expanding The Brand:

     - Last year, we offered inly Reclamation. But there were so many talented people working with us that we couldn't leave it at that. This year in June, we are releasing a one-shot book called Trinity. It will feature three short stories from Reclamation, Axios!, and Isaac & Ishtar.

     - Axios! - written by Travis Huber, Ryan Snelling and Phillip Wilson, with art by Matthew Walker is told from the perspective of demons sent to Earth to hone their skills. It chronicles the way they infect and torment souls in often subtle ways. It shows how demonic presences can come from anywhere, even disguising themselves as beings of light and good. It shows the ways that people can get twisted around by their wiles. But it also shows that there is hope for freedom from their oppression.

     - Isaac & Ishtar - Written By Travis Huber, with art by Tressina Bowling is a story about a soldier who dies in a desert conflict. But before his soul can cross over, he is confronted with a choice by an ancient spirit. Ishtar offers to return Isaac to life. But in return, he must offer his body to be her vessel so that she may once again walk among the living. Not wanting to die, he agrees. She enters him and he is resurrected. But all is not well. When Ishtar becomes bored with the mortal coil, she spices things up by fully taking over Isaac's body and wreaking havoc on the world of men. But once she releases her hold on Isaac after her tantrums, he is left with no memory of what happened, other than the devastation he now sees in front of him. 

     - Keeper of Secrets - A title currently in the works. But we're not giving you any details for this one. Let's just say that it continues where the events of the Reclamation series end after issue 12. We promise it's going to be something very cool and this project is very near and dear to all involved.

 

As you can see, we have gotten very accustomed to adversity and challenges. But no matter what, we are committed to getting our stories out there. We stay in communication with other indie publishers all over and collaborate with them on marketing strategies and ways to get our books out to the masses and garner help from wherever we can. It has been a long road, four years in fact since the beginning...but we are not giving up and we are most definitely not going away!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us out with money, we will never turn down a soul wanting to assist us on this incredible journey! In addition to monetary support, we need help with getting our name out there. A few minutes of your time a couple of days a week and posting our stuff out through your social media pages is always welcomed. Also, word of mouth is a powerful advertisement. In fact, if it hadn't been for the lip service of our friends, families and fans we would've never gotten this far! So please, even if you can't contribute funding, your time is equally as valuable!

story: Malkah Duprix and Michael King, two lovely and ardent fans of Denver's comedy scene, were recently burglarized while out being fucking cool and supportive at the recent High Plains Comedy Festival. If you know these two, you'd know that they give and give and give to this community and ask very little - if nothing at all - in return. Let's get together and see about getting them another 'pooter so they can keep doing what they do so well………which is of course allowing Malkah to like and comment on every single post in the greater metro area. Please donate a couple bucks and share if you can.

Please donate a couple bucks and share if you can.

story:
Tell me about the project?

We need local heroes (writers, illustrators and fans) to unite and use their powers (love) for comics and memorabilia to fund and launch Leamington’s first Comic Con.

Harnessing superhuman support of a community, we’ve aspirations to one day transform this humble starter project into a permanent Hulk-sized fixture.

Together we can bring something epic to Leamington!

Why is it important and who are you?

Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No it’s a plan to launch Leamington Spa’s first Comic Con!

Let’s face it, this project isn’t as important as World peace, but what comic enthusiast wouldn’t want to set up the first ever comic con in their home town?

I’m just a local lad and Transformers nerd with a pipedream, but by using the muscle of like-minded fans I hope to fund a Leamington legend, well its first Comic Con at least.

We’re not promising the Earth, they’ll be no large corporate sponsors.

We plan to deliver a small, but perfectly formed, intimate affair at a quirky venue where fans can engage with local and national comic writers, illustrators and traders.

What do you need and how can I help?

We don’t need Stark-sized funding, just oodles of small but super important donations, goodwill and the clout of word of mouth from enthusiasts to bring you a mighty offering.

This project will gratefully accept all donations however great or small, and in return for your generosity we have some great perks up for grabs.

We’re asking for just £1,500 to fund:

  • Leamington's first comic con
  • Venue hire, furniture
  • Q&A panel of writers and illustrators
  • Super hero/villain photo booth
  • 501st UK Garrison Star Wars Legion
  • Goodie bag for first 100 visitors
  • Live event podcasting
  • Promotional material

100% of profits will be used to grow future Leamington Comic Cons.

However, we don’t just need financial backing, spreading the word is just as important. Please follow, like and share our social media pages:

Twitter - @LeamComicCon
Facebook.com/LeamComicCon

What if you don’t hit your target?

If we don’t raise the full £1,500 all donations will be refunded.
